job_title: Lead Analyst, Production Scheduling and Supply Chain Business Systems
description: The Lead Business Analyst – Production Scheduling and Supply Chain Systems will provide functional and technical support for the Enterprise Business Systems team at Vertex, working primarily with the Bio-G platform and supporting business stakeholders in the Manufacturing business function. Major activities include collaborating with business partners to identify and prioritize areas for opportunity, gathering and refining requirements, determining options for solution design, delivering enhancements, integrations and contributing to technology-driven projects and initiatives.Key Responsibilities:Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their current and future state strategy, needs and requirements from a global perspectiveProactively offer solution ideas and potential business process improvements in pursuit of driving efficiencies and meeting business needsDevelop and document functional and technical aspects for integrations to the Bio-G platformDesign, perform and document system configurations within Bio-GPartner with offshore team members and GIS peers for platform and database support, as well as technical development for enhancements and projectsWork closely with GIS Compliance, Internal Audit and Quality Assurance groups as needed to ensure compliance with GxP regulations, as well as our GIS system lifecycle and change management requirementsMinimum Qualifications: - Deep experience with Production Scheduling applications - functional and technical ability with configurations, solutions and authoringDeep Experience with OPM Supply chain applicationsDemonstrated ability to translate business needs and functional requirements into technical or process-driven solutionsStrong communication, interpersonal and collaborative skillsSolid analytical and problem-solving abilitiesExperience in GxP environments and the relevant testing requirementsEducation and Preferred Experience:B.S. and 5+ years of relevant work experienceFunctional/Technical knowledge in supply chain planning and manufacturing conceptsBiotech or pharmaceutical industry and contract manufacturing experienceExperience working with SaaS solutions in the SCM and Production scheduling disciplinesExperience with systems integrations with the Oracle OPM platform#LI-JF1

POSITION: INFORMATION SECURITY ANALYST

Summary:

Report to the IT Security Manager and provide support to identify and remediate security threats and vulnerabilities as well as being involved in other aspects of networking and security. Assist in the management of key security reporting systems including patch, vulnerability, firewall, SIEM, NGAV, Active Directory monitoring, file data monitoring & classification software and audit log management programs. Also, assist in the development and maintenance of Information Technology compliance policies and procedures on existing and new systems.

Key Result Areas:

Investigate and respond to system alerts generated by firewall, IDS/IPS, NGAV, SIEM, Active Directory monitoring. Work with vendors as necessary to resolve issues
Provide support for the implementation of the Bank’s NGAV program including installing and troubleshooting client installs, reviewing weekly and monthly agent status and scan reports, responding to real-time alerts, and assisting with documentation
Assist with the implementation of the Bank’s security systems including review of logs and reports from various tools such as firewall, IDS/IPS, NGAV, SIEM and event log monitoring
Schedule internal and external vulnerability scans and provide investigation and remediation efforts. Additionally, provide follow-up documentation as required by department and risk procedures
Assist with the administration of security systems and asset inventory tool including collection and management of data and running reports as necessary
Assist with procedure development and documentation of various IT Security systems.
Provide IT security related end-user support
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with other employees, vendors and customers
Perform additional duties as required

Qualifications:

Associate degree in Information Security, Information Technology, or other subject matter area with a minimum of 3 years IT Security experience. IT Security / Cybersecurity certifications and Microsoft Certifications a plus
Experience with deployment, management and reporting of compliance and security systems including network-based patch management, firewall, IDS/IPS, vulnerability and security event log management systems
Understanding of PC and Local Area Network (LAN) technologies. 1 – 3 years of experience working with network management tools with a focus on security systems preferred.
Experience with Active directory and Windows server management from a compliance and vulnerability management perspective
Analytical skills with proven problem-solving ability is a must. Experience with threat hunting and/or anomaly investigations is a plus
Demonstrated extensive organizational, communication and interpersonal skills required. Experience working with financial regulatory agencies and 3rd party auditors is a plus.
Highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently
Experienced in the use of Microsoft Office applications required and experience with end-user support for Microsoft Office applications is preferred
Ability to work flexible work schedule, i.e., weekends and evenings as needed

The above description covers the most significant responsibilities but does not exclude other occasional responsibilities and accountabilities, the inclusion of which would be in conformity with the major purpose of this job.

Location:

Waltham, Massachusetts

About Cambridge Savings Bank:

Cambridge Savings Bank is a full-service financial institution with approximately $5 billion in assets that is committed to improving the quality of life in the communities it serves. One of the oldest and largest community banks in Massachusetts, Cambridge Savings Bank offers a full line of individual and business banking services and has branches located in Arlington, Bedford, Belmont, Burlington, Cambridge, Charlestown, Concord, Lexington, Melrose, Newton, and Watertown.

Cambridge Savings Bank is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are a VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

job_title: Principal Business Analyst ll, Turner Construction
description:
A little about us
At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That’s why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you’ll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.
Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a “Great Place to Work” by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also named by Forbes as one of America’s Best Employers for Women and one of America’s Best Employers for New Graduates—as well as one of America’s Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran’s status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.
This is a unique opportunity to work directly with one of Liberty’s largest customers, to act as liaison to operational teams and to collaborate with underwriters on go forward strategies and program design.
The Turner Principal Business Analyst (BA) is an important player on the Turner underwriting team. He or she is responsible for overseeing unique elements of the program and ensuring they are effectively outlined and communicated to key stakeholders. The BA enjoys a direct relationship with the insured and the reinsurance partners. Working with internal stakeholders the BA is key in facilitating cross functional collaboration.
Join a highly collaborative team that values diversity of thought in improving processes and creating effective customer solutions.
Responsibilities:
Regularly meets with underwriting team, customer and reinsurance partners to communicate activity and address material findings.
Oversees the execution of key financial controls for the program.
Collaborates regularly with internal stakeholders.
Owns design of annual operational profit study and presents results to leadership.
Monitors program reporter for exposure and premium irregularities.
Works with CM Retro, Premium Audit and Reinsurance Accounting to manage program volume and bring items to resolution for the customer and reinsurance partners in a transparent and timely fashion.
Involves appropriate parties to support project initiatives as needed.
Ability to effectively present and communicate with stakeholders in a manner that exhibits strategic presence and builds credibility.
Exhibits strategic vision in recommendations and solutions by addressing broader, cross-functional implications.
Qualifications:
Displays strong research, problem solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills.
Advanced knowledge of Excel and strong knowledge of database software.
Advanced business operations knowledge including an understanding of direct and net premium implications.
Strong influencing, relationship management & presentation skills.
Strong project management skills as part of implementing business process changes.
Advanced knowledge of available data sources, strengths and shortcomings.
Ideal candidate will be analytically driven, comfortable in front of a customer and adept operating with a high level of autonomy.
Competencies typically acquired through a Bachelor`s degree or equivalent experience in addition to 8+ years of relevant experience to include business analysis

North Easton Savings Bank is a mutual bank with 18 locations throughout southeastern Massachusetts. Founded in 1864, the Bank has a proven track record of growing the community through fair banking practices, financial advising, and local philanthropy. Our team maintains an engaged, rewarding, and enjoyable work atmosphere that allows each member to achieve their highest potential and personal fulfillment.Position Summary The Business Analyst will lead efforts to develop and implement a business intelligence strategy across the organization. Engage with executives and stakeholders to understand data and reporting needs, identify potential solutions using new or existing tools, then develop and implement strategies that improve business intelligence capabilities and drive strategic decision making.Essential Job Functions/ResponsibilitiesThe essential functions include, but are not limited to the following:Collaborate with management and staff from across the organization to understand business issues and identify data analytics and reporting requirements.Understand the data architecture and reporting capabilities of existing business systems, evaluating the opportunities and limitations for these systems to provide strategic business data.Create requirement documentation that will translate business needs into requirements that can be understood by management and staff.Ensure that proposed system features, and requirements meet user needs and satisfy business objectives and initiatives.Prioritize initiatives based on business needs and requirements.Assist in creation and implementation of test plans that are mapped to documented requirements.Perform and coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and/or BETA presentations as required on department related projects.Perform ad-hoc analysis as needed to answer specific business questions and produce actionable insights.Create training and system documentation, conduct training sessions, create training videos as required.Manage special projects as assigned by IT management.Minimum Qualifications (Education/Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities)A bachelor’s degree in business or related field.A minimum of five (5) years of experience in business analysis or related field.Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.Advance technical skills.Excellent documentation skills.Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.Physical DemandsThis position is an office-based position in terms of physical demand. Employees are expected to be able to operate their fingers and hands to perform functions such as typing, writing, and filing. Employees must also be able to move throughout the office with ease while also being able to sit for extended periods of time. Employees must be able to see and hear in an office setting that does include much noise going on around one’s workspace. While this job is mainly clerical, there are instances in which employees must be able to transport up to 20 pounds.Work EnvironmentThis job operates in a bank branch office. It is a professional environment.NoteThe above is a description of the ordinary duties of the position. It should be expected that from time-to-time other duties [both related and unrelated to the above] may be assigned and are therefore required.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.North Easton Savings Bank is dedicated to being an equal opportunity workplace. To reach and maintain this goal, the Bank strictly prohibits harassment and discrimination based on gender, sex, race, ethnic background, age, physical disability, mental disability, and anything else protected by law. North Easton Savings Bank welcomes diversity and we believe that diversity is the root of successful teams and an overall successful workplace.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to Commute/Relocate:South Easton, MA 02375 (Required)Education:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:Business Analysis: 5 years (Required)Work Location:One locationCompany's website:www.northeastonsavingsbank.comWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Bryce, Inc.REPORTS TO:Planning and Analytics ManagerLOCATION:Gloucester, MACONTRACT:Non-ExemptDATE:March 2021BACKGROUND: FW Bryce is a Gloucester, MA based seafood company with global reach, owned by Nippon Suisan (NISSUI). Offering product sourced from the USA, Asia, Norway, Russia, Chile, New Zealand, and other parts of the globe, FW Bryce customer base reaches across the entire United States. FW Bryce sells commodity based products but utilizes our brand and reputation to distinguish ourselves in the market. As part of the Business Analytics team, you’ll have an opportunity to dig into the data and spin reports that will be utilized to improve the company in all aspects of operations and profitability. The right candidate for this position will have a positive impact on the operations and business direction of the company.BASIC FUNCTION: Within the Business Analytics department, to be responsible for, but not limited to, all aspects of report generation. Must be detail oriented in terms of analytical process and project management.CONTACTS:Frequent contacts within the F.W. job_title: Business Systems Analyst - Service and Finance
description:
Business Systems Analyst – Services and Finance
Intapp helps firms shift to a modernization strategy and gain a growth edge in today’s competitive marketplace. We offer intelligent solutions built for partner-led firms– spanning the entire client lifecycle, from strategy through origination and execution. Intapp is looking for a highly motivated team player for the key role of Business Systems Analyst, supporting Services and Finance within the Business Applications group.
As a member of our Enterprise Applications Team, you will be helping to maintain and support Intapp’s cloud-based Enterprise Applications portfolio consisting of Project management/resourcing, project billing and Accounting solutions.
As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for administering and supporting Intapp’s Services and Finance systems. You will be responsible for coordinating with key business partners regarding their business requirements and functioning as the functional lead for services and finance systems and design. The ideal candidate should have demonstrated skills in understanding and adhering to policies, procedures, and operating controls to ensure consistency and timeliness of execution. They will also need to be able to combine business process knowledge with a deep technical understanding of related systems and software to help identify and implement scalable solutions.
Responsibilities
Function as an analyst and business partner to the professional services and accounting teams to model, design, and build business solutions that improve and scale Intapp’s Services and finance processes
Responsible for owning services and accounting system configuration - Configure fields, workflows, roles/permissions, custom rules, reports, and dashboards
Ability to explain technical objects or designs in non-technical terms for business partners (i.e. being able to digest something like a workflow & tell the business what it does without being too technical)
Experience with integrations and the flow of data across multiple systems is a plus
Knowledge of both business and IT process design and best practices
Collaborate with Services and Finance teams to define requirements and manage expectations from project inception through delivery, including status updates, issue resolution, scope changes, UAT, deployment, etc
Work with business leadership, internal/external development resources and suppliers to ensure timely, accurate and cost-effective delivery of IT solutions
Create and execute test cases for unit/regression testing; Interface with the application development teams to validate test results for new features/applications, verifying that they meet the requirements of the business before facilitating UAT and deployment
Maintain and document current and new system process flows
Provide day-to-day administration and maintenance of critical business systems including OpenAir and NetSuite. Triaging and resolving production support issues and implementing small enhancement requests
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with minimum of 5 years of system administration or application support experience.
At least 4-6 years of business systems analyst experience in a global organization utilizing NetSuite
3+ years of professional experience supporting a Services/Finance organization
Demonstrated understanding of Services process – Project billing/ resource management
Experience with any Services application – OpenAir or Oracle project accounting
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Experience with IT compliance controls
Knowledge of project management methodologies (waterfall or agile) a plus
Demonstrated ability to remain composed in a dynamic environment and communicate successfully to all levels of employees
Experience in supporting a highly integrated ERP ecosystem with working knowledge of the following systems; NetSuite OpenAir.
5+ years of Experience in providing end to end PSA solutions.
Understanding of industry best practices implementing solutions for professional services team.

Accelerate360 is a distribution, sales, marketing and media conglomerate that provides customized solutions for retailers and consumer product brands across each of our lines of business. With over 100 years of legacy experience, the company has a proven track record in Direct Store Delivery (DSD) and Direct to Consumer (DTC) fulfillment as well as sourcing, retail program development, marketing, sales, category management and media solutions. Accelerate360 is also the largest magazine wholesaler in the US and owns over 30 media brands including US Weekly and Men’s Journal. The company’s internal brand and marketing studio manages proprietary brand development and marketing services throughout the ecosystem. Accelerate360 has launched across multiple eCommerce channels including LifeToGo.com, a curated marketplace for those looking to keep moving, stay healthy and find their ideal life balance, Shopa360.com, a marketplace enabling Independent Retailers to source and order the latest on-trend products, and multiple pure play and omni-channel platforms selling our own as well as external brands. This set of offerings from marketing to distribution to eCommerce creates a unique position in the market where a brand can come in and be supported wherever they may need the most help. Located in Smyrna, Georgia and with offices and facilities across the US, Accelerate360 is proud to employ over 1,100 employees.www.accelerate360.comAccelerate360 currently has an opening for an Analyst – Business Development whose primary focus will be on researching brands to work with, evaluating brands that are brought to the company, performing deep analysis of a brand’s financial history, benefit offerings, differentiators, and how Accelerate360 could best impact/provide value to them. This position will work closely with the VP of Business Development & Ventures. See below for additional details.Position:  Analyst – Business DevelopmentLocation: New York City, Boston, Atlanta or Remote (working from home)Reports To:  EVP of Business DevelopmentHours:  Normal quickly understand if it would make sense to partner with a particular brand and working with the VP of Business Development/Accelerate360 management on next stepso Performing an in-depth, detailed analysis of brands financial history and financial performance – be able to identify strengths, weaknesses and areas of opportunity or future riskso Identifying a brands benefit offerings and unique differentiators that could make the brand an attractive partner for Accelerate360o Providing analysis how Accelerate360 offerings could provide value to the brand and how potentially the brand could provide value to Accelerate360 from a partnership or equity perspectiveo Communicating a detailed, thorough analysis to VP of Business Development and Accelerate360 Management so that the company can make an informed on how to proceed about potentially working with specific brandso Assisting with proposals from a financial analyst perspective including responding to RFI’s, RFP’s and general presentationso Maintaining a strong, positive relationships with internal partnerso When needed be able to communicate effectively with potential or existing clients· Qualifications: o Education – College Degree Required, Master’s Degree – preferably in Finance or Data Analysiso Experience – Minimum of 3+ years’ experience in a similar positiono Must have experience providing financial analysis for brands and working with brands and/or brokerso Must have experience and understanding dealing with and potential securing equity relationshipo Must have experience answering and responding to RFI’s and RFP’s from a financial analysis perspectiveo Must be a high level thinker – must be able to provide insightful analysis based on modeling – we need an analytical mind and strategic thinkero Professional demeanor – must be able to interact successfully with perspective clients, peers and senior management staff.o Strong attention to detail – must ensure that financial modeling, research, etc. is accurate and correcto Communication – Strong written and verbal communication skills, must have experience communicating with executives and potential customerso Must be enthusiastic about the job, the company and the services we have to offero Ability to work well under pressure and have the flexibility to adjust to constant changeso Demonstrated project management skills, ability to job_title: Senior Business Analyst, Liberty Specialty Markets
description:
At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That’s why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you’ll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.
Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a “Great Place to Work” by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the “100 Best Places to Work in IT” on IDG’s Insider Pro and Computerworld’s 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America’s Best Employers for Women and one of America’s Best Employers for New Graduates—as well as one of America’s Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran’s status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.
Liberty Mutual Reinsurance Actuarial team is currently seeking a Business Analyst. In this role you will perform business research that's designed to improve business processes and support decisions that contribute to the growth of profitable business. You will be an expert on various data sources used to explain trends and results, enhance and refine complex databases, and support ad hoc analyses. This position requires strong proficiency with spreadsheets and data manipulation. You will be responsible for the following:
Responsibilities:
Conducts complex research within Liberty Mutual and/or externally to obtain information such as client submissions, industry reports, pricing recommendations, and metrics.
Compiles information and identifies trends and anomalies. Participates in and may lead the implementation of special projects.
Based on analysis, develops reports, proposals for action or implementation plans as necessary and presents to management. Presentation may be formal or informal depending on the nature of projects.
Works with other departments to coordinate activities and project work in order to ensure that Liberty meets customer expectations. Resolve problems as needed to ensure that customers receive prompt, efficient service in accordance with company policies.
Performs or coordinates special projects as requested.
Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Economics, Mathematics, Statistics or Engineering
1-3 years of equivalent experience and demonstrated success in driving analytical projects
Must be organized and have ability to manage multiple competing priorities
Strong proficiency with relational database design and analytical capabilities required
Experience with reinsurance, specialty insurance products, or large account pricing preferred

Manage the Global RI operations team and functions that support Ceded Re and Internal Re. The Global Reinsurance is part of Comptroller Group in Corporate Finance, the team structures and transacts Liberty Group’s external reinsurance placements, and acts as a service provider to buyers of internal reinsurance within GRM and GRS. The Operations Manager role is critical in delivering support to the component teams within Global Reinsurance, as well as providing key services to the teams’ multiple internal clients and stakeholders across SBU’s, Corporate Finance, Tax and Legal.
The Operations Manager will work closely with Global RI’s senior managers on a daily basis and will also manage a team with 3 reports. The role requires a self-starter, organized and multi-skilled individual that is comfortable across various disciplines – namely reinsurance, finance, claims, compliance, operational and leadership skillsets.
Global RI operations functions following but not limited to:
Internal Re and Ceded Re document management and storage
Internal Re regulatory Compliance
Intra-group reinsurances Transfer Pricing annual audit coordination with Tax and external auditor
Foreign Sourced Income - quarterly forecast from Internal Reinsurances for Tax
Internal Audit management arising from Internal Re and Ceded Re functions
Interactions with Corp Finance RI Operations and Claims – monthly Finance Results and Claims Log and Monthly Reporting.
HAROLD system management and Reporting
Management of Internal Re Compendium
Ceded Re Key Controls management, and Ceded Re client and/or broker surveys
Displays strong research, problem solving, analytical, critical thinking, influencing, relationship management, and presentation skills.
Strong business operations knowledge to include understanding the function's value chain and market conditions.
Solid ability to support change and impart value within an organization.
Solid project management skills as part of implementing business process changes.
Strong knowledge of available data sources, strengths and shortcomings.
May also be relevant based on the particular needs of the position
Advanced knowledge of Excel and solid knowledge of database software.
Solid knowledge of business intelligence tools preferred.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in addition to 5+ years of relevant experience to include business analysis work.

job_title: IT Business Systems Analyst at Pension Reserves Investment Management Board
description:
IT Business Systems Analyst
Pension Reserves Investment Management Board
Boston, MA
General Description
The Massachusetts Pension Reserves Investment Management Board (PRIM) seeks an IT Business Systems Analyst, reporting to the Director of IT. The IT Business Systems Analyst serves as an IT generalist focusing on business analysis and project management but may be asked to participate in other department initiatives. The IT Business Systems Analyst will act as an intermediary between IT and the business, working to understand processes, gather requirements and participate in the maintenance of existing systems and the successful implementation of new systems and upgrades.
Responsibilities and Duties:
Work with business users to understand and document internal business processes for existing and future systems
Independently lead requirements-gathering sessions
Develop and analyze functional requirements for technology solutions, with stakeholders, to ensure business needs are well understood
Work with vendor and solutions architects to communicate business needs; oversee the translation of functional requirements into software products
Act as potential system administrator for business systems and/or related infrastructure
Develop or contribute to the development of users guides
Perform user acceptance testing
Perform user training on business systems
Analyze user, process, and systems data and create executive analytics dashboards
Participate in and actively lead projects within IT
Qualifications and Skills:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
5-7 years of relevant hands-on experience
Exposure to CRM or Business Intelligence software is a plus
Experience working on multiple projects with time sensitive deadlines
Experience leading requirements-gathering sessions
Must be able to communicate with non-technical (business) and technical (development) audiences
Willingness to take ownership of activities outside direct job responsibilities, when necessary
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Flexibility and adaptability working in a fluid environment where visions and requirements may change
Proficient in MS Word, Visio and Project
Highly organized
Vendor management experience
Familiarity with software design and development preferred
Microsoft SQL Server and Windows Server Operating Systems experience preferred
It is the policy of Pension Reserves Management Board to afford equal employment opportunity to all qualified persons regardless of race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, disability, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression or gender unless based upon a bona fide occupational qualification.

Summary
Client is currently recruiting an Identity Access Management Business Analyst to join our team. In this role you will be a lead Subject Matter Expert for defining the requirements and technical specifications for a ServiceNow Solution that will replace our home grown legacy request workflow tool. The Business Analyst will be responsible for current and future state business processes, high level technical design documentation and a recommendation to leverage a specific request workflow technology that will integrate with the SailPoint Lifecycle Management provisioning tool.
The Business Analyst must be a self-starter and have aptitude and willingness to learn new technologies and tools in our rapidly changing Identity Access Management technology environment.

Participate in project meetings and report progress at status meetings
Support of projects with occasional extended evening or weekend hours depending on the status and time table of a project/initiative.

Required

3+ years of experience supporting the SailPoint Application
Ability to communicate effectively
Highly motivated with ability to self-manage and work independently

Why This Role is Important to Us
The Analytics & Reporting Summer Intern will be supporting CCA’s Business Intelligence department, which provides analytic and data support to all levels of the organization. The Business Intelligence department ensures CCA best serves our members by delivering accurate, timely, and meaningful data using a mode of technology that best suits our stakeholders. A diverse array of healthcare data is utilized across multiple systems to answer pressing business questions. Projects include extracting data, producing analyses in Excel, creating charts, developing data models for new initiatives, working with teams to ensure data is captured effectively, and developing dashboards that meet business needs.

What We're Looking For
Data Analysis skills: working knowledge of Excel, SQL, Tableau, and other data/visualization products
Ability to translate insights derived from data analyses to a non-technical audience
Ability to multi-task and switch gears quickly / effectively
Must be able to work collaboratively and create an atmosphere of trust and respect within project teams and with external partners
Must be highly organized and self-directed with a proven ability to work with supervision on departmental and cross-functional projects of a diverse nature
Requires excellent interpersonal skills to communicate and work with staff and external partners of all skill and experience levels
Rising Junior or Rising Senior
Highschool Diploma, GED or equivalent xeperience.
Must have maintained a minimum 3.0 GPA.

What You'll Be Doing
Provide Analytic and Reporting Support under the supervision of Senior Analysts
Respond to data requests within our ticketing system in a timely fashion
Write SQL, SAS, Dbt and/or Looker queries to extract data from various source systems
Support Regulatory Reporting as needed, providing quality checking and report development support as needed
Create analyses in support of organizational initiatives using a variety of tools
Dashboard Development and Report Automation
Use tools such as Tableau, Looker or Alteryx to create dashboards that satisfy business needs
Automate report delivery using a variety of tools
Identify areas for process improvement
Assist with documentation and project tracking in Jira and Confluence as needed

Summary description:
The Business Analyst, Corporate Actions will be responsible for performing daily tasks related to reconciling and processing corporate events on a total return swap book of business across a growing list of prime brokers. This position is in the Fund Accounting Oversight organization and will interface with external fund accounting services and custodians as well as several internal groups such as Investments, Trading, Settlements, Collateral Services, Pricing, Portfolio Reporting and Security Reference Data Administration teams. The Business Analyst will report to the Sr. Business Analyst, Corporate Actions and will interact with senior members of Putnam’s management team, with opportunities to contribute in a very meaningful way.
Corporate Actions plays an integral part in the management of securities. It is a vital link necessary to ensure that proper and timely action is taken by the portfolio managers, the custodian banks, and the fund accounting group, to ensure an accurate reflection of a fund's holding.
Primary responsibilities:Maximizing the automation of corporate action processing for fund accountingResearching and validating corporate actions information from various vendors and sources to determine the level of automation that can be achievedManaging CAPS (internal system to Putnam) to determine account entitlements and query holdings for research purposesDaily reconcilement of lot level accruals, spreads, notional values across several prime brokersLead processing of corporate action events on internal trading and accounting system; field questions from external custodian/clients pertaining to any corporate action messaging distributed outside of PutnamPartner with Digital Technology to build out necessary enhancements to support the businessCoordinate escalated operational issues and ensure proper follow-up; expedite sensitive operational issues effectively while taking steps to prevent future problemsMonitor department workflow and operating practices to ensure compliance with department standards and business requirements; recognize business issues and identify impact on other business units within Putnam, assessing urgency of issues and facilitating timely resolutionsMaintain a high level of knowledge of technical Custody and Accounting operations and Putnam’s products, services, policiesEffectively communicate appropriate facts and issues to the business leader/associates

Qualifications and Required Skill Sets:
Prior industry experience required with in-depth knowledge of Corporate ActionsExperience with Trade Settlement and OTC Derivative Processing functions requiredExceptional client relationship management skills with both internal and external partnersStrong analytical and problem-solving skills, as well as effective time management skills and the ability to work in a high pressure, deadline-oriented environmentDemonstrated working knowledge of Microsoft Office applicationsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsProject management experienceBachelor’s degree, with 3+ years directly related work/industry/corporate actions experience; mutual fund accounting work experience strongly preferred

Are you looking for unlimited opportunities to develop and succeed? With work that challenges and makes a difference, within a flexible and supportive environment, we can help our customers achieve their dreams and aspirations.
Job Description
Job Profile Summary
Oversee, manage, and coordinate multiple business initiatives to identify, document, analyze and provide solutions related to complex processing, service and/or technical improvement opportunities. Business initiatives may also include implementations of new technologies and new product development.


Individual Responsibilities:
Define and manage the scope, strategy and requirements of business initiatives with specific emphasis on creating integrated strategic solutions.
Help resolve complex operational business issues by facilitating the development of creative solutions involving workflow procedures and/or new technologies that are consistent with business long-term strategic plans.
Offer analytical support and create documentation including new requirements for enhancements to existing technological solutions.
Provide post implementation support for projects, implementations and initiatives.
Keep current on market and industry trends and new product and services affecting the business area and the Company.
Shared Responsibilities:
Represent and advocate for business unit in major division or corporate initiatives ensuring business unit needs are appropriately addressed
Provide effective communication with business unit management as well as business partners across the business unit including IS, Product Development, Project Office and the Sales teams
Shares best practices with other team members, ensuring consistency across BUs and channels in the way John Hancock does business, and in its delivery of products and services
Shares information on projects with other team members to ensure interdependencies amongst work are identified and addressed
Job Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree preferred
5+ years progressive business analysis and/or project management experience supporting significant business initiatives.
7+ years of business experience
Strong facilitation skills and ability to build team consensus by utilizing strong conflict management skills
Able to translate issues and problems into effective business solutions.
Ability to effectively apply project management and business cases methodologies and ensure the necessary technical skills are included with the project team and utilized appropriately
Advanced communications skills, able to articulate business cases clearly and effectively when presenting information.
Ability to build effective business relationships with key stakeholders and business management
Knowledge of Sales and CRM tools like Salesforce, Selling Team, etc. is a plus
Understanding of financial markets, especially the dynamics in the retirement plan marketplace
Decision Authorities:
Prioritize work deliverables and small initiatives for internal clients based on changing business needs (deadlines, costs, scope of projects)
Managing internal and external resources to achieve targets
Day to Day operational decision-making authority
Decisions at this position are made using judgment based on skills and knowledge already developed
Decisions beyond normal day to day may require escalation to management

About Manulife
Manulife Financial Corporation is a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. With our global headquarters in Toronto, Canada, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We provide financial advice, insurance, and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. At the end of 2020, we had more than 37,000 employees, over 98,000 agents, and thousands of distribution partners, serving over 30 million customers. As of December 31, 2020, we had $1.3 trillion (US$1.0 trillion) in assets under management and administration, and in the previous 12 months we made $31.6 billion in payments to our customers. Our principal operations are in Asia, Canada and the United States where we have served customers for more than 155years. We trade as 'MFC' on the Toronto, New York, and the Philippine stock exchanges and under '945' in Hong Kong.

You will work closely with our corporate and operations teams on a variety of projects. Public Consulting Group, Inc. (PCG) is a leading public sector solutions implementation and operations improvement firm that partners with health, education, and human services agencies to improve lives. Founded in 1986 and headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, PCG has over 2,500 professionals in more than 60 offices worldwide. PCG’s Health practice offers in-depth programmatic knowledge and regulatory expertise to help state and municipal health agencies respond to regulatory change, improve access to health care, maximize program revenue, improve business processes, and achieve regulatory compliance. Using industry best practices, PCG’s Health team helps organizations deliver quality services with constrained resources to promote improved client outcomes. To learn more, visit http://www.publicconsultinggroup.com/health/.
PCG looks for highly talented, motivated and results-oriented recent college graduates with drive, determination and the ability to thrive in a team-oriented environment to enter into its Apprentice Business Analyst (ABA) Program. The Apprentice Program is the foundation for learning how to be a consultant at PCG. Throughout the one year program, you build your skills by working alongside talented senior consulting staff. You work on a variety of challenging assignments in our different practice areas to assist public sector clients achieve their performance goals and better serve populations in need. Your growth is supported by a Practice Area Manager who provides guidance and monitors your involvement with project assignments. You also select a mentor who guides you on "how to be a successful PCG consultant". Our team is dedicated to ensuring ABAs build a solid foundation for success through serving a diverse client base, playing an integral role on our project teams, and partaking in performance development activities. Our Apprentice Program will push you to fulfill your potential.

Job Description:
Work with a team that cross collaborates across organization to inform business decisions, drive winning strategies, and enable the business to capitalize on change.
Conducts Enterprise Market Research (EMR) provides business and functional area partners with objective, credible and actionable insights; helping to profitably grow the business, build the brand and positively position company within the marketplace.
Perform secondary market research roles to obtain, analyze and synthesize internal and external data sources to identify and size market and industry opportunities, understand competitors’ actions, and monitor external trends and their potential impact on the business.
In this role, the analyst conducts secondary research, informs project insights and prepares project deliverables.
Conduct thorough research by identifying and mining multiple market, economic, financial, and demographic sources and synthesizing and reconciling information
Create meaningful analysis that is accurate, appropriate, and actionable for our internal clients
Balance multiple projects while working with manager to help prioritize deliverables
Produce clear, concise write-ups and/or presentations of findings

Specific Competencies:
The ideal candidate will have degree in Business or similar discipline as well as a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills
Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite with emphasis on Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Ability to learn quickly and adapt to shifting business needs
Strong project management skills
Ability to analyze and summarize information from survey or qualitative data to perform market, industry, or economic analyses.
Manages workload efficiently, effectively, and completely
Learn quickly, demonstrate initiative, and adapt / adjust to shifting priorities

The Financial Analyst will be an integral part of the Fidelity Corporate Development Group (the "FBD"). FBD is a multidisciplinary team that evaluates strategic opportunities, including potential acquisitions, divestitures, strategic alliances, as well as business unit evaluations and reviews.
The Team
Fidelity Corporate Development Group is a multidisciplinary team that evaluates strategic opportunities, including potential acquisitions, divestitures, strategic alliances, as well as business unit evaluations and reviews.
Fidelity Corporate Development Group works with all of Fidelity’s Business Units and levels of the organization to evaluate strategic opportunities. These opportunities include potential acquisitions, divestitures, strategic alliances, as well as business unit evaluations and reviews.
The Expertise You Have
Bachelor's degree
Excellent research skills – the ability to gather and synthesize materials on companies, products, industries and effectively communicate findings
Complex financial/valuation modeling skills
The Skills You Bring
Excellent research skills
Advanced analytical, financial modeling and valuation skills
Expertise in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills
Results-oriented, versatile and self-motivated
Ability to work well independently and on a team
The Value You Deliver
Supporting the Fidelity Corporate Development Group team in the valuation and due diligence process of potential acquisitions, strategic investments, divestitures and partnerships

Monitoring strategic moves of top competitors/industry leaders

Our comprehensive ad tech platform, Basis, supports the planning, reporting, and financial reconciliation of direct, programmatic, search, and social media, all in one place. We are deeply committed to building software that will change the ad tech industry for the better and are equally dedicated to building an inclusive culture of highly motivated individuals who create a positive and supportive environment together. We invest in our culture and support our employees so they can do their best work. Centro is headquartered in Chicago, with beautiful offices also in Toronto, Dallas, Denver, and New York to name a few. Post-COVID, many of us will be returning to one of our offices (by choice, not requirement -- we believe results matter more than where they are produced). What you will doThe primary purpose of this Business Analyst role is to aid the Business in data/fact-based decision making based on global reporting project. This will be accomplished in 3 specific ways:Firstly, serve as a liaison between business stakeholders and the analytics sub-functional teams to review, analyze and evaluate business systems and user needs.Secondly, document requirements, define scope and objectives and formulate systems to parallel overall business strategies.Lastly, this role will support end-user adoption by engaging users in design and development and serving as a subject matter expert for all visualizations and underlying data.How you will do itUnderstand business strategy and objectives by studying the business function, gathering information, and evaluating output requirements and formats. Develop mockups to visualize insights and elicits feedback to ensure visualizations meet business needsOwnership of capturing formal requirements, use cases, user stories, test plans, etc. which ensure that the solutions developed are tested, meet business needs and are operationally sustainableDetermine operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formatsDefine project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases and elementsValidate resource requirements and develop cost estimate modelsEstablish best practices and serves as an advisor on how to visualize data to provide insights that drives business decisions and improves overall business performance.Engage end-users with tools to facilitate their day-to-day work, making large and/or complex data more accessible. Provide training and guidance as needed.Collaborate with Global Analytics team to maximize and leverage the understanding of business solution functional requirements and non-functional requirements.Perform daily, weekly and monthly reviews and analyses of current processes using operational metrics and reportsSuggest changes to senior management using analytics to support your recommendations. Actively participate in the implementation of approved changesOwn and develop relationship with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our integrationHelp design, document and maintain system processesPerform other job-related duties as neededWhat we look forBachelor's degree preferredMinimum of six (6) years of professional relevant experience. Business Analyst and/or customer-facing delivery experience preferred.In lieu of a Bachelor’s degree, will consider an Associates’ Degree with a minimum of 8 years of relevant experienceDemonstrate the ability to effectively plan and prioritize work to create impact as quickly and efficiently as possibleAbility to communicate complex concepts verbally and in writing to colleagues with varying degrees of analytical knowledge and understandingDemonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skillsDetail oriented, analytical and inquisitiveAbility to work independently and with othersExtremely organized with strong time-management skillsPreferredExperience managing multi-faceted projectsCreating process flow diagramsDocument functional or data conversion requirementsManufacturing company experiencePower BI DAX codingPower BI or Tableau data visualization building experienceAdditional detailsSponsorship is not available for this positionPosition will report to the Glendale, WI office full-time (post-COVID)Less than 10% travel expectationsWho we areClarios is a world leader in advanced energy storage solutions. We partner with our customers to meet increasing market demand for smarter applications, on a global scale. Our 16,000 employees develop, manufacture and distribute a portfolio of evolving battery technologies for virtually every type of vehicle. Technologies that deliver uniquely sustainable, next-generation performance, and bring reliability, safety and comfort to everyday lives. We add value at every link in the supply chain, contributing to the progress of the communities we serve and the planet we all share. Learn more about Clarios at www.clarios.com.To all recruitment agencies: Clarios does not accept unsolicited agency resumes/CVs. Please do not forward resumes/CVs to our careers email addresses, Clarios employees or any other company location. Job ProfilePosition OverviewAt PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. As a Loan Processing Analyst within PNC's Retail Lending Services organization, you will be based in Downers Grove, IL, Jacksonville, FL, Pittsburgh, PA and various other locations.Job DescriptionProcesses, analyzes and verifies submitted individual credit and income documents to ensure that varied and complex residential loan applications are complete.Manages customer experience throughout the origination process. Ensures compliance with established policies and procedures. Partners with internal and/or external partners to route communications, documents, or other action items to complete transactions. Identifies and may address exceptions; escalates appropriately.Manages the review and processing of residential loan information of varying complexity, including loan applications and credit documents. Prepares and forwards documents to appropriate parties.Verifies all required borrower documents are collected and acceptable under the firm's policies and procedures; ensures these documents have been received.Provides responses and documentation for inquiries and ad hoc requests. Completes research. Provides feedback on workflow and work received. Recommends best practices to team members. May participate in projects and initiatives.PNC Employees take pride in our reputation and to continue building upon that we expect our employees to be:Customer Focused - Knowledgeable of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and able to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.Managing Risk - Assessing and effectively managing all of the risks associated with their business objectives and activities to ensure they adhere to and support PNC's Enterprise Risk Management Framework.CompetenciesAccuracy and Attention to Detail – Understanding of the necessity and value of accuracy and attention to detail; ability to process information with high levels of accuracy.Decision Making and Critical Thinking – Understanding of the issues related to the decision-making process; ability to analyze situations fully and accurately, and reach productive decisions.Effective Communications – Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.Flexibility and Adaptability – Knowledge of successful approaches, tools, and techniques for dealing with changes and adapting to a changing environment; ability to adapt as needed.Influencing – Knowledge of effective influencing tactics and strategies; ability to impact decisions within and outside own organization.Managing Multiple Priorities – Ability to manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects, groups, or activities, making effective judgments as to prioritizing and time allocation.Operational Functions – Knowledge of major functional processes and associated operating requirements; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.Problem Management Process – Knowledge of and ability to bring a reported problem to successful resolution.Products and Services – Knowledge of major products and services and product and service groups; ability to apply this knowledge appropriately to diverse situations.Work ExperienceRoles at this level typically require an Associates or equivalent degree as well as related experience or product knowledge to accomplish primary duties. Typically requires 3+ years experience. In lieu of a degree, a comparable combination of education and experience (including military service) may be considered.EducationNo DegreeDisability Accommodations Statement:The PNC workplace is inclusive and supportive of individual needs. If you have a physical or other impairment that might require an accommodation, including technical assistance with the PNC Careers website or submission process, please call 877-968-7762 and select Option 4: Recruiting or contact us via email at pathfinder@pnc.com.The Human Resources Service Center hours of operation are Monday - Friday 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM ET.Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO):PNC provides equal employment opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.California ResidentsRefer to the California Consumer Privacy Act Privacy Notice to gain understanding of how PNC may use or disclose your personal information in our hiring practices.

Analyze and manage business requirements throughout the System Development Life Cycle (SDLC), including support of requirements workshops, business process modeling, writing detailed functional specifications for new and changed complex information systems, preparing test cases and testing strategies, conducting peer reviews to ensure 'as-built' information systems conform to specifications, and ensuring that processes are followed. Additionally, participate with analysis of business requirements and recommend effective, efficient, flexible technical solutions to meet business needs. Perform work within the full range of project development methodologies, including: waterfall and Agile methods. Assist with leading and facilitating groups across all levels of the organization to deliver valued outcomes, including improved analytics, adoption of improved methodologies, and using analytics to drive business decisionsRESPONSIBILITIESRelease Planning and daily operations - 50% oElicit, analyze, and document requirements by communicating directly with customers to resolve complex issues oGroom and maintain backlog with prioritized user stories oPlan and monitor the progress of release items oUnderstand issues and help resolve them through data analysis, technical research, and team collaboration on complex issues oAssist with connecting processes and overcoming internal silos oEnhance the end user experience by providing actionable information oFacilitate user acceptance testing and perform integration testing, as required oOther activities within area of responsibility, as neededProjects - 40% oCommunicate effectively with all team members, stakeholders and project sponsors on technical and non-technical topics oDevelop elements of systems design, including user stories, business process documentation, workflow charts, diagrams, data migration rules, business rules, wireframes, or other detailed deliverables oStrive toward continual optimization across processes using technology to solve issues, increase efficiency, and add to the bottom line oUse new technologies to leverage possibilities and opportunities to innovate the future through the interconnectivity of devices and processes oAchieve core business competencies in rapidly changing environments by using innovative technology oIdentify controls necessary to ensure long-term system stability oCreate test plans and strategy oCollaborate with end users and developers on developing comprehensive test cases oAssists in the development of training material. Conducts training as appropriateStrategy and R&D - 10% oInvestigate and make recommendations on emerging technologies oUnderstand enterprise strategy and direction oKeep the end user/customer at the forefront of thought; support, guide, influence users to see opportunities and value with new approaches using technology oAssist users with realizing their strategy and goals through the use of new technologyQUALIFICATIONSInnate curiosity about technology and how technology can solve problemsStrong business acumen; ability to understand business models quicklyAct as a liaison with the Digital Governance, Risk and Security team to comply with digital governance and security policies and standards during design and implementationBe a champion of digital security at TTXDemonstrated self-starter; strong initiativeAbility to manage and focus on multiple tasks and changing prioritiesBachelor's degree in technology, programming, or businessMinimum 3 years of experience as a BAMinimum 5 years professional experience with demonstrated progressive responsibilityExperience using agile methodologies such as Scrum or KanbanExcellent communication and interpersonal skillsAbility to create wire frames; leveraging intuitive designStrong MS Office skillsIntermediate experience using SQL or other programming languagesKnowledge of all phases of the Software Development Life CyclePHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS(The physical demands and work environment characteristics described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.)Performs work in general office environment with a moderate noise level. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk, hear, or sit (remain stationary within work area). The employee is frequently required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is occasionally required to move about (stand, walk) and reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or transport up to 10 pounds. job_title: SR ANALYST, CONTRACT MARKETING & COMMERCIAL ANALYSIS
description: Job SummaryThe Sr. Analyst, Contract Marketing and Commercial Analysis extracts, analyzes, and interprets data from an array of systems to address complex business issues. The Sr. Analyst also prepares and summarizes commercial and customer analysis to identify key trends and communicates business drivers, market dynamics, competitive landscapes, and product/therapy opportunities to marketing and sales teams.ResponsibilitiesCommunicates findings, trend analyses and recommendations verbally and in writing to management and other stakeholders.Develops and manages reporting templates used to analyze and interpret data.Ensures data quality of all outgoing reports and analyses.Designs complex ad hoc reports to support a variety of functional areas.Recommends actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; studying proposed changes in methods and materials (i.e. market competitive trends, customer specific trending)Identify process improvement opportunities and develop or enhance tools to assist in the work deliverables.Provide recommendations and review the analysis and business drivers based on cost-benefit analysis interpretation.Provides on the job training, guidance, and quality review to Analyst / Associate Analyst.Anticipate the consequences of pricing and business analysis decisions while weighing multiple factors and review as appropriate with management.Act as project manager and provide analytical support / guidance for major GPO bid roles.Review and action contract compliance monthly.Provide guidance and recommendations on pricing activities, initiatives and deliverables for the Commercial organization.Analyze and prepare analysis for the weekly marketing/Commercial Contracting and Analysis update meeting and provide pricing recommendations based on these analysis and feedback.Use SAP, TM1, BEX, MicroStrategy, Qlik and other databases and tools to obtain, prepare, compile and analyze information.Analyze key KPIs such as forecast accuracy to drive improvements in our demand planning.Work with marketing managers and supply chain to ensure the demand forecast is entered into the system.Provide support during the new molecule process by ensuring models and information is up to date.Support the financial forecasting, budgeting and long-term planning process.RequirementsBachelor’s degree required, MBA or equivalent experience preferred.Minimum of 5 years of experience in Finance, Marketing, Supply Chain, Demand Planning roles with a proven analysis background. Experience in the pharmaceutical industry preferred.Must be analytical, have excellent organization skills, with the ability to prioritize projects.Ability to work independently.A general understanding of pharmaceutical development, manufacturing, distribution and regulatory processes desirable.Strong verbal and written communication skills required.Must have advanced skills in Microsoft Excel with proficiency in Word and PowerPoint; Access and data visualization software experience preferred .IND-1#CBAdditional InformationWe offer an excellent salary and benefits package including medical, dental and vision coverage, as well as life insurance, disability, 401K with company match, and wellness program.Fresenius Kabi is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disabilities, or protected veteran status.

Procurement Analyst-RiskCity & State:Chicago, IL, US, 6065460654Job Category: Procurement/Purchasing60654ARYZTA is a global baking company with a Passion for Good Food. We provide our retail and foodservice customers with a portfolio of bakery solutions so they can deliver memorable, delicious food to consumers. With operations in the United States, Canada, South America, Europe, Asia, Australia and New Zealand, ARYZTA has become a global leader in the baked goods industry and one of the largest specialty bakery companies in the world. Our leading bakery brands in North America include La Brea Bakery®, Otis Spunkmeyer®, and Oakrun Farm Bakery®. We have 58 state-of-the-art bakeries and kitchens around the globe, with 20 of those in North America, and are committed to driving innovation, predicting upcoming consumer trends and flavors, and exceeding our customers’ expectations. The Americas team champions the values of Integrity, Ownership, Customer Focus, Creativity and Care to help us deliver on People Safety, Food Safety, Quality and Collaboration.Job TitleProcurement Analyst-Risk (Commodity Risk Management)LocationChicago, IL USADepartmentProcurementReporting toDirector, Procurement – Commodity Risk ManagementKey AccountabilitiesThe Procurement Analyst-Risk is responsible for commodity, economic and quantitative research/ analysis to support the commodity strategy and risk management operations for ARYZTA. This role will develop and enhance commodity risk management tools and models that allow for more effective strategy development and execution. The Analyst's responsibilities directly support business plans for the underlying commodities used in the procurement of ingredients and energy consumption. This position is strategically important to delivering Procurement’s cost of goods budgets within stated annual goals and objectives, and is critical to the price stability of finished foods.ResponsibilitiesSupport the business units through the development of commodity position reports, PPV models, and price forecasting tools.Responsible for system and database development, and the maintenance of audit traceable transaction records used in executing commodity trades.Regularly review impact of economic, trade flow and commodity movements, assessing trends and provide insights to Procurement team and business partners on underlying cost drivers.Create regular commodity reports to monitor market dynamics and potential price impacts to various categories.Contribute to the development of commodity risk management strategies.Develop presentation tools to be used in the monthly Commodity Price Risk Management Committee meeting; these tools are vital in communicating and gaining consensus for strategic hedging initiatives with the key Executive Leadership team members, including CFO and VP of ProcurementConsolidate views on variety of commodity markets for strategic category managers, procurement leadership, business unit leaders, and external customers.Train and coach team members necessary for performance of duties and responsibilities.Skills, Experience & QualificationsMinimum Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Business, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, Engineering or similar.3 years of experience in applied research or modeling with an understanding of econometric techniques.Demonstrate working knowledge and experience of commodity hedging within the food and agriculture, energy, or related industries.Advanced knowledge in energy, agricultural, softs, metals and other commodity markets is a plus.Strong analytical, business process analysis and problem solving capabilitiesPersuasion skillsAbility to manage conflictDrive for resultsBusiness and financial insightsCustomer FocusOrganizational savvyAbility to manage ambiguityEffective written and verbal communication skillsARYZTA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

job_title: CRO Analyst - Remote Contract to Hire
description: Opportunity at a GlanceCOME WORK FOR US AND PUT YOUR DATA TO WORK!Web analysts generally build the same reports every month, pull the data and then deliver on it. This position is different as you will use the data and put the data into a plan for management:You will get to see the conversion rates go upYou will research on what is needed and then devise ways of communications of how to push it alongYou get to see how the data is being used and how successful it isThe CRO Analyst reports to the CRO Manager and is responsible for contributing to the success of our Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Program. Success will depend on the ability to enthusiastically and competently deliver on the following:Analytics and Behavioral Science - The CRO Specialist will employ a marriage of strong data analytics with good instincts for web behavior to be able to identify opportunities to improve conversion rate.Demonstrating a passion for continuous learning, iterating and improving; a sound understanding of the digital marketing landscape; a zest for UX design, paid media and research and an entrepreneurial spirit to improve processes– from planning to strategy to delivery.Successful collaboration with the CRO Developers ensuring that the spirit of customer behavior improvement is captured by the variants and providing the data stories that support design rationale.Please note this is a remote position!ResponsibilitiesAnalyze web and app behavior data in Google Analytics to create data-driven insights to fuel future tests hypotheses.Create test performance reports in analytics and provide analyses on opportunities based on deep data research and segmentation. You will use segmentation strategies to uncover the ‘why?’ behind every win and loss.Collaborate with UX teams to support design strategies and user research with analytics rationale when possible.QA and configure goals, tags, triggers, and other Google Analytics administration required for CRO tests.Be able to translate and communicate testing results and data-driven recommendations to the Senior Leadership Team. Explain how we got here and where we are going.Work as an intrapreneur under general prioritization and guidance of the CRO Manager. Self-management and motivation are critical soft skills to succeed.QualificationsMust be highly organized with excellent project management skillsMinimum of 2 years’ experience in formulating optimization strategy, execution of AB, multivariate, Multi-Page and funnel testingHighly proficient in Google Analytics.Strong proficiency in digital marketing & web designA sound understanding of the mathematics behind effective testing.Must be able to work collaboratively and effectively with all levels of staffStrong knowledge of one or more testing platforms (e.g. Optimizely, Adobe Target, etc.). Google Optimize 360 a plus.Value adds:Experience with e-commerce websitesStrong digital proficiency, knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript is a bonusExperience with CRM platforms (Marketo, Salesforce, Hubspot)Experience inside a digital agency or startup.#LinkedInADT1EEOWe are proud to be an EEO employer M/F/D/V. We encourage our Colleagues to be their true authentic selves and support laws that prohibit discrimination everywhere we do business.
