Job Description
The National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL), located at the foothills of the Rocky Mountains in Golden, Colorado is the nation's primary laboratory for research and development of renewable energy and energy efficiency technologies. NREL’s office of the Chief Financial Officer (OCFO) has a position opening for a full time Business Intelligence (BI) analyst. Within NREL’s OCFO we provide ample internal and external training and developmental opportunities that are aligned to your specific area of work. Our goal is to develop, challenge and engage our staff to meet individual goals, laboratory objectives and to ensure a deep commitment toward serving the needs of our external stakeholders as well, such as our Department of Energy customer. Fulfilling these objectives will, in turn, further NREL’s renewable energy mission across the globe .
The analyst will report within the OCFO Financial Systems and Project Delivery group and will also have the opportunity work with and support the three other OCFO groups: Financial Operations, Acquisition Services and Financial Planning & Analysis. The position will be fully dedicated to implementation of a new Business Intelligence reporting tool, conversion of standard and custom reports, and creation of new reports and dashboards based on business and technical requirements.
Job duties will include:
Convert existing reports and dashboards from the Oracle Business Intelligence reporting system to Microsoft Power BI.
Work with stakeholders to define and document requirements for new report and dashboard requests.
Develop and unit test new reports and dashboards based on business and technical requirements.
Design innovative and intuitive visualizations of data to enhance the value of data sets for OCFO staff and customers.
Validate and input business definitions into existing data schemas.
Develop and document business requirements for new data sets, reports and dashboards.
Fully define new data sets with business definitions and frequency requirements.
Analyze business requirements to determine the most advantageous solution within the OCFO BI reporting framework.
Provide basic troubleshooting and support to OCFO BI user groups, customers and stakeholders.
Conduct unit testing of reports developed internally by other members of the BI team.
Provide subject matter expertise during training events.
Support development and maintenance of system documentation and training materials/guides.
Participate in focus groups with OCFO financial reporting stakeholders.
Contribute to the creation of data governance policies and procedures for OCFO data management.
.
Basic Qualifications
Relevant Bachelor's Degree or equivalent relevant education/experience.
.
Additional Required Qualifications
Demonstrate quantitative and critical thinking skills in the areas of finance, accounting, general business, supply chain and/or a technology background.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with an emphasis on customer service.
Strong organization, time management, analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Ability to work both independently and on a team.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with Microsoft Office Products, especially Microsoft Excel and SmartView reporting
Experience with financial systems.
Experience with design and visualization of data.
Experience with Business Intelligence reporting systems and frameworks.
.
Annual Salary Range (based on full-time 40 hours per week)
Annual Salary Range: $59,100 - $97,600
Of fers will typically be made in the bottom half of the listed range. In compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, a potential new employee’s salary history will not be used in compensation decisions.

Benefits include medical, dental, and vision insurance; short*- and long-term disability insurance; pension benefits*; 403(b) Employee Savings Plan with employer match*; life and accidental death and dismemberment (AD&D) insurance; personal time off (PTO) and sick leave; paid holidays; and tuition reimbursement*. NREL employees may be eligible for, but are not guaranteed, performance-, merit-, and achievement- based awards that include a monetary component. Welltok is a consumer activation company that drives individuals to take actions that optimize their total wellbeing. Only Welltok leverages advanced analytics and machine learning to engage consumers with timely and relevant multi-channel, personalized resources and incentives. Our solutions integrate data driven SaaS software, curated resources and professional services to help health plans, employers, providers and public entities drive growth, build longitudinal relationships and improve healthcare value.
At Welltok, we’re proud of what we’re accomplishing and are committed to building a company where smart, passionate people can thrive and succeed. Join us as we make healthcare more personal and rewarding!
Position Summary
The Business Analyst is a client-facing role that works proactively with external clients to identify business cases, recommend solutions, and create technical documentation for enterprise SaaS implementations. The ideal candidate has demonstrated the ability to work effectively with both business stakeholders and highly technical team members as a detail-oriented, customer-focused, self-starter. This role reports directly to the Manager, Business Analysis.
Key Responsibilities
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform the following duties. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Produce and manage technical business requirements across multiple client projects of varying complexity throughout the project lifecycle.
Align Welltok platform capabilities to client outcomes in partnership with Account Managers and Service Delivery Managers.
Establish and maintain agreements between the customer and project team.
Ensure requirements are specified in a manner suitable for the intended audience and are understandable, unambiguous and capable of being implemented and tested.
Responsible for ensuring change control and change management procedures are followed within the project team as they relate to requirements.
Assessing client requirement change requests and assisting in level-of-effort estimates.
Support User Acceptance and Functional Testing through the development and review of test scenarios, test file mockups, and test scenario validation.
Assist delivery and support teams, as needed, to resolve customer issues.
Create internal and client-facing materials that define requirements for new system capabilities.
Contribute to the improvement and standardization of requirements templates and implementation documentation.
Experience
3-5 years related experience in a client-facing role at a revenue-generating, technology platform service. Experience at a SaaS company is a plus.
Bachelor’s degree from four-year college or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Proven ability to read, analyze, and write technical business requirement documents, acceptance criteria, and user scenarios.
Capable of translating complex technical concepts into non-technical terms and conveying them to clients.
Must be able to efficiently collaborate on multiple, simultaneous projects/work efforts.
Strong time management and prioritization skills.
Comfortable with ambiguity and energized by opportunities to influence change.
Experience working with SQL is a plus.
Available for occasional travel to client sites.
This role may require access to systems containing Regulated or Confidential data and is thereby subject to additional security and privacy controls.
The estimated compensation for this position includes an annual salary between $65,000 to $70,000 with an annual bonus opportunity of 10%. Welltok also offers comprehensive employee benefits, including Medical insurance with Prescription Drug coverage, Dental insurance, Vision insurance, Healthcare Flexible Spending Accounts, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, Life and AD&D insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability insurance, Traditional and Roth 401K options, Flexible Time Off (FTO) plus 10 Company Holidays, Parental Leave, Adoption Assistance, Employee Assistance Program (EAP), as well as additional benefits such as Legal Plan, Identity Theft Protection, Auto/Home insurance, and Pet insurance.
Welltok celebrates respects and supports diversity in the workplace. Welltok is an equal opportunity employer. Ibotta is seeking a Business Systems Analyst to join our innovative team and contribute to our mission to Make Every Purchase Rewarding.

What you will be doing:

Embrace and uphold Ibotta's Core Values: Integrity, Boldness, Ownership, Teamwork, Transparency & Advocate for Savers

Business Analysis:

Define, utilize and advance Business Systems Analyst methods & tools for high priority projects related to our Salesforce platform
Exhibit outstanding communications skills.
Ability to create and maintain documentation including User Stories for requirements, design, testing and training purposes.
Work cross functionally in order to understand and translate business needs into well defined systems requirements and specifications.
Work closely with the Product Owner and help tailor the Salesforce experience for several groups of users based on unique business requirements.
Troubleshoot and resolve issues affecting Ibotta's Salesforce users.
Constantly find opportunities to improve systems and processes by understanding current practices and evolving business needs.

System Validation:

Assist the developers and admins in testing the User Stories.
Perform System Integration Testing (SIT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT).
Perform data validations in production post-deployment.

Administration:

Oversee the administration of software tools integrated with SFDC such as CPQ, Outreach and Conga.
Build custom reports and dashboards in Salesforce to help the Ibotta Sales Team make more informed decisions.
Manage users, roles, profiles, security and data integrity.
Assist in the integration and testing of 3rd party applications.

What we are looking for:

Technical Skills: Sound understanding of the SFDC platform, with the ability to build new, or iterate over existing formula fields, workflows, validations, and other content of intermediate complexity.
3-5 years' of business systems analysis work, Salesforce administration, or other related experience
Bachelor's Degree OR equivalent education/experience.
Salesforce Administrator Certification required. Advanced Administrator and CPQ Specialist Certifications preferred.
Great problem solving and analytical skills with an aptitude to use software applications for analysis, reporting and tracking.
Great communication skills, both written and verbal.
Solid understanding of overall Lightning architecture.
The ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Prefered skills: Understanding of Agile methodologies, Test automation tools like Selenium.

About Us:

Built in Denver, CO, Ibotta ("I bought a...") is a free mobile shopping app that gives users cash back on groceries and more. Through our partnerships with brands and retailers like Procter & Gamble, Kraft Heinz, Kellogg, Amazon, Walmart, Target and Uber, we've delivered over $750 million in cumulative cash rewards to our Savers. Guided by our values and our mission to make every purchase rewarding, we come to work energized by the business problems we get to solve, the technology we get to build, and the people we get to innovate (and have fun) with. Ibotta made Inc.'s 2020 list of the 5000 fastest-growing private companies in the U.S. for the third consecutive year. In 2019, we became the first mobile consumer technology company in Colorado to achieve $1B in valuation.

Additional Details:

This position is located in Denver, CO and includes competitive pay, flexible time off, benefits package (including medical, dental, vision), Lifestyle Spending Account, 401k match, profit sharing and equity.
Base compensation range: $75,000-$90,000. Total compensation for this role also includes a variable component in addition to base salary.

description:
Ball Corporation manufactures aluminum packaging for beverage, personal care and household products, and provides aerospace and other technologies for commercial and government customers. We have been in business for over 140 years and is leading the charge in creating solutions that keep our planet healthy. Ball Corp has been nationally recognized as a leading company in the creation of sustainable products (Fast Company World Changing Ideas award) as well as one of America's Best Employers for Diversity (Forbes Magazine.) Join our team of over 18,000 people worldwide in our quest to make the world a cleaner and healthier place. BE BIGGER THAN YOURSELF. BE UNSTOPPABLE. BE AN INSPIRATION. JOIN US IN MAKING THE WORLD A BETTER PLACE.
Primary Purpose of the Position:
The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) ensures the proper collection and documentation of business requirements that can be understood by both business and technology stakeholders to improve the effectiveness of the business function, responsible for requirements to be consistent with the business case and the long-term plans within the capability/service delivery area. The BSA also leads user acceptance testing to ensure the solution is aligned to the business requirements, driving resolution of any potential defects where necessary.
Essential Responsible Areas:
Accountable for developing, defining, and documenting business requirements that describe the business need and solution scope, and communicate them effectively to IT and business stakeholders
Remain up to date of technology trends, opportunities, compliance, and regulatory requirements within a defined capability/service delivery area
Provide process expertise to others to understand the impact of system enhancements on the company’s processes and to understand how system functions and processes will generate the intended outcomes for business
Collaborate with solution architects, adhering to enterprise architectural frameworks and roadmaps to design processes, systems, and information/data architectures
Build and maintain an in depth knowledge of the processes, systems, and data in a defined capability/service delivery area
Responsible for writing functional specifications that can be used by solutions/systems engineers to support the creation of technical designs and delivery of business and technical requirements
Responsible for communicating documented defects to technical team members, create and validate proposed defect resolutions (fixes) from systems/solutions engineers, ensure that the initial defect was corrected, and that initial data and/or processes will not be impacted
Coordinate user acceptance testing to ensure business requirements are satisfied and ensure proper UAT documentation is produced (based on use cases and test requirements)
Ensure proper training, transition, and cutover plans are developed and executed to ensure proper user adoption and minimize business disruption.
Provide project management support for small/medium size projects, being responsible for project planning and execution of work required, including issue management and status reporting.
Position Requirement & Competencies:
Broad training in a related field usually acquired through college degree level education or work-related experience
BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Marketing, Information Systems Management, Computer Science or related field, or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience
5+ years of related work experience with progressively increasing responsibility
Experience creating core BA deliverables (e.g., functional spec, test cases, etc)
Ability to work in global, multinational and remote teams in a matrix organization
Strong analytical skills, excellent communication skills (written and oral)
Demonstrated ability in IT analysis methodologies (e.g., process flow definition, data flow diagramming, use case definition)
Demonstrated ability to work effectively with all levels of staff, customers and other IT Personnel
Proficiency using the Microsoft Office suite including Visio or similar applications (e.g., LucidChart, OmniGraffle, etc)
Solid knowledge of technologies relevant to the capability/service delivery area
Working knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)
Working knowledge of project management methodologies (e.g. Agile, Waterfall) and activities/deliverables(e.g., work planning, status reporting, issue management)
Demonstrate Ball Leadership Behaviors:
 Inspire

Empower Retirement is currently recruiting a Senior Business Systems Analyst for SAP. This is an exciting opportunity for a qualified candidate to participate in our Financial Reporting transformation initiative by defining effective business processes for our organization and configuring and testing the SAP system in support of this effort. As part of our established SAP team, the successful candidate will under consultative direction, design, document and implement complex applications and system enhancements for SAP. Ensures delivery satisfies system and business requirements. Provides on-going configuration and operational support for complex SAP application modules. The chosen candidate will coordinate with users to determine functional and/or technical requirements and ensure that SAP system improvements are successfully implemented and monitored to increase efficiency.
What you will do
Gathers, documents and analyzes system and business requirements for moderately complex SAP applications. Prepares detailed specifications from which new applications and system enhancements will be written.
Analyzes system and business needs to effectively map business processes to SAP application modules.
Configures and customizes moderately complex SAP application modules.
Tests moderately complex SAP application modules. Troubleshoots problems and recommends modifications to applications.
Completes moderately complex project tasks within defined milestones. Makes recommendations for project resource requirements to project managers and/or systems leadership. Maintains requirements documentation, project tracking, and key stakeholder reporting metrics. May lead or direct projects of depending on size and scope of assigned project.
Support Business units with detailed Master Data request, to include month end, Quarter end and Year end activities.
Other duties as assigned.
Will be assigned to on-call support rotations within assigned teams.
What you will bring
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Business or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 4 years relevant SAP experience. Hands on configuration experience required.
Experience in implementations of new SAP enhancements and conversions.
Financial Accounting expertise in configuring General Ledger Accounting (FI-G/L), New G/L, Accounts Payable (FI-AP), Accounts Receivable (FI-AR), Fixed Asset accounting (FI-FA), and Treasury-Cash Management (TR-CM), Material Management (MM).
Experience in setting up SAP banking, treasury and cash management configuration and testing. Experience should include the setup, testing and maintenance of house banks, and the integration of SAP with banks – NACHA files, check formats, and EDI and BAI file formats.
Working Conditions/Physical Requirements: Normal Office Working Conditions May be required to work on-call shifts as necessary.
What will set you apart
Experience on a Financial Reporting business process transformation initiative.
Experience with HP ALM testing tool.
Experience using SAP Solution Manager (Charm ) for SAP transport Imports.
Experience using Waterfall and Agile as method of delivering new Software Development.

At McKinstry, we’re proud to be a diverse and passionate group of innovators and problem-solvers, builders and engineers, mentors and students. We believe the world needs curious, forward-thinking, solutions-oriented people who want to make our planet better. We are committed to strengthening our diversity through recruiting, developing, and retaining professionals from all backgrounds, and we believe that promoting diversity, equity, and inclusivity is an integral component of our continuing quest To Build a Thriving Planet. If you are looking to leave a purposeful mark on the world, then McKinstry is the place for you.


Here's where you come in:

We are currently seeking a Business Operations Analyst to join our team as a member of our growing Colorado Energy division. At McKinstry, it is our mission is to make every building we touch more efficient. Energy efficiency in any built environment is critical - not just to the bottom line of the owner, but to the well-being of the planet. We are unsurpassed and nationally recognized as a premier provider of energy-efficient technologies, creating high-performance buildings and innovating solutions that get the most for every energy dollar. No matter what the energy challenge, we put all our energies into meeting it.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to use your project management skills and continually think of ways to improve the process. You will analyze data for financial anomalies, trends and find different solutions to make the process smoother for our Construction Manager and cross-functional teams. Developing metrics and analyzing trends for key takeaways to achieve business objectives and reduce operating costs and increase financial predictability is a high priority in the role.
As our business is growing, we need someone with a strong accounting and financial background to support our Construction Managers on projects across the region.
You will be responsible for compiling and analyzing financial information related to cost-based revenue projections and monthly forecasting for implemented contracts. Additionally, you’ll manage administrative project workflow: including active work and forecasted work; backlog of work, and be responsible for other financial project deliverables within required deadlines such as internal and external billing and invoice generation.

So, if project support, data analysis of financials, and cross-collaboration are passions of yours, this role might be the one for you. We are excited to hear from you in the hopes to bring you on as not only a steward of Mckinstry but an invaluable member of our team.


What we would like to see from you:

Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience required (a degree in facilities management, construction management, engineering, or other related field preferred).
Three (3) to four (4) years’ experience in architecture, engineering, construction, accounting or other professional services industry required.
 Proven leadership abilities and program/project management experience required.
Advanced business writing and editing skills required.
Demonstrable knowledge of finance and economics principals, with proven ability to analyze business performance from a cost, revenue, and margin perspective required.
Highly proficient with Microsoft products, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook required.
Excellent knowledge of Excel functions and data analysis preferred.

Founded in 1921 and publicly traded since 1925, Newmont (www.newmont.com) is one of the largest gold companies in the world. Headquartered in Denver, Colorado, the company has approximately 24,000 employees and contractors, with the majority working at Newmont's core operations in the United States, Australia, Ghana, Peru and Suriname. Newmont is the only gold company listed in the S&P 500 index and in 2007 became the first gold company selected to be part of the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index. Newmont's industry leading performance is reflected through high standards in environmental management, health and safety for its employees and creating value and opportunity for host communities and shareholders.

Dimensions
At Newmont, our purpose is to create value and improve lives through sustainable and responsible mining. One of the largest gold companies in the world, we pride ourselves on our dedication to safety, environmental management, inclusion and diversity, and adding value and opportunity to our host communities. With operations on four continents, we are honored to be named the mining industry leader by the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index in 2015, 2016, 2017 and 2018, and the only one listed in the S&P 500 index.
About this role
What will you be responsible for?
Provide BPC System functional and business process support for planning applications.
Support forecast/planning process, including communication and training materials.
Maintain and further improve BPC Systems functionality for a more simplified and streamlined planning process.
Work with corporate and global business planning teams.
Analyze and report cost and production forecast/budget information.
Your role will consist of
Here is a snapshot of what your day to day will look like:
We coordinate and analyze the data and assumptions that drive forecast/plan results.
We support the development and tracking Newmont and peer organization external financial commitments and targets.
We support the development and tracking of short-term incentive (bonus) metrics.
We perform conventional planning practices including researching and analyzing trends.
We build/maintain presentations, spreadsheets, reports, or other metric-driven tools.
We communicate and support the forecast/planning process and results effectively in both verbal and written form to Planning leadership and other functional teams.
We perform BPC System support such as researching, detailing or updating basic functionality such as input schedules, master data, data flow and calculation logic.
We utilize the BPC System for Business Planning which is comprised of five applications, including Operating Expense, Manpower, Projects, Stats, and Planning.
We support development, implementation and testing of BPC system improvements.
We support regional planning teams based at operational sites with planning process and BPC application support and troubleshooting.
This role may be globally-focused, or oriented (i.e. coordinates information, resources and compiles data from multiple sources, sites and/or functions).

The above duties and responsibilities are representative of the nature and level of work assigned and are not necessarily all-inclusive.

Your training, skills, and experience checklist
Here is what we would need to see from you!
Undergraduate degree required (preferably Accounting or Finance; or related field).
3-5 years’ business analytics/mining ops experience (preferably in mining or mineral extraction-related industry).
3-5 years’ systems experience (preferably BPC or other multifaceted systems).
Strong analytic and synthesis skills; conceptual understanding of financial data and the basic application of accounting principles.
Strong Ms Excel skills, including sophisticated financial modeling and other tool's development.
Requires acumen in accounting, finance and planning concepts and methodologies.
Ability to communicate and present information required –translate financial and data driven information into presentations.
Working conditions and location
Where you will be located!
The position is located in the Denver Corporate office.
Position may be required to travel to, and assist, other domestic and international sites.
Willingness to put in extra hours as projects and priorities dictate; ability to accommodate meeting times outside typical business hours to attend global calls, etc.

The salary range offered for this role is $75,680 to 99,330. The salary range is tied to the Colorado market for jobs performed in Colorado. The salary offer to the successful candidate will be based on job-related education, training, and/or experience. The salary offer will not be based on a candidate’s salary history at other jobs, and by law, Newmont will not seek information about salary history, and candidates should not share such information with Newmont.
This role will be eligible for participation in a discretionary annual bonus program, pursuant to which an employee may be awarded a percentage of their salary based on the company’s performance and their own individual performance.
Newmont offers a competitive and inclusive benefits package to support physical, mental, financial and emotional wellbeing. This role will be eligible for the following benefits: Medical, prescription drug, dental, and vision insurance; flexible spending accounts; health savings accounts; life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance; short and long-term disability; 401(k) program with company match; pension; financial planning; employee assistance program (EAP); adoption assistance; dependent scholarship program; tuition reimbursement; paid holidays and paid time off; paid family leave; matching gifts; and discounts on home, auto and pet insurance. All bonuses and benefits are subject to the applicable eligibility and program/plan terms and may be modified or terminated at Newmont’s sole discretion.

EnMotive, a Gannett Company, is a full-service event services company offering registration, timing, scoring and a wide range of other endurance event solutions. We work with over 1,000 events per year, using a combination of in-house registration, fundraising and volunteer software as well as industry leading external race timing software. We are looking for passionate, detail-oriented, computer & technology savvy individual with the desire to help grow our eCommerce business and integrate our software solutions to support our mission to becoming “the one stop source” for endurance and ticketing events. Our application consists of features including customer relationship management, event registrations, ticket registrations, shipping, donations, results, photography, on-site check-in, fundraising, membership and reporting among other uses.

EnMotive is seeking an experienced Business Analyst that will be a part of a growing team working to refine and enhance a suite of consumer-facing applications. You should be comfortable working on projects either as part of a small team, or individually depending on the needs of the project. You should also expect to be working in a fast pace and dynamic environment that is able to shift from one project or business priority to the next as we break down projects into smaller tasks and release frequently.The Business Analyst will serve as the Scrum Master and use Scrum methodology to perform work that will consist of holding requirements gathering sessions and retrospectives, preparation of agendas and notes, requirement refinements, monthly status reporting, user story writing, system documentation, testing, and supporting the application throughout the development process. Work is expected to be offsite.

Responsibilities:

•Serve as the Scrum Master and lead certain Agile ceremonies

•Elicit requirements using any of the following: interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, storyboards, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, event lists, business analysis, competitive product analysis, task and workflow analysis, and/or viewpoints

•Write requirements specifications/User Stories according to standard templates, using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely. Represent requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, or scenarios, where appropriate

•Lead requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable, and that they conform to standards

•Decompose high-level business and user requirements into functional requirements specifying an appropriate level of detail suitable for use by those must base their work on the requirements

•Participate/Lead user story prioritization and facilitate the negotiation of requirements amongst multiple stakeholders

•Identify the current and future-state business processes; define quality attributes, external interfaces, constraints, and other nonfunctional requirements

•Participating in functionality testing and user acceptance testing of the new system

•Participate in peer reviews and inspections of requirements documents and work products derived from those documents to ensure that the requirements were interpreted correctly

•Coordinate Business Validation to verify that a set of end-to-end business processes function as intended

•Work with the product manager or project sponsor to document the product’s vision and the project’s scope

•Identify ways to assist product management in product planning through requirements development and analysis

•Manage changes to baselined requirements through effective application of change control processes and tools

•Propose new product features and updates

•Participate in daily stand-up with team

•Meet with business owners and developer regularily

•Prepare agendas for meetings and document notes as needed

•Acting as a team-lead on assigned projects and assignments; and providing work direction to the developers and other project stakeholders.

Minimum Qualifications:
•Three to Five (3-5) years’ experience Business Analyst role

•Two (2) engagements lasting more than six (6) months in Business Analyst role
•Experience with scrum methodology
•Experience as scrum master
•Experience writing user stories
•CSM Certification

Headquartered in Colorado Springs, Colorado, Focus on the Family has nearly 600 employees who work to achieve the mission of enriching the lives of families, engaging the culture, advocating for life and spreading the Gospel of Jesus Christ. The Business Development Analyst 1 (BDA1) position exists to provide support to the Sr. Mgr., Business Development Analysis, the Business Services & Strategy team, and Focus on the Family’s ministry owners. The BDA1 will support the ministry in general research tasks, data management & accumulation, process management & coordination, and development & editing of reports & presentations. The BDA1 will also collaborate with the Business Services & Strategy team in managing financial processes through key ministry activities. The BDA1 will be accountable for monitoring ministry goals and budgets and providing business analysis of ministry activities.

Maintains a working understanding of Business Impact Centers and provides support and analysis of performance regarding ministry objectives

Engage appropriate Financial Service team to coordinate and/or assist in identifying information relating to projects’ financial (GL) activity

Engages with various internal teams and repositories to gather data: financials (including forecasts, actuals, and costs), Business Impact Center metrics, constituent impact, & program results. Compiles data into existing or custom spreadsheets, scorecards, or reports

Under direction from the Sr. Mgr., BDA, supports ministry owners in development of business cases, including some research, coordination, writing and financial data entry

Work is performed in an office environment, laboratory, cleanroom, or production floor.

Who Is KORE?
KORE is the global leader in sports and entertainment business management solutions. Comprised of KORE Software and KPI (KORE Planning and Insights), KORE provides leading B2B SaaS software to more than 500 sports properties worldwide, providing practical tools, services, and insights that drive ticket sales, digital marketing, corporate sponsorships, activation management, premium hospitality and more.
Our Values
We operate with transparency. We communicate and act with resolute honesty, integrity, and respect.
We are accountable. We take ownership in the quality of our work and can be counted on to deliver.
We commit to our customer. In all that we do, our customer is our priority. We are fanatical about serving both our internal and external customers.
We embrace change. We are unafraid of questioning assumptions and believe that growth and innovation flourish when challenging the status quo.
Role Overview
KORE Planning and Insights Team consults with clients on a variety of business intelligence, strategy, and reporting initiatives. Team members have a client facing role and work as an extension of the clients BI and data teams. This new role will report to the Manager, Analytics, and be responsible for collaborating with other members of the KPI team.
This role will primarily assist on CRM implementations, customization, and administration as well as email marketing system implementation and integration projects, in addition, they will also be involved in building and designing tableau dashboards and other data visualization.
The ideal candidate for this position will be self-motivated, able to meet deadlines, detail-oriented, data-focused, and have a strong ability to work well in a team-based setting. This includes a customer service disposition and the ability to collaborate both with internal and external teams.
This selected candidate will have a technical aptitude to work on customizing and integrating third party apps with CRM and email marketing platforms, and good customer service skills.
Duties and Responsibilities
This position will split their time between CRM customizations, email marketing implementation, and basic SQL script writing. Although we expect this role to expand as skills and experience grow, the following is an estimated breakdown of where we expect this individual's time to be allocated in main categories of tasks:
CRM implementation & customization
Help implement and customize CRM (Salesforce & MS Dynamics CRM) based on customer requests or needs.
Provide clients with CRM administration support by working with the client sales, service, and sponsorship teams to manage and maintain the CRM and KORE's applications on a day-to-day basis.
Email Marketing Implementation & Integrations
Help implement and customize email marketing platforms (Salesforce, Eloqua, etc.) based on customer requests or needs.
Assist clients in using data and insights to build powerful customer journeys and automations to build better marketing execution
Communication & Consultation
Communicating via phone, email, face-to-face, and web meetings with customers
Analyze and define tasks, data flows, and dependencies in relation to project deliverables
Work cross-departmentally to continue to develop KORE's reporting products
Skill Requirements
1+ years of experience / certification working on CRM platforms (Microsoft Dynamics, Salesforce)
SQL experience preferred
Strong organizational, analytical, and technical skills
Familiarity of database marketing and the sports industry
Ability to communicate professionally in both a written and verbal context with external end-users and internal colleagues
Attention to detail, ability to work with deadlines, and ability to coordinate across multiple departments

Position Summary:
Bio-Techne is seeking an agile IT Business Analyst to sit in their Centennial, CO office. This individual is responsible for support and enhancement of IT development, systems and integration projects. This individual will work with departments across the organization eliciting and analyzing requirements in addition to helping with the implementation of solutions to meet the needs of the organization. The business analyst will work with end users providing support, training and assistance. Perform additional duties as assigned. This position is currently 100% remote with the expectation of a future return to the Centennial office.
Ideal candidate will be self-motivated, proactive, comfortable with ambiguity, possess a deep sense of curiosity, thrive in a collaborative environment, and enjoy empowering others.
Key Responsibilities:
Analyzes and defines user requirements and translates them into clear and concise system requirements. Effectively communicates requirements to the development team during project discovery through implementation.
Represents business need on project teams. Ensure solutions identified map back to the business “what” and “why”.
Serve as a bridge between stakeholders and IT.
Understands and documents process flows to uncover and clarify business requirements.
Documents data requirements and conducts data analysis for integration and conversion efforts.
Leverages technical skills in conjunction with analysis and systems thinking to identify opportunities to improve or develop processes and provide clarity around IT work.
Ability to work collaboratively across disciplines and build relationships with key stakeholders.
Assist in testing and validating system changes, upgrades and enhancements.
Develop training documentation and provide training to end users.
Familiarity with Agile methodologies including Scrum and Agile Analysis
Performs work in a way that is consistent with Bio-Techne’s EPIC values.
Understands the overall company vision and can relate this vision to specific business and system requirement details.
Performs additional duties as assigned.
Education and Experience:
Position requires a bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 3 - 5 years of related experience or equivalent experience. IIBA-AAC preferred. Prefer experience working as a member of an IT team to support software development, web or data systems. Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and have good communication skills both verbally and in writing. Must be able to clearly document ideas in non-technical terms and demonstrate these ideas to upper management. Working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel as well as computer entry and/or typing skills are required.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Knowledge of web and data systems. Familiarity with infrastructure, security, and SDLC.
Knowledge of requirements elicitation, documentation, and writing functional requirements.
Skills in problem solving; including the ability to identify and appropriately evaluate a course of action.
Skillful interpersonal and intercultural communicator across multiple mediums including oral, written, and virtually. Comfort working virtually with individuals across the globe.
Assists in defining, generating, refining and socializing metrics.
Ability to work cooperatively individually and within a group.
Ability to organize, prioritize and respond to multiple projects and deadlines.
Ability to work independently and have demonstrated the ability to work cooperatively with end users.
Ability to work hours that conform to standard business operations (8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.)
Ability to work on evenings and weekends if needed.
Preferred Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
IIBA-AAC
Familiarity with ServiceNow including ITBM
Familiarity with LIMS & Electronic Lab Notebooks
Experience with Analytics and Data Storytelling

Brady Corporation is an international manufacturer and marketer of complete solutions that identify and protect people, products and places. Brady's products help customers increase safety, security, productivity and performance and include high-performance labels, signs, safety devices, printing systems and software. Founded in 1914, the Company has a diverse customer base in electronics, telecommunications, manufacturing, electrical, construction, medical, aerospace and a variety of other industries. Brady is headquartered in Milwaukee, Wisconsin and as of July 31, 2020, employed approximately 5,400 people in its worldwide business. Brady's fiscal 2020 sales were approximately $1.08 billion. Brady stock trades on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol BRC. More information is available on the Internet at www.bradycorp.com.Do you like solving mysteries? Do you refuse to accept things at face value? When you're channel flipping, do you find yourself stopping at "How It's Made" and thinking - "wow, so that's how they do that." Sound like you? Then you may be the strategic analyst we're seeking.Come join our team to uncover opportunities, resolve problems and engineer solutions. We're a small team committed to continually improve through creativity, drive, determination and a keen focus on data. We believe numbers drive strategy, but we also believe you need to get out of your chair, roll up your sleeves and really get into the business. Bring us your problem solving analytical skills and learn how a business truly works with us.Who we are:We're a manufacturer. We're an innovator. We make things that people need. Brady Corporation is a 105 year old company that stands by its motto of "We identify and protect people, products and premises." The PDC division of Brady is all about people - literally - that's our customer set. We make hospital wristbands and labels; RFID wristbands for waterparks; and woven wristbands for music festivals. We also make ID cards and the software that gets you into the office, as well as, the lanyards and badge holders for your ID. If it identifies and protects a person, we aim to make it.So, what activities will you be involved in?Strategy: Help solve problems and identify opportunitiesData: Distill the data into actionable insights.Planning & Analysis: Undertake scenario analysis and research projects to drive financial growthProject Management: Lead the movement for process improvementCollaborate: Join forces for maximum impactAdditional tasks as assigned by managerWhat we are looking for:Bachelor's degree, preferably in an engineering, science, computer or math-related fieldMaster's degree a plusExperience in SQL, and strong understanding of relational database structuresProficiency in data reporting / analysis software; strong preference for Alteryx and TableauExperience in evaluating business processes and driving efficiency improvements leveraging technology (we do case interviews, so suit up)Familiarity and overall understanding of ERP systems; strong preference for SAPAbility to apply concepts of Algebra, Statistics and ProbabilitySolid foundation in mid-2000's pop trivia - we're trying to build up our pub trivia team and we're a bit weak here.Proven organizational skills and attention to detail (duh)Demonstrated ability to effectively work with and communicate with senior managementExperience with Salesforce a plusProject management experience a plusBenefits:Complete insurance coverage starting on first day of employment - medical, dental, vision, life401(k) with company matchPretty decent coffeeIn Valencia, so you're against traffic if you're coming from LA, which is pretty coolTuition reimbursementBonus opportunityVacation and Holiday pay

It’s Time For A Change…Your Future Evolves HereAt New Century Health we are pioneering a new era of specialty care, focused on engaging with payers and providers to improve the quality of care for patients diagnosed with cancer and heart disease. Our evidence-based care delivery model supports patients during their most vulnerable times, a responsibility we are both humbled by and passionate about.With nearly two decades of proven results in Oncology and Cardiovascular care, New Century Health improves quality and lowers costs for the 6M+ patients whose care we manage. Our approach is based on a proven clinical model that engages Oncology and Cardiovascular specialists through value-based care delivery. We believe the highest quality care is also the lowest cost care over time, improving outcomes and delivering financial savings to our partners. The New Century Health model has been proven across Medicare, Medicaid, and Commercial populations. New Century Health joined the Evolent Health family in 2018, joining the mission to change the health of the nation.Are we growing? Absolutely. We have seen about 30% average growth over the last three years. Are we recognized? Definitely. We were named one of “Becker’s 150 Great Places to Work in Healthcare” in 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019 and are proud to be recognized as a leader in driving important Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) efforts. Evolent achieved a 95% score on its first-ever submission to the Human Rights Campaign's Corporate Equality Index, was named on the Best Companies for Women to Advance List 2020 by Parity.org, and we publish an annual Diversity and Inclusion Annual Report to share our progress on how we’re building an equitable workplace. We recognize employees that live our values, give back to our communities each year, and are champions for bringing our whole selves to work each day. If you’re looking for a place where your work can be personally and professionally rewarding, don’t just join a company with a mission. Join a mission with a company behind it.What You’ll Be Doing:The Business Systems Analyst will meet and speak to business, understand their needs, create mockups for possible solutions, and create requirements documents. They will also follow up with business throughout the development cycle should questions arise or requirements change. They will shepherd and manage projects to delivery.The Experience You’ll Need (Required):Comfortable communicating with technical and non-technical peersProficient at creating mockups and writing requirements documentsProficient with a mockup tool - Axure, Balsamiq, or MS Project (min 1 year)Experience as Business Systems Analyst (min 2 years)Bachelor’s degreeFinishing Touches (Preferred):Healthcare ExperienceProficient in SQL or LINQCan read and understand ERDsTechnical Requirements:Currently, Evolent employees work remotely temporarily due to COVID-19. As such, we require that all employees have the following technical capability at their home: High speed internet over 10 MBPS and, specifically for all call center employees, the ability to plug in directly to the home internet router. These at-home technical requirements are subject to change with any scheduled re-opening of our office locations.Evolent Health is an equal opportunity employer and considers all qualified applicants equally without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin. #LI-HY1

Company Overview:Mitchell, Genex and CoventryWith Mitchell, Genex and Coventry now one organization, we’ve dramatically expanded our ability to deliver innovative services and technologies to our customers. We’ve also seen career opportunities within our combined organization grow. Each part of our organization helps people recover after a challenging event in their lives.Mitchell delivers trusted software and services to the property & casualty claims, collision repair and risk management industries with technology-enabled solutions that simplify claims handling, repair processes and pharmacy transactions. Genex helps injured workers return to their jobs in a safe and efficient manner through compassionate case management, reducing health care costs and disability expenses for our customers. Coventry offers the nation’s largest and most diverse set of provider and ancillary networks focused on improving total overall outcomes.Together, we bring a complete set of proven capabilities for our partners who require more than one-dimensional solutions. May provide consultation to users in the area of automated systems.May lead cross-functional linked teams to address business or systems issues.May be internal or external, client-focused, working in conjunction with Professional Services and outsourcing functions.May include company-wide, web-enabled solutions.May include responsibilities as Product Owner for one or more Scrum Teams.Qualifications:IAIABC Claims EDI experience with IAIABC Claims EDI badge preferred.Minimum of 4 years of related experience with a Bachelor’s degreeCSPO or Scrum Team experience.Benefits : We’re committed to supporting your ultimate well-being through our total compensation package offerings that support your health, wealth and self. job_title: Business Systems Analyst - Service and Finance
description: Business Systems Analyst – Services and FinanceIntapp helps firms shift to a modernization strategy and gain a growth edge in today’s competitive marketplace. We offer intelligent solutions built for partner-led firms– spanning the entire client lifecycle, from strategy through origination and execution. Intapp is looking for a highly motivated team player for the key role of Business Systems Analyst, supporting Services and Finance within the Business Applications group.As a member of our Enterprise Applications Team, you will be helping to maintain and support Intapp’s cloud-based Enterprise Applications portfolio consisting of Project management/resourcing, project billing and Accounting solutions.As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for administering and supporting Intapp’s Services and Finance systems. You will be responsible for coordinating with key business partners regarding their business requirements and functioning as the functional lead for services and finance systems and design. The ideal candidate should have demonstrated skills in understanding and adhering to policies, procedures, and operating controls to ensure consistency and timeliness of execution. They will also need to be able to combine business process knowledge with a deep technical understanding of related systems and software to help identify and implement scalable solutions.ResponsibilitiesFunction as an analyst and business partner to the professional services and accounting teams to model, design, and build business solutions that improve and scale Intapp’s Services and finance processesResponsible for owning services and accounting system configuration - Configure fields, workflows, roles/permissions, custom rules, reports, and dashboardsAbility to explain technical objects or designs in non-technical terms for business partners (i.e. being able to digest something like a workflow & tell the business what it does without being too technical)Experience with integrations and the flow of data across multiple systems is a plusKnowledge of both business and IT process design and best practicesCollaborate with Services and Finance teams to define requirements and manage expectations from project inception through delivery, including status updates, issue resolution, scope changes, UAT, deployment, etcWork with business leadership, internal/external development resources and suppliers to ensure timely, accurate and cost-effective delivery of IT solutionsCreate and execute test cases for unit/regression testing; Interface with the application development teams to validate test results for new features/applications, verifying that they meet the requirements of the business before facilitating UAT and deploymentMaintain and document current and new system process flowsProvide day-to-day administration and maintenance of critical business systems including OpenAir and NetSuite. Triaging and resolving production support issues and implementing small enhancement requestsREQUIREMENTS:Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with minimum of 5 years of system administration or application support experience.At least 4-6 years of business systems analyst experience in a global organization utilizing NetSuite3+ years of professional experience supporting a Services/Finance organizationDemonstrated understanding of Services process – Project billing/ resource managementExperience with any Services application – OpenAir or Oracle project accountingExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsExperience with IT compliance controlsKnowledge of project management methodologies (waterfall or agile) a plusDemonstrated ability to remain composed in a dynamic environment and communicate successfully to all levels of employeesExperience in supporting a highly integrated ERP ecosystem with working knowledge of the following systems; NetSuite OpenAir.5+ years of Experience in providing end to end PSA solutions.Understanding of industry best practices implementing solutions for professional services team.

job_title: Systems Analyst (Oracle HCM, Taleo) - Full-Time/Direct Hire (will Sponsor) [Carson, CA]

Advise and assist other ERP Application in areas of special knowledge, i.e. Employee self-service, Manager self-service, Reporting and other HR areas. Experience with SDLC, Agile Methodology and working experience at large companies Experience of working with sourcing vendors/IT partners and remote/offsite employees as well. Conduct meetings with client representatives to identify and create functional requirements. Conduct meetings with Development Team to document technical design requirements. Meet with other members to review completed functional specifications, technical specifications and customizations. Perform systems analysis and design activities. Determine and resolve application and program problems. Assist in the designing custom applications, interfaces, Flow charts, scripts, and its impact on applications, creation and review of test scripts. Document meeting minutes, action items, and issues as assigned.Required EducationBachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent experienceRequired ExperienceRequires minimum of 3-5 years professional IT experience. At least 2-3 years of experience supporting HR cloud applications such Oracle HCM cloud, EBS, Workday and any analytics tool using SQL. Candidate should be experienced with writing complex SQL. Strong analysis skills that have been proven in an application development / ERP implementation environment. Ability to identify and understand problems and/or issues and develop solutions. Proven ability to meet project deadlines. Relevant industry knowledge of widely used systems and subsystems. Ability to manage sub-project tasks, deliverables, and milestones. Strong organizational and analytical skills. Strong verbal and written communication skills, along with the ability to present to mid-level management. Understanding of the Systems Implementation Life Cycle. Proven ability to perform advanced SQL and application specific query skills using various tools. Job Description: Assistant Manager, Business Planning & StrategyCompany:  174 Power Global – Irvine, CaliforniaEmployment Type:  Full-time, Salary, ExemptIndustry:  Renewables & Environment, Solar, Utilities & ConstructionCOMPANY OVERVIEW174 Power Global, headquartered in Irvine, California, is an affiliate company of Hanwha Group, a FORTUNE Global 500 firm that is among the eight largest business enterprises in South Korea. 174 Power Global designs, builds and manages solar power plant solutions. The company brings a decade of global leadership in solar PV to North America, combining best-of-world technology, processes and partnerships to deliver utility-grade solar PV solutions customized for local energy markets. 174 Power Global offers the full spectrum of PV solutions – from power plant development, design, construction, operations and maintenance. With proven capabilities across the solar value chain, 174 Power Global minimizes uncertainty and risk, and helps customers achieve a higher return on their investment in solar energy.POSITION OVERVIEWThe Assistant Manager, Business Planning & Strategy will provide support to the Business Planning & Strategy team to develop solar projects in North America. This position is required to meet tight deadlines and prepare advanced reports with Excel and PowerPoint, in both English and Korean. This position reports to the Head of Planning & Strategy, or another senior management personnel that the President of the Company may designate.Qualified candidates will be able to speak English and Korean, bilingually.This position is located in Irvine, California, and the ideal candidate will be within commutable distance to the Irvine office location. Working hours are Monday through Friday, from 9:00am to 6:00pm, with a 1-hour lunchbreak.RESPONSIBILITIESEstablish mid-to-long term strategies and plans to develop solar projects in North America;Provide detailed financial analysis regarding mid-to-long-term sales plans and forecasts;Forecast 10-year cash flows, P&L for each project and provide detailed explanation to assist executives on business strategy and investment planning;Manage and support the development of PV Solar Projects in the United States;Provide strategic recommendations to the top executives and management-level company members;Provide market research, analysis, and market intelligence of US Renewable market and set goals, such as pipeline, profit, etc.;Implement and manage the processes for project budget and monitor the project budget;Collaborate with relevant parties to create project budget and obtain approval from management to invest projects;Prepare requests for approval of project investment and report to management; andPerforms all other duties and special requests, as assigned by Management.QUALIFICATIONS· Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, or another business-related field;· Minimum of 5-years of experience in the area of financial analysis, or the equivalent;· Bilingual (English and Korean), required;· Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, is required;· Experience in construction or renewable energy industry, preferred;· Previous experience working in a multinational company, preferred;· Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present and explain complex information clearly;· Strong, self-motivated team player;· Assertive, able to cope with pressure, a team player; and· Comfortable working in a fast-moving dynamic, environment.174 Power Global provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. www.174powerglobal.com.Job Type: Full-timeSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:Financial Analyst: 5 years (Preferred)Business Development: 3 years (Preferred)Language:Korean and English, bilingually (Required)Work Location:One locationWork Remotely:Temporarily due to COVID-19COVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Job Summary:The Pricing Analyst role is responsible for ensuring iHerb pricing is competitive and profitable through strategic analysis for all existing and new items. Additionally, this position will be accountable for reporting and explaining to internal constituents the outcome of the various pricing scenarios implemented and helping in the development of guidelines and processes for pricing actions to achieve revenue and margin growth goals.Job Expectations:Develop overall pricing strategy for respective categories collaboratively with respective Category Manager(s) including routine audit of pricing and implementation of new pricing into the system to ensure compliance with overall strategyDevelop and manage price scrapping program determining and configuring rules under the direction of management. Also controlling what items would be priced based on which competitor for all categories and in specific regionsMaintain and configure pricing rules in companies in house software, defining and maintaining the reason or pricing strategy for each rule by brand and/or item exceptionsEstablish consistency in pricing for brands, product lines/groups, and trial/promotions in conjunction with respective Category Manager(s) and Purchasing Manager, regionally if applicableAnalyze category margin, sales volume, and profit performance and provide weekly reports to respective stakeholders about current margin trends, growth, and areas of opportunityCollaborate with the logistics team and buyers to ensure freight costs are properly accounted for in the company's costing structure for pricing of new and existing productsProvide actionable recommendations for improvement for respective categories, including but not limited to: pricing, item mix and rationalization, promotional activity, and procurement trends and patternsDocument pricing processes and update operating procedure manuals based on process changes with assistance from Purchasing Manager and respective Category Manager(s)Additional jobs as assigned by Purchasing ManagerThe duties and responsibilities described above may provide only a partial description of this position. This is not an exhaustive list of all aspects of the job. Other duties and responsibilities not outlined in this document may be added as necessary or desirable, with or without notice.Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Required:Retail and/or pricing experiencePoint of Sale (POS) experience a plusProficiency with Outlook, Teams, Word, and other office suite productsAdvanced excel skillsUnderstanding of the dynamics of price elasticity and consumer price perceptionsAnalytical and problem solving skillsUnderstanding of merchandising terminologyStrong organization skillsAbility to review and analyze large, complex data sets related to pricing strategiesAbility to effectively communicate with all levels of the organizationAbility to work independently, as well as team groupsAbility to manage multiple projectsHigh degree of accuracy and attention to detailExcellent organization skills and ability to multitaskEquipment Knowledge:Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)Experience with Google Business Suite (Gmail, Drive, Docs, Sheets, Forms) preferredExperience Requirements:Generally requires between two (2) to three (3) years of experience.Education Requirements:Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field preferred, or a combination of education and equivalent work experience.Judgment/Reasoning Ability: Able to identify, troubleshoot and resolve problems quickly using sound judgment, poise and diplomacy. job_title: Senior Manager, Business Systems Analyst – Commercial and Medical
description:
At MannKind our employees are our number one asset, and we continue to be a tight-knit community where each of us has a critical role in our success. Committed to diversity, at MannKind we depend on a rich blend of ideas, backgrounds, and working styles in our quest to change the world for the better.

Position Summary:

Located at our headquarters in Westlake Village, CA, and reporting to the Director, Information Technology, the BSA is responsible for functional support for Commercial and Medical systems and processes. They will also effectively identify, analyze, and translate business needs into technology and process solutions.

Principal Responsibilities:

Regularly monitor and evaluate information and data systems that could affect analytical results.Assess system performance and make recommendations for software, hardware, and data storage improvements.Manage all incoming data files.Provide functional and technical support to the business and functional areas.Build strong relationships with key stakeholders built on trust, transparency, and communication across Sales, Marketing, and MedicalGather requirements from business stakeholders, translate those requirements into technical implementation plans and execute plans to provide technology solutions.Manage Salesforce security including roles, profiles, sharing rules, workflows, and groups.Build custom reports, dashboards, and workflows. (Tableau, PowerBI)Collaborate with Commercial Team to create and manage SMS and email journey digital engagement.Maintain database for integrity and accuracy including cleansing and duplicate record management.Automate and manage Salesforce.com data feeds and other integrationsAnalyze business processes and systems, and applications used within defined processes and recommend changes to improve operational efficiencies.Troubleshoot system problems and provide customer support to business users.Maintain all system documentation for the business systems.Ability to use strong industry knowledge to relate to customer needs and dissolve customer concerns and a high level of focus and attention to detail.As a member of the IT organization at MannKind Corp., the incumbent is also expected to be customer-focused, a problem solver, a communicator, professional, willing to learn, organized, and a team player.Duties and responsibilities are not limited to the work listed above and may include other assignments as necessary.

Education and Experience Qualifications:
BS/BA Degree with 5-7 years of related experience in data management or analysis.2+ years Pharmaceutical industry or related healthcare industry experience desiredHands-on Salesforce.com experienceRelevant expertise in using data-handling tools including Excel, and SQL, and able to quickly master new packages when neededAn analytical mindset with superb communication and problem-solving skills.Ability to translate complex problems clearly and in nontechnical terms.Knowledge of computer system validation, 21CFR Part11, and HIPAA regulations.Excellent communications, problem-solving and organizational skills.Must be a self-starter and have the ability to drive results.Resourceful and innovative, willing to think“out of the box” when developing solutions.

MannKind Corporation (NASDAQ:MNKD) focuses on the development and commercialization of inhaled therapeutic products for patients with diseases such as diabetes and pulmonary arterial hypertension. MannKind is currently commercializing Afrezza® (insulin human) inhalation powder, the Company's first FDA-approved product and the only inhaled rapid-acting mealtime insulin in the United States, where it is available by prescription from pharmacies nationwide. MannKind is headquartered in Westlake Village, California, and has a state-of-the-art manufacturing facility in Danbury, Connecticut. The Company also employs field sales and medical representatives across the U.S. For further information, visit www.mannkindcorp.com.

Mannkind Corporation is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of race, creed, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, gender (including pregnancy, breastfeeding or medical condition related to pregnancy or breastfeeding), age, physical or intellectual disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, gender stereotyping, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, genetic characteristic or information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.
