job_title: Sr D365 Supply Chain Functional Consultant
description: Do you enjoy connecting people with technology? So do we.You’re a collaborator who loves solving problems with technology and using your good interpersonal and organizational skills to build positive relationships. We’ll surround you with people who are as passionate about technology and innovation as you are.About youYou’re a natural bridge between consultants and clients, especially when projects are starting up. With your great interpersonal and presentation skills, you establish relationships quickly. You love working in an informal environment where you can use your initiative to realize results.About the jobERP is all about helping businesses simplify complexity and thrive in the digital age. You’ll be solving your client’s challenges and turning their needs into goals and solutions through Microsoft Dynamics 365.Working as part of the ERP team you’ll collect information, analyze requirements and solve problems, providing technical and operational support.In this role, you’ll:*Lead the D365 Supply Chain Workstream*Transform business requirements into a straightforward and technical model, and match processes to application requirements*Prototype and configure processes in Microsoft Dynamics 365 to make sure the system works the way your client needs it to*Lead workshops with your clients, consultants and client leaders to analyze and design solutions for any application, and handle gaps detected during prototyping*Work with the technical team to make sure that your clients' needs are incorporated into the specifications and functions*Create or evaluate a breakdown of your clients’ businesses processes so that you can identify and link functional and non-functional requirements*Documents settings and prepare your clients to use the system*Support testing the proposed system and train users*Travel, as needed.Your skillsYou have a passion for learning teamed with good business sense and time management, and you know how to manage your clients’ expectations effectively. You’ve probably got a Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant field and at least three years of relevant professional experience.Ideally, your experience includes:Experience implementing Microsoft Dynamics 365 Supply Chain module

Title: Senior Financial AnalystDate: 2.1.21 Location: IrvineReports To: FP&A Manager General SummaryParcel Pending is the leading provider of package management solutions for multifamily, residential, commercial, retail, and university properties in the United States and Canada. We deliver over 2 million packages monthly, offering a wide range of solutions that ensure the simple and secure delivery and retrieval of packages and online orders.In 2019, Parcel Pending was acquired by Quadient (formerly Neopost), the global leader in parcel, mailing, customer experience, and business process automation solutions. With the strength of our combined power, reach, and offerings, Parcel Pending by Quadient provides state-of-the-art solutions and world-class customer service to solve the last-mile delivery challenge.Essential Duties/ResponsibilitiesWe offer an exciting, fast-paced work environment, and we currently have an opportunity for a Senior Financial Analyst, allowing you to make an immediate impact on our team and company. Role requires a skilled analyst to scrutinize financial statements, prepare reports for the public parent company and develop a full understanding of what drives the earnings in order to assist in forecasting/budgeting. This individual will be responsible for the following:· Financial analysis. Develop and maintain an understanding of the primary drivers of each type of revenue, cost of sales and operating expense, continually adapting understandings as new products and business verticals are launched.· Leverage accumulated knowledge to assist in the budgeting and forecasting processes.· Prepare key sections of a monthly operations report and reporting deck; assist in development of new reports as needs arise; alternate sections with second SFA, for full understanding of entire deck.· Assist in data governance initiative, standardizing data usage company-wide, establishing policies& procedures; bring patience and tenacity to the task.· Perform ad hoc analyses, employing a creative view on the best way to "solve" the goal of each analytic request.· Stage month-end accounting data for load into forecast model. Research and understand material variances, seeking information to adjust model assumptions if needed.· Ad hoc analyses and assignments.Required Skills & Experience· Degree in Finance or Accounting with a solid understanding of accounting principles and financial statements.· At least 3 years' experience in financial statement analysis with the ability to spot new trends and perform detailed investigation to confirm the underlying causes of emerging trends.· Advanced excel and power point skills absolutely required.· Organized working style, ability to work in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment, multitask and stage workload to meet overlapping deadlines.· Adept at extracting data from multiple systems and integrating into one report.· Strong communicator, written and verbal.What Parcel Pending Offers You: · Company subsidized Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance· 401(k) Retirement Plans –Company Match Offered· Life & Disability Insurance –Company Sponsored· Paid Vacation, Sick Leave, & 11 Company Holidays· Career & Leadership Development· Tuition Reimbursement Program· Veteran Programs· Company Sponsored GroupsClick HERE to learn more about Parcel Pending!Parcel Pending by Quadient does not accept unsolicited resumes and no work authorization assistance is available at this time.DisclaimerThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and levels of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.Parcel Pending, a Quadient Company, is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.Job Types: Full-time, TemporaryPay: From $60,000.00 per yearSchedule:8 hour shiftWork Location:One locationEmployment Length:4 - 6 monthsWork Remotely:NoCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetings

OVERVIEW:

The Marketing Operations Analyst provides insights and analysis to power data-driven decision-making for the Marketing team related to sales operation, account management, compensation, and payroll. The role will create reporting that provides insights and information used to develop and measure the Sales Operations team. The position will report to the Sr. Manager, Marketing Analytics and will also collaborate with the Business Intelligence team and other key stakeholders to develop process improvements for data management and collection.

TEAM OVERVIEW:

The Marketing Analytics team is a dynamic, data driven group which drives all metric planning, analysis, reporting, and optimization efforts across the marketing organization. We produce customer lifetime value data models that assist the department in making better acquisition decisions. We also work across the organization to coordinate and prioritize marketing initiatives with Development and Business Intelligence teams.

COMPANY PERKS:

Competitive pay, 401k with company match, Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Educational Reimbursement, Commuter benefits, Discount programs, Inventor patent bonuses.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:

Stamps.com (NASDAQ: STMP) is the leading provider of postage online and shipping software solutions to customers including consumers, small businesses, e-commerce shippers, enterprises, and high volume shippers. Stamps.com offers solutions that help businesses run their shipping operations more smoothly and function more successfully under the brand names Stamps.com, Endicia®, ShipStation®, ShipEngine®, ShippingEasy®, ShipWorks®, GlobalPost and MetaPack™. Stamps.com’s family of brands provides seamless access to mailing and shipping services through integrations with more than 500 unique partner applications.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Primary Objectives:

Support day-to-day compensation plans for sales and account management.
Monthly Reporting
Implement procedures and controls with a focus on streamlining our process.

Essential Position Duties:

Support day-to-day compensation plans for sales and account management



Demonstrating understanding of compensation plans and policies.
Reviewing and analyzing compensation data.
Performing data analysis.


Monthly Reporting



Generating compensation and payroll reports.
Demonstrating understanding of systems and interdependencies of processes to drive the business toward the development of systems that enable process improvement.


Implement procedure and controls with a focus on streamlining our process



Seek out improvements in current internal reporting and performance monitoring to drive more accuracy, better insights, and more streamlined processes
Master large data sets with SQL and Tableau
Manage multiple data sources and perform data management and data cleansing processes
Analyze results and prepare reports and presentations detailing recommendations for action to senior management


Perform other duties as assigned

Additional Job Duties:

Sit for prolonged periods of time
Utilize wrist and hands for a prolonged period of time
Walk short distances
Stand for short periods
Speaking and conversing with others
Lift up to 25lbs without assistance up to chest height

QUALIFICATIONS:

Education and/or Experience:

Bachelor’s degree, preferably in a quantitative/analytical field.
Three or more (3+) years of extensive hands-on data analytics experience.
‪‪Advanced Excel skills and having experience creating reports and running ad hoc analysis preferred.
Experience with visualization software such as (Tableau/ Power BI) is a plus.

Skills and Knowledge:

Knowledge of Customer Relationship Management tools, especially Salesforce.com is preferred.
Excellent analytical and fact-based problem-solving skills, including ability to analyze large amounts of data and be able to make recommendations based on identification of trend and gaps along with creating forecasts based on historical data
Must be a self-starter and ready to work in an intense but fun environment with our existing team of marketing professionals
Strong communication and relationship-building skills
Self-motivated individual who is able to prioritize and multi-task
Works well under pressure and able to meet tight deadlines

Computer/Software/Application Proficiency:

Advanced MS Excel
MS Access, Tableau, Power BI, and/or SQL is strongly preferred

Travel Requirements:

None

Brady Corporation is an international manufacturer and marketer of complete solutions that identify and protect people, products and places. Brady's products help customers increase safety, security, productivity and performance and include high-performance labels, signs, safety devices, printing systems and software. Founded in 1914, the Company has a diverse customer base in electronics, telecommunications, manufacturing, electrical, construction, medical, aerospace and a variety of other industries. Brady is headquartered in Milwaukee, Wisconsin and as of July 31, 2020, employed approximately 5,400 people in its worldwide business. Brady's fiscal 2020 sales were approximately $1.08 billion. Brady stock trades on the New York Stock Exchange under the symbol BRC. More information is available on the Internet at www.bradycorp.com.Do you like solving mysteries? Do you refuse to accept things at face value? When you're channel flipping, do you find yourself stopping at "How It's Made" and thinking - "wow, so that's how they do that." Sound like you? Then you may be the Sr strategic analyst we're seeking.Come join our team to uncover opportunities, resolve problems and engineer solutions. We're a small team committed to continually improve through creativity, drive, determination and a keen focus on data. We believe numbers drive strategy, but we also believe you need to get out of your chair, roll up your sleeves and really get into the business. Bring us your problem solving analytical skills and learn how a business truly works with us.Who We AreWe're a manufacturer. We're an innovator. We make things that people need. Brady Corporation is a 105 year old company that stands by its motto of "We identify and protect people, products and premises." The PDC division of Brady is all about people - literally that's our customer set. We make hospital wristbands and labels; RFID wristbands for waterparks; and woven wristbands for music festivals. We also make ID cards and the software that gets you into the office, as well as, the lanyards and badge holders for your ID. If it identifies and protects a person, we aim to make it.So, what activities will you be involved in?Strategy: Help solve problems and identify opportunitiesData: Distill the data into actionable insights.Planning & Analysis: Undertake scenario analysis and research projects to drive financial growthProject Management: Lead the movement for process improvementCollaborate: Join forces for maximum impactAdditional tasks as assigned by managerWhat We Are Looking ForBachelor's degree, preferably in an engineering, science, computer or math-related fieldMaster's degree a plusExperience in SQL, and strong understanding of relational database structuresProficiency in data reporting / analysis software; strong preference for Alteryx and TableauExperience in evaluating business processes and driving efficiency improvements leveraging technology (we do case interviews, so suit up)Familiarity and overall understanding of ERP systems; strong preference for SAPAbility to apply concepts of Algebra, Statistics and ProbabilitySolid foundation in mid-2000's pop trivia - we're trying to build up our pub trivia team and we're a bit weak here.Proven organizational skills and attention to detail (duh)Demonstrated ability to effectively work with and communicate with senior managementExperience with Salesforce a plusProject management experience a plusBenefitsComplete insurance coverage starting on first day of employment - medical, dental, vision, life401(k) with company matchPretty decent coffeeIn Valencia, so you're against traffic if you're coming from LA, which is pretty coolTuition reimbursementBonus opportunityVacation and Holiday pay

Description

The Compliance Analyst is part of a team of professionals dedicated to assessing, identifying, and mitigating legal and regulatory risk in the company. The Compliance Analyst fosters a culture of compliance within the company and supports the company's Compliance Management System by performing the following:

Perform risk assessments by applying knowledge of applicable laws to business operationsWrite risk-based test plans; test, analyze, and document findings; communicate results to management via written reports and oral presentations; and follow up with operational staff to guide and ensure corrective action is completeEnsure policies and procedures accurately reflect current laws and management intent; draft and modify written policies, procedures, and consumer-facing forms as needed; track version control; and collect approvals and distributeMonitor training due dates, send reminders, and follow up with managersCoordinate with third party service providers to conduct initial or ongoing due diligenceConduct complaint analysis for trends and root causes and help develop and execute work plans to address such root causesCollect and organize information and documentation for regulatory exams and third party audits Perform special projects, compile data, prepare and analyze reports, conduct transactional reviews, and perform other related tasks as assigned by the Chief Compliance Officer

Education

Bachelor's Degree (BA / BS) from a four-year college or university

Work Experience

The ideal candidate will have 4+ years experience working in a compliance, legal, or risk function of a consumer finance company (preferably auto finance).

Skills and Competencies

Advanced computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel and Power Point. Knowledge of the law that governs our industry, including but not limited to the ECOA, FCRA, FDCPA, GLBA, SCRA, TCPA, TILA and UDAAP. Strong analytical and problem solving skills. Demonstrated ability to handle multiple projects, prioritize, and meet deadlines while maintaining a high degree of accuracy. Self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Experience managing projects, developing helpful relationships, and coordinating with stakeholders.

Lobel Financial is an Equal Opportunity employer.Job Posted by ApplicantPro

description: DescriptionAbout this roleYour TeamThe Aladdin Product Group (APG) sits at the heart of BlackRock, responsible for crafting, building, and operating Aladdin. And, of course, discounts on Stanley Black & Decker tools and products and well as discount programs for many other vendors and partners.What You’ll Also GetCareer Opportunity: Career paths aren’t linear here. Being part of our global company with 60+ brands gives you the chance to grow and develop your skills along multiple career paths.Learning & Development: Our lifelong learning philosophy means you’ll have access to a wealth of state-of-the-art learning resources, including our Lean Academy and online university (where you can get certificates and specializations from renowned colleges and universities).Diverse & Inclusive Culture: We pride ourselves on being an awesome place to work. job_title: Data Management Business Analyst-Sourcing Analytics, CT or Remote
description: Come Build The World With Us!This is the career you’ve been waiting for your whole life. Joining the Stanley Black & Decker team means working in an innovative, tech-driven and highly collaborative team environment supported by over 58,000 professionals in 60 countries across the globe. Here, you’ll get the unique chance to impact some of the world’s most iconic brands including STANLEY TOOLS, DEWALT, CRAFTSMAN, MAC TOOLS and Black & Decker. Your ideas and solutions have the potential to reach millions of customers as we work together to write the next chapter in our history. Come build with us and take your career to new heights.Who We AreWe’re the World’s largest tool company. We’re industry visionaries. We’re solving problems and advancing the manufacturing trade through innovative technology and our Industry 4.0 Initiative. We are committed to ensuring our state-of-the-art “smart factory” products and services provide greater quality to our customers & greater environmental and social value to our planet. We are unique in that we have a rich and storied history dating back to 1843, but that hasn't stopped us from evolving into a vibrant, diverse, global growth company.Who You AreYou’re a curious problem solver who has the ability to bring big ideas to life. You’re creative and scrappy but can navigate a large organization with ease. You’re agile and adaptable but work with precision to ensure we deliver top-notch customer experiences, always. You also have:Bachelor’s degree in a technical field of study: Computer Science/engineering, Data Analytics or related fieldMaster’s Degree preferredExperience working on business analytics projects preferredSolid understanding of business functions and common data sources / models e.g., Sales, Marketing, Finance, Manufacturing, Operations including supply chain, sourcing and logistics2+ years’ experience in business analysis and projects related to Data ManagementKnowledge and hands-on application of database technologies (SQL, Hive, Hadoop, etc.)Ability to query databases using programming languages (e.g. SAS, R, Python, etc.) to manipulate and draw insights from large data setsCandidate should be comfortable with Data Modelling and Warehousing concepts (relational & non-relational) and Data ArchitectureMust possess excellent analysis and data logic skillsMust be detail oriented and possess strong problem-solving skillsStrong verbal and written communication skills, either remotely or in personExperience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Qlik Sense, PowerBi, Business Objects etc. is a plusAbility to manage multiple projects simultaneouslyStrong teaming skills, collaborative style and commitment to continuous professional growthApply superior judgment as it pertains to prioritizing work for yourself and others and escalating roadblocks when necessaryDemonstrated ability to partner with various projects and teams while interfacing with business stakeholders to ensure value deliveryWhat You’ll DoStanley Black & Decker (SBD) is looking for a Data Management Business Analyst to join the Center of Excellence, Strategic Sourcing team. The Data Analyst role will be key member in establishing and maintaining Enterprise Data Assets. S/he will be responsible for management, integrity and usability of data.The ideal candidate will have strong technology skills to be able to lead robust data solutions that leverage disparate datasets, data warehousing and reporting technologies as well as Master Data Management platforms.S/he will partner with Business stakeholders globally and SBD’s IT team to ensure that the organization has the necessary data sets, integration of the ERP data sets with other source data, and governance to effectively leverage data to derive procurement insights. Working with peers in strategic sourcing, operations, finance and other business functions, you will be responsible for:Partner with business leaders on data analytics use cases to drive the understanding and adoption of advanced analytics within the business.Responsible to understand business, conceptualize and analyze data framework.Define data requirements and coordinate implementation with business partners and vendors for solution design and delivery.S/he will play a key role in deploying Data Governance practices and execute key strategies for the Enterprise Data Management and Analytics OrganizationDevelop and maintain data landscape maps and data source inventories/data catalogsAble to perform data quality / cleansing, de-duplication and harmonization of data across for various systems. Work closely and share ideas with fellow Architects, Developers and Technical Project ManagersS/he will be responsible to work with product owner & vendor team, to ensure that the lead time to deploy changes is continuously improvingEnsure compliance and bare minimums with respect to quality and audit is metSolicit and rationalize ideas and featuresEstimate work effort required to deliver specific bodies of workPartner with stakeholders to define high level areas of opportunity that align to enterprise directionBrainstorm potential technical solutions that meet business needs, deliver value, and enable scaleBenefits & PerksYou’ll get a competitive salary and a comprehensive benefits plan that includes medical, dental, life, vision, wellness program, disability, 401k, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Paid Time Off, including paid vacation, holidays & personal days, and tuition reimbursement. And, of course, discounts on Stanley Black & Decker tools and products and well as discount programs for many other vendors and partners.What You’ll Also GetCareer Opportunity: Career paths aren’t linear here. Being part of our global company with 60+ brands gives you the chance to grow and develop your skills along multiple career paths.Learning & Development: Our lifelong learning philosophy means you’ll have access to a wealth of state-of-the-art learning resources, including our Lean Academy and online university (where you can get certificates and specializations from renowned colleges and universities).Diverse & Inclusive Culture: We pride ourselves on being an awesome place to work. We respect and embrace differences because that’s how the best work gets done. You’ll find we like to have fun here, too.Purpose-Driven Company: You’ll help us continue to make positive changes in the local communities where we work and live as well as in the broader world through volunteerism, giving back and sustainable business practices.SBD is one of the world's largest, fastest growing and most dynamic companies. SBD, a Fortune 200 company is a world-leading provider of tools and storage, commercial electronic security and engineered fastening systems, with unique growth platforms and a track record of sustained profitable growth.#LI-SZ1EEO:All qualified applicants to Stanley Black & Decker are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran’s status or any other protected characteristic.Requisition Number75146BRBusinessUS - Global Strategic SourcingNo. of Positions1EEO StatementAll qualified applicants to Stanley Black & Decker are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran’s status or any other protected characteristic.FunctionData AnalyticsFeatured Category on SBD CareersProduct & Strategy, Supply Management & Operations

job_title: New York Risk & Compliance – Risk Senior Consultant
description: Are You Ready to Live Protiviti?The Protiviti Career provides opportunity to learn, inspire and advance within a collaborative and diverse company culture. We hire curious people for whom learning is an everyday activity. We fuel your curiosity with challenging work, talented colleagues and creative learning resources. At every level, we champion leaders who influence and achieve results. We encourage you to “bring your whole self to work” – all of your motivations, passions, priorities and commitments – as these things bring us closer to exceptional.That's Living Protiviti.We strive to recruit and hire the best talent, and it does not stop there. Once you join us, we promise to help you bring your career to life through exceptional work experiences, a culture passionate about learning and development, and a dedication to what matters to you.Are you inspired to make a difference?Then you have come to the right place.Where We Need You:The Charlotte office is seeking a Risk and Compliance Senior Consultant to join our growing team.What You Can Expect:The Senior Consultant coaches Interns, Consultants, and facilitates the successful completion of project work plan. Serving as both role model and trainer, the Senior Consultant demonstrates the attributes of excellent client service and assists team members in developing technical and professional competency. The Senior Consultant learns to identify areas of risk and opportunities to improve efficiencies. Relationships with client personnel and professional associates strengthen as the ability to communicate, gain trust and network improves. At the direction of managers, the Senior Consultant may accept responsibility for decision-making, ranging from staffing and preparation of deliverables to application of methodologies.What Will Help You Be Successful:You enjoy identifying areas of business risk, potential technical problems, and opportunities to improve the efficiency and profitability of the client’s overall business processes.You are passionate about evaluating, synthesizing, organizing and interpreting data and information.You create a positive work environment that fosters open communication among all engagement team members.You effectively build relationships with your clients and provide them with timely top quality service.You have an inherent interest in project management and team leadership. You seek new ways to create extraordinary development opportunities and ways for your team to make an impact on our clients and communities.Do Your Talents Include the Following?Advanced verbal and written communication skills, including documentation of findings and recommendations.A solid foundation in risk and compliance processes and objectives.Knowledge of key banking or insurance regulations.An understanding of core business processes related to banking, insurance and asset management.Understanding of commonly used internal control frameworks, risk frameworks and regulatory/compliance methodologies.Knowledge of risk and compliance methodologies and developing key deliverables, including process flows, work programs, reports, and control summaries.Ability to work with a diverse portfolio of clients in banking or insurance.Mentoring and advising junior staff.Your Educational and Professional Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree from accredited university in relevant academic area or equivalent relevant work experience3+ years working in internal audit, consulting, assurance services, or related field, either in professional services or industry.Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite applications with specific emphasis on Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Secondary emphasis on Visio and Access.Professional Certification such as CPA, CIA, FRM or similar strongly preferred.Do You Love Exploring New Places?We travel throughout the month frequently based upon client requests/commitments. Travel may include suburban, regional, or out of state locations.

Company DescriptionUncommon Schools is a nonprofit network of high-performing charter public schools that are closing the academic achievement gap and preparing students from historically underserved communities for success in college and beyond. Uncommon currently manages 55 schools serving more than 20,000 students in six cities: Boston, Camden, New York City, Newark, Rochester, and Troy. Uncommon graduates persist in and graduate from college at rates far higher than their peers. We believe that every child deserves an outstanding education, and we are committed to working beyond the walls of our schools to achieve that goal through our professional development workshops, books, and district partnerships.Job DescriptionTeam Overview

Uncommon’s Data & IT (D&IT) team is undergoing an exciting transformation to improve technology operations and systems! We are seeking a skilled Technical Analyst with experience in large-scale ERP implementations, ongoing management of the ERP system, and management of data housed in the system. This role will act as a domain specialist on our ERP projects and collaborate with all levels of the Talent, Accounting, Finance, IT, and school-based teams and will supervise the planning, prioritization, and execution of the system roadmap!

Role Overview

The Analyst supports the ERP System Managers to ensure the functionality, including but not limited to change management, optimization, and system security. This role is also responsible for supporting them with documentation of system processes and procedures, assisting in the training of a variety of end-users.

Core Duties & Responsibilities

Integration Development & Management

In collaboration with the ERP System Manager, design, test, program and develop system improvements and/or modifications as they fit into our customer and user requirementsPrepare and maintain the vital documentation for proposed changesServe as a domain specialist, including on system architectureAbility to communicate ideas in user-friendly and technical languageCommitted to ensuring the accurate adoption, maintenance, and support of our ERP system and to improve our operational efficiencyLead system upgrades, ensure data backups, test new features, and functionality additionsIndependently create detailed communication and change management plans for workstreams including simple, creative ways to explain sophisticated information for clear decision-makingCollaborate with Talent, Accounting, Finance, and Operations team leaders to identify and implement methods for improving current processes, promoting process standardization, efficiency, and standard methodologies within the bounds of the system.Collaborate with System Managers to design and maintain a technology ecosystem that takes full advantage of the features available in each platform and collectively follow the IT change request processSupervise application integration with 3rd parties' applications, including reporting/business intelligence systems, and payroll.Stay up-to-date on the latest technology and software for integration to improve processes and user interaction with Workday.Translate business needs into detailed requirements and solutions that allow Workday capabilities and functionality to drive efficiencies and process maturityCreate technical requirements documentation, processes and deliver training to partners

Report Development

Responsible for all steps of report writing, including gathering requirements, designing, developing, and testing new reportsDevelop reports of varying complexity, layouts, and analytics for business purposes

Technical expertise

Provide domain expertise on Workday Reporting standard methodologiesBecome a Workday specialist with deep knowledge of current functionality and the ecosystem design conceptsIdentify new ways that Workday can be used and future product direction

Training

Support the implementation and roll-out of new features or modules within Workday

Organizational Relationships

Work closely with functional teams across the organization, including HCM, Compensation, Payroll, Benefits, Financials, and Talent, along with members of the Data and IT Team


QualificationsRequired Skills & Abilities

High attention to detailSolid understanding of APIs used for Workday integrationsAbility to work on multiple projects and change priorities as neededGood interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate with others, at all levelsExcellent verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to translate complex requirementsExperience in building and maintaining Workday reports, including calculated fieldsCommitment to providing access to meaningful dataDemonstrable ability to diagnose issues, identify root causes, and implement effective solutionsProven analytical and problem-solving skillsComfort with ambiguityA willingness to take ownership of an issue, and drive it to resolutionStrong organizational systems for both self and others to ensure accountability for timely, high-quality outcomes

Preferred Skills & Abilities

Experience with data extraction and creating structured data setsSolid understanding of SQL or other data specific programming languagesWorkday certified

Educational Requirements

Job Summary

The Senior Business Analyst, Information Systems plays a critical role in the partnership between eMoney business stakeholders and the Information Systems team. This strategic and hands-on role combines deep understanding and analysis of cross-functional operations with systems knowledge to drive delivery of prioritized initiatives. The Senior Business Analyst develops and maintains productive working relationships with stakeholders, vendors, key business owners and peers to drive enterprise goals.

The ideal candidate will seamlessly balance progress across strategic initiatives, partnering with stakeholders, the Information Systems Product Owner, and development team members on both architectural direction and detailed requirements for large-scale solutions, features, enhancements and issues related to the end-to-end technology ecosystem. Through development of subject matter expertise, the Senior Business Analyst will create working groups that bring together diverse skill sets and business perspectives, lead the aggregation, analysis, and documentation of operational and technical business requirements, and continually confirm alignment with vision. By creating and providing clear, well-refined requirements to Product Owners and developers, this role directly impacts the design, timing, and implementation of prioritized business solutions.

The Senior Business Analyst will act as a leader to initiative working groups, bringing perspective, guidance, and project management that represents shared priorities, mitigating risk and identifying opportunities for collaboration and economies of scale. In addition, they are a key point of communication back to stakeholders, business owners, and end users, determining organizational readiness, evangelizing solutions, building adoption, and promoting the effective use of data, information, and technology to inform decisions.

Job Responsibilities

Apply technical and operational subject matter expertise, best practices, and thought leadership around the internal tech stack to lead and influence solution design related to various business systemsDevelop and feed the development team backlogs; partner with Product Owners on ongoing prioritization, refinement, communications, and expectations (development team and business owners across business units)Collaborate with end users, business owners and leadership in the design and development of business requirements, reporting and data needs, workflows, use cases, complex user story mapping, test scripts, and training materialsDrive development teams to delivery by exploring and documenting solutions, which may include tool implementations, workflow/process engineering, and/or system modificationsRepresent specific business areas in cross-functional teams to build economies of scale, tighter integrations, improved handoffs, timely data sharing, and greater overall cohesion within each functional area of the organization and the enterpriseTeam with the Data and Analytics program in representing business area priorities and client experiences to discern patterns, areas for improvement, data gaps, and opportunitiesCollaborate with leadership and wider cross-functional teams to refine and build processes that optimize client experiences and enhance client experience data captureUnderstand complex and/or competing business needs and translate them into functional requirementsAct as a bi-directional point of contact between operations, business owners, end users and the Internal Systems team building and managing the initiative backlog and communicating priorities, risks, and timelinesWrite functional test cases and work with Quality Assurance in the areas of auditing and testingCultivate systems subject matter expertise through management of vendor relationships, product ownership, and application administrationManage and run User Acceptance testing, following feature development through to production and ensure successful long-term delivery through customer feedback and KPIs

Requirements

Bachelors degree or related field or equivalent experience required5-7 years of Business Analysis or Solutions Architect experience, preferably in a SaaS environment and/or in the financial services/fintech industrySalesforce/CRM, Zuora/ERP, and/or Marketing Automation Platform experience

Skills

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbalAbility to translate business requirements into technical specifications including User Story MappingAbility to resolve conflicting end-user requirements and competing prioritiesTeam player with the ability to adapt to changing priorities and goalsCapable of articulating needs and opportunities, translating findings for technical and nontechnical audiencesDisplays intellectual curiosity and business acumenProven ability to achieve results and effect changeStrong analytical, problem solving and diagnostic skillsTop notch organizational skills and ability to work within processesDetail oriented

The Systems Analyst who will serve as a primary contact for any questions related to system functionality from both a business and technical perspective. The Systems Analyst partners with business representatives to translate business requirements into technical specifications, as well as partners with CEB IT and vendors to develop logical technical processes. The Systems Analyst also performs interdependency analysis related to system upgrades and changes. This includes assisting with system upgrades and enhancements to ensure that project tasks are completed on schedule. The Systems Analyst must have the ability to perform support and analysis tasks independently or with minimum guidance.ResponsibilitiesPartners with business representatives and technical teams to understand system goals and business requirements in order to develop technical system requirements.Coordinates small project initiativesCreates technical specifications and processes using structured Business System Analyst - Contract

 Job DetailsLevel ExperiencedJob Location Corporate Headquarters - Plymouth Meeting, PARemote Type N/APosition Type ContractorEducation Level Bachelor's degree preferredSalary Range UndisclosedTravel Percentage NegligibleJob Shift DayJob Category Information TechnologyDescription POSITION SUMMARY

Support ECRI Institute's 50-year mission of advancing effective evidence-based healthcare worldwide. Work with IT Development Managers, teams of ECRI Platform & Software Engineers, and our respected and accomplished business partners, working together virtually at ECRI's scenic suburban world headquarters in Plymouth Meeting, PA. Benefit from a healthy work-life balance while staying on the leading edge of technology and thriving in an innovative startup-like culture minus the risk. Sleep well knowing you are helping achieve a world where safe, high-quality healthcare is accessible to everyone.

As part of the Information Technology Team a Business System Analyst under the guidance of the BSA Manager and respective development managers participates in the creation of new products and features from the idea stage to launch. In this role, the Business Systems Analyst acts as the liaison between the business stakeholders and the development team to create user stories and acceptance criteria to support the development of high-quality desktop, browser-based and native mobile applications across multiple projects used by ECRI business users and thousands of organizations in the USA and worldwide. This is a Contract position that is also virtual/remote work. We are ONLY accepting direct applicants, not via agencies.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Reasonable Accommodations Statement

To accomplish this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform, with or without reasonable accommodation, each essential function satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to help enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Essential Functions Statements(s)

Participate on an agile team as a Business Systems Analyst
Partner with business stakeholders to create and define User Stories and Acceptance Criteria that meet the business need.
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the acceptance criteria to ensure that requirements are correctly interpreted.
Partner with UX Designer to clearly define and document software design and usability.
Create, edit, prioritize and manage the backlog of User Stories
Participate in planning, estimation, daily standup and retrospective meetings
Responsible for reviewing and accepting completed User Stories
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of the requirements to stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Deliver internal training on new feature enhancements or products to the business unit.

Accountability Metrics:

Requirements which meet the needs of the market as defined by the business
On time high quality delivery of projects


Qualifications Experience:

3+ years' experience as a Business Systems Analyst
3+ years' experience in Agile Methodologies (Scrum, Kanban)
Healthcare business experience preferred
Knowledge of Content Management Systems, Contentful preferred
Proficient in all aspects of the Software Development Life Cycle
Experience using issue tracking tools to manage the release process
Highly self-motivated and directed with a keen attention to detail.
Excellent written, oral, interpersonal, and presentational skills
Proven experience working with cross-functional and virtual teams
Strong team player with ability to multi-task
Experience working with Content Management Systems (like Contentful), cloud computing platforms (like Azure) and/or search analytics engines (like Elasticsearch) a plus.
Regional resident preferred, must be available during ECRI core hours, 10 am to 3 pm EST, onsite attendance at Assigned Location may be required up to 20% a month.

Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field preferred, or equivalent experience

Computer Skills:

Proficient with Microsoft Office 2007+
Proficient with Microsoft Visio
Proficient with Atlassian Jira or other issue tracking tools
Proficient with Atlassian Confluence or other collaboration tools

job_title: Business Systems Analyst - Service and Finance
description: Business Systems Analyst – Services and FinanceIntapp helps firms shift to a modernization strategy and gain a growth edge in today’s competitive marketplace. We offer intelligent solutions built for partner-led firms– spanning the entire client lifecycle, from strategy through origination and execution. Intapp is looking for a highly motivated team player for the key role of Business Systems Analyst, supporting Services and Finance within the Business Applications group.As a member of our Enterprise Applications Team, you will be helping to maintain and support Intapp’s cloud-based Enterprise Applications portfolio consisting of Project management/resourcing, project billing and Accounting solutions.As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for administering and supporting Intapp’s Services and Finance systems. You will be responsible for coordinating with key business partners regarding their business requirements and functioning as the functional lead for services and finance systems and design. The ideal candidate should have demonstrated skills in understanding and adhering to policies, procedures, and operating controls to ensure consistency and timeliness of execution. They will also need to be able to combine business process knowledge with a deep technical understanding of related systems and software to help identify and implement scalable solutions.ResponsibilitiesFunction as an analyst and business partner to the professional services and accounting teams to model, design, and build business solutions that improve and scale Intapp’s Services and finance processesResponsible for owning services and accounting system configuration - Configure fields, workflows, roles/permissions, custom rules, reports, and dashboardsAbility to explain technical objects or designs in non-technical terms for business partners (i.e. being able to digest something like a workflow & tell the business what it does without being too technical)Experience with integrations and the flow of data across multiple systems is a plusKnowledge of both business and IT process design and best practicesCollaborate with Services and Finance teams to define requirements and manage expectations from project inception through delivery, including status updates, issue resolution, scope changes, UAT, deployment, etcWork with business leadership, internal/external development resources and suppliers to ensure timely, accurate and cost-effective delivery of IT solutionsCreate and execute test cases for unit/regression testing; Interface with the application development teams to validate test results for new features/applications, verifying that they meet the requirements of the business before facilitating UAT and deploymentMaintain and document current and new system process flowsProvide day-to-day administration and maintenance of critical business systems including OpenAir and NetSuite. Triaging and resolving production support issues and implementing small enhancement requestsREQUIREMENTS:Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with minimum of 5 years of system administration or application support experience.At least 4-6 years of business systems analyst experience in a global organization utilizing NetSuite3+ years of professional experience supporting a Services/Finance organizationDemonstrated understanding of Services process – Project billing/ resource managementExperience with any Services application – OpenAir or Oracle project accountingExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsExperience with IT compliance controlsKnowledge of project management methodologies (waterfall or agile) a plusDemonstrated ability to remain composed in a dynamic environment and communicate successfully to all levels of employeesExperience in supporting a highly integrated ERP ecosystem with working knowledge of the following systems; NetSuite OpenAir.5+ years of Experience in providing end to end PSA solutions.Understanding of industry best practices implementing solutions for professional services team.

We are Radial, the leader in Omnichannel commerce technologies and operations. We enable our clients to profitably exceed customer expectations by taking on the complexity of their Omnichannel retail business and transforming it into a seamlessly orchestrated customer experience.To bring order to ordering. To make fulfillment more fulfilling. To keep commerce clicking. When we partner with our clients to execute their orders, payments, fulfillment, or customer care, our clients’ promises become ours. The analyst will use critical thinking in challenging traditional/classical work platforms and processes (e.g. Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint, intranet sites) to promote effective and efficient ways of working in an agile, project intensive and remote work environment.Primary QualificationsTechnology enthusiast/savvy and very fast learnerAbility to work both independently and as part of a teamFirst experience in managing projects with timeline and key deliverables is preferredAdvanced knowledge of Microsoft Teams is preferredExpert knowledge of key Microsoft Office 365 suite of products: Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, OneNote, Forms, OneDrive, SharePointPrior knowledge of Smartsheet is preferredGood presentation skills (PowerPoint)Demonstrated integrity, independent thinking, judgment, and respect for othersEarly adopter of newer productivity improvement toolsChange agent mindset to actively promote tools adoption within the broader organization

job_title: Claims Analyst III, Cyber/Tech/Media and Employment Practice Liability (EPL)
description: Who we areAmerican International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. Building on 100 years of experience, today AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance, life insurance, retirement solutions, and other financial services to customers in more than 80 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets, manage risks and provide for retirement security.Get to know the businessGeneral Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services for commercial and personal insurance customers. It includes one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. General Insurance offers a broad range of products to customers through a diversified, multichannel distribution network.Our Claims professionals support AIG policyholders through some of the most trying times. When our clients face losses large and small, we step up to help them ease the financial burdens of catastrophic events like fires and hurricanes; we help them get their businesses back up and running again or recoup the value of a lost family heirloom or a prized possession. Our Claims team is an industry leader, drawing daily on its unparalleled levels of expertise to offer our clients the highest levels of stewardship to drive total cost of claim improvement and consistent outcomes. AIG manages claims using a wealth of technical and market knowledge about risks, business practices, and the ever-evolving legal and regulatory environment.About the roleWhat you need to know:We have opportunities within both Cyber/Tech/Media Claims and Employment Practice Liability (EPL) Claims.As a Claims Analyst III, you will handle claims from inception through conclusion of Professional Liability matters, including Cyber, Network Security, Business Interruption, Media and Technology exposures or Employment Practice Liability exposures.This position reports to the Assistant Vice President, Claims.Investigate/evaluate coverage, litigation management and settlement negotiation.Explore the use of technology, structured settlements, and other means to find strategic and cost-effective claims resolutions.Interface with insureds, brokers and counsel to resolve claims.Effectively analyze and budget the litigation of each claim on pending through timely discussions with counsel, vendors and insureds.Determine judgmental value on all files in pending within a reasonable time frame and make presentations to management as necessary.Travel for mediation attendance and trials as necessary.Other responsibilities as needed.What we are looking forSome experience as a claims or litigation professional.Financial experience preferred.Ability to analyze policies of insurance and legal documents.Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively and professionally interact with brokers, insureds, counsel and other industry professionals.Strong interpersonal and organizational skills.Strong computer skills (Microsoft Office).Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent required. Multi-state adjuster licenses and/or JD highly preferred.A look at our benefitsAt AIG, we have a 100-year legacy of working to make the world a better place. And that begins with our employees. We’re proud to offer a range of employee benefits and resources that help you protect what matters most – your health care, savings, financial protection, and wellbeing. We provide a variety of leaves for personal, health, family, and military needs. For example, the “Giving Back” program allows you to take up to 16 hours a year to volunteer in your community.We also believe in fostering our employees’ development and offer a range of learning opportunities for employees to hone their professional skills to position themselves for the next steps of their careers. AIG also has a tuition reimbursement program for eligible employees to enhance their education, skills, and knowledge in areas that relate to their current position or future positions to which they may transfer or progress.We are an Equal Opportunity EmployerIt has been and will continue to be the policy of American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. As a Business Intelligence (BI) Manager you will lead a team that strategically supports the commercial organization by integrating data from a variety of sources, generating key insights. You love large projects, working cross functionally and are always seeking to better understand the nuances of the business so you can improve process to produce stronger analytics for the organization. You will be a thought leader and subject matter expert in depletion reporting programs iDig, Compass, and Diver.

Responsibilities:

Performance Management/ Systems & Training

Lead team of two analysts and be responsible for end to end delivery of the BI agenda, including depletion reporting, sales team KPI planning and monitoring, syndicated data, and other various ad hoc BI related projects. Process Reviews: Monitor and analyze department work to develop more efficient processes. Data Quality: Continually monitor the validity and quality of data in all BI related tools. Ability to serve as technical and subject matter expert and liaison with IT on the translation of business requirements and implementation of BI platforms and tools. Responsible for Data Integration projects for Data Warehouse. Reporting: Manage the collection, analysis and production of all BI products in order to consolidate data into strategic analysis, make conclusions and provide recommendations to the business. Design and develop stories and visualizations to communicate insights and recommendations to Senior Leadership and other stakeholders. Training: Develop and maintain a training program for the team Analysts (“train the trainer”), to include utilization of analytical tools to monitor activities, analyze impact (ROI), and ensure accountability to deliver against MJUS KPIs.

Requirements

Bachelor’s degree required 5+ years of experience in Business Intelligence or related field Beverage Alcohol industry background a plus, with strong track record of driving both business performance & process improvement People management experience Strong understanding of database architectures for BI operations Experience with data cleansing, harmonization and validation a plus Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite, especially excel and power point Strong technical skills, knowledge of IRI, iDig, Diver, and Compass a must SAP experience a plus

A Career with Point72's Technology Team

As Point72 reimagines the future of investing, our Technology group is constantly improving our company’s IT infrastructure, positioning us at the forefront of a rapidly evolving technology landscape. We’re a team of experts experimenting, discovering new ways to harness the power of open source solutions, and embracing enterprise agile methodology. We encourage professional development to ensure you bring innovative ideas to our products while satisfying your own 


What You'll Do:

We are embarking on a build out of the centralized reference data platform for Point72. Reference Data team will build out several data domains such as Security Master, People Master, Account Master & Entity Master. Business Analyst in Reference Data Engineering will help build out the central reference data solutions and consolidate multiple iterations of reference systems into single sources.

Ideal candidate will bring wealth of experience in building reference data platforms at large asset management firms. Candidate should have extensive experience working with large data vendors such Bloomberg and Refinitive, experience with MDM platform and should have good understanding of the financial business processes.

The role will require experience interacting with technology leaders & SME’s, business SME’s and operations partners. 


Key Responsibilities / Duties:
Business Analysis – Requirement gathering, functional analysis, data analysis, functional and technical specifications development, documentation and estimation for strategic projects, vendor driven changes and business initiativesPartner with business and technology users in Trading, Middle office, Operations, Risk and Compliance area, understand and document their processes, concerns and data usage. Devise data solutions to address the emerging needs of the business.Develop, coordinate and elicit approvals from stakeholder on Data Models, Data Quality, ETL processes and Data distributions.Provide subject matter expertise on data processes, asset classes, data vendors, data lifecycle and reference data frameworkReverse engineer functional specs from existing processes and data, study existing data constructs and propose changes to improve efficiency and STPCoordinate with Business, Technology and Operations leadership to align goals, deliverables, needs and status of deliverables
Work Experience / Knowledge:
Minimum 8 years experience as a Business AnalystMinimum 4 years of working on MDM platform for Security Master or Account MasterStrong background in financial reference data and capital marketsFinancial Data modelling experience Strong data analysis and data mining capabilities including SQL Data oriented and excellent attention to details Experience of business process reengineering, system analysis and development Project management experience with Agile Ability to communicate well with different audiences with clarity and conciseness demonstrated by well-developed written and verbal skills, and the ability to deliver content to large groups BA/BS in computer sciences or finance disciplines or extensive experience in reference data buildout

We Take Care of our People

We invest in our people, their careers, their health, and their well-being. We want you to concentrate on success and leave the rest to us. When you work here, we provide:

Fully-paid health care benefitsGenerous parental and family leave policiesMental and physical wellness programsTuition assistanceA 401(k) savings program with an employer match and more

About Point72

Point72 Asset Management is a global firm led by Steven Cohen that invests in multiple asset classes and strategies worldwide. Resting on more than a quarter-century of investing experience, we seek to be the industry’s premier asset manager through delivering superior risk-adjusted returns, adhering to the highest ethical standards, and offering the greatest opportunities to the industry’s brightest talent. We’re inventing the future of finance by revolutionizing how we develop our people and how we use data to shape our thinking. For more information, visit www.Point72.com/working-here.

job_title: Business Analyst - Claim and Data Analyst
description:
Grade 9

GeoBlue is the trading name for the international health insurance programs of Worldwide Insurance Services, an independent licensee of the Blue Cross and Blue Shield Association. For the past 20 years, GeoBlue has been dedicated to simplifying the international healthcare experience for the globally mobile. GeoBlue members have access to the Blue Cross Blue Shield network in the U.S. and our hand-picked network of high-quality medical providers outside the U.S. where we collaborate closely with our largest single shareholder, Bupa, one of the largest healthcare companies on the planet outside the US. Coupled with leading-edge technology and 24/7 multilingual world-class medical assistance, GeoBlue provides members with the confidence and peace of mind to carry out their international aspirations. GeoBlue offers a range of solutions, covering the needs of the globally mobile for short trips and long-term assignments including group, individual and student international health insurance plans.

We are looking for a Business Analyst– Claim and Data Analytics who is responsible for maintaining current knowledge of the Blue Cross Blue Shield Blue Card Program and using that knowledge in the administration of the Blue Card Program. In this capacity, the role is responsible for providing guidance and support the resolution of escalated inquiries. In addition, this role will perform data interpretation and analysis to transform data into information and provide insights to support business decisions.

Responsibilities:

Provides guidance to Claims Team and support the resolution of complex claim escalations.Generate weekly and monthly claim activity reports including but not limited to: Claim inventory / Turn Around Time / Aging of Inventory and Support Ad hoc reports upon request. Monitoring claims inventory and working with business partners, external and Internal, to ensure claims are processed timely, in accordance with both internal SLA’s and BCBSA standards.Provide guidance and support to a contact center team, interfacing with vendors, ensuring claims operation adheres to all Blue Cross Blue Shield established quality and timeliness standards, as well as Client and Vendor expectations. Performs standalone process analysis to identify gaps, inefficiencies, and training opportunities, and works with business leaders to improve operational performance.Communicates performance, risks, and issues to internal and external parties at multiple levels, to include staff, management, and executive leadership.Develop business requirements for projects/initiatives and collaborate with cross functional partners on assessment and implementation of projects/initiatives.Generate monthly and quarterly utilization reports for all three sites.Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity.Support the month end billing and invoicing process by performing quality assurance of the billing files and reports.Other duties as assigned.

Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in business preferred, or equivalent combination of education and experience.At least 3 years of healthcare, insurance, or related industry required.Familiarity with Blue Cross Blue Shield BlueCard program is highly preferred.Demonstrated experience with technical or operational claims management is highly desirable.Proven analytical skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.Demonstrated ability to problem solve.Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload.Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Word is required.Bilingual in English/Spanish is preferred.Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of cross-functional teams.Employee is required to have at minimum an internet speed of 75 Mbps (standard high-speed internet access.

We offer competitive benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, 401(k), PTO, and more.

EOE/M/F/Vets/Disabled

If you prefer to mail your resume you can send it to:

Worldwide Insurance Services

Attn: Human Resources

933 First Avenue | King of Prussia, PA 19406

The Optum Tri-State Region is committed to leveraging the communications function to help our organization achieve business objectives. We are transforming the way we communicate our value proposition including becoming more visible and present in the marketplace. We have significant momentum and are looking for a data analyst and revenue cycle analyst professional to create and execute innovative strategies to help us accelerate our progress.We’re a dynamic and growing health care organization, offering a wide range of employment opportunities. We are seeking professional and dedicated individuals to be part of our team, where integrity, respect, accountability, and collaboration are among our core principles. We offer our employees competitive compensation and benefits, flexibility and opportunity for growth and advancement.The Healthcare Business Analyst is responsible for gathering and interpreting from a variety of sources to help the organization improve the quality of care, lower the cost of care and enhance patient experience.The ideal candidate has strong presence; may be responsible for automating internal and external reports, creating executive-level dashboards, and presenting information to help healthcare executives and others understand the operational impact of the data.Position Summary The Revenue Cycle Analyst is the reporting guru for the Central Revenue Cycle Management Department. This position’s job duties include; Design, implement, and maintain reports for financial reporting. The ideal candidate has extensive experience in revenue cycle metrics. The candidate will have a background that consistently displays data analytic skills, subject matter expertise and competencies. The Revenue Cycle Analyst will cultivate and align with a strong team culture and collaborative environment centered on consistently delivering exceptional performance and outcomes. The Revenue Cycle Analyst must have proficient knowledge in revenue cycle terminology, reimbursement policies, payer contracts, and RCM operations.Duties and Responsibilities· Meets with Revenue Cycle team members routinely to obtain information and to understand their reporting needs in order to develop specification to prepare specialized reports.· Assesses reporting needs through research, analysis and evaluation to create requested reports.· Ensures timely creation and reporting of key RCM indicators and other reports requested.· Develops and maintains an inventory of existing and needed reports.· Produce and analyze both ad hoc and standard sets of billing data reports to assess billing, financial, quality and statistical performance.· Extracts data from various data repositories to analyze and display the information in an efficient way using a variety of different reporting.· Monitors the status of all report requests.· Identifies and validates the appropriate solution for various reporting needs.· Assists in creating design specifications for reports.· Prioritizes and manages multiple projects simultaneously and follow through on issues n a timely manner.· Tests reports and reporting functionality to assure data quality prior to production.· Promotes the culture of team collaboration, while identifying and implementing opportunities to enhance the shared values of the group.· Exhibits exceptional customer service skills; prompt return and follow up to all interactions; prompt response to requests for information, both internally and externally.· Proactive resolution of issues and timely response to questions and concerns.‘Requirements· Strong analytical background in statistics and mathematical optimization, forecasting and simulation.· Knowledge in Revenue Cycle KPIs, payer reimbursement policies and contracts, and Revenue Cycle Operations.· Ability to interact with business leadership and make dynamic presentations.· Energetic, motivated with a strong work ethic, eager to take on challenging tasks.· Excellent communication skills including experience speaking to both technical and non-technical audiences; ability to bring actionable insights through effective communication.· Demonstrated experience identifying solutions using standard analysis techniques such as business process and information modeling, root cause analysis, etc.· Ability to manage multiple projects involving diverse stakeholders across leadership levels.· Ability to independently and quickly ramp up on new business and technical concepts.· Expert knowledge in Microsoft Excel, including Pivot tables, vlookups, PowerPivot, and VBA.· Skilled in business intelligence applications such as Tableau, Domo, Power BI, etc.· Understanding of SQL programming.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)Dental insuranceEmployee discountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's (Preferred)Experience:SQL: 1 year (Preferred)Business Analysis: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location:One locationThis Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger pictureAchievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might failInnovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativityHigh stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environmentThis Company Describes Its Culture as:Detail-oriented -- quality and precision-focusedInnovative -- innovative and risk-takingAggressive -- competitive and growth-orientedCompany's website:https://www.riversidemedgroup.com/Benefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Temperature screeningsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Accelerate360 is a distribution, sales, marketing and media conglomerate that provides customized solutions for retailers and consumer product brands across each of our lines of business. With over 100 years of legacy experience, the company has a proven track record in Direct Store Delivery (DSD) and Direct to Consumer (DTC) fulfillment as well as sourcing, retail program development, marketing, sales, category management and media solutions. Accelerate360 is also the largest magazine wholesaler in the US and owns over 30 media brands including US Weekly and Men’s Journal. The company’s internal brand and marketing studio manages proprietary brand development and marketing services throughout the ecosystem. Accelerate360 has launched across multiple eCommerce channels including LifeToGo.com, a curated marketplace for those looking to keep moving, stay healthy and find their ideal life balance, Shopa360.com, a marketplace enabling Independent Retailers to source and order the latest on-trend products, and multiple pure play and omni-channel platforms selling our own as well as external brands. This set of offerings from marketing to distribution to eCommerce creates a unique position in the market where a brand can come in and be supported wherever they may need the most help. Located in Smyrna, Georgia and with offices and facilities across the US, Accelerate360 is proud to employ over 1,100 employees.www.accelerate360.comAccelerate360 currently has an opening for an Analyst – Business Development whose primary focus will be on researching brands to work with, evaluating brands that are brought to the company, performing deep analysis of a brand’s financial history, benefit offerings, differentiators, and how Accelerate360 could best impact/provide value to them. Overview:

At New York Blood Center Enterprises (NYBCe), one of the US’ leading comprehensive blood centers in the world, our focus is on cultivating excellence by merging cutting-edge innovation with diligent customer service, groundbreaking research, and comprehensive program and service development. Join us as we work towards meeting and exceeding the growing needs of our diverse communities, furthering our lifesaving strategic goals in a rapidly changing environment, and expanding our impact on the local, national, and global communities we serve.
Responsibilities:

Reporting to the Vice President of Ventures and Business Development, this role will assist with and analyze strategic partnerships and investment opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to join a newly created team. This role, although based out of our Upper East Side Manhattan location, will consider high potential candidates from outside the New York metropolitan area:
Responsibilities include:
Create valuation and investment/returns models for the individual partnership and investment deals, including supporting research
Conduct primary and secondary research, including expert interviews among key opinion leaders (KOLs)
Prepare marketing materials and conduct outreach for out licensing opportunities
Monitor and report deal flow progress and deal milestones
Attend and represent the Ventures and Business Development team at key industry events including BIO, JPMorgan, relevant medical conferences, etc.
Analyze portfolio investment performance and be actively involved in portfolio management
Prepare and maintain internal investment documentation on potential investments/spinouts and portfolio companies, including investment case presentations, financial analyses and reporting
Create, update and maintain subscription and proprietary NYBC Ventures and BD databases
Perform other tasks as necessary to support the team
Qualifications:

To qualify, you must have an MBA with at least 5 years of relevant work experience; academic credentials in the life sciences are a plus. Prior experience in venture capital, strategic consulting, and business development is preferred. We will consider entrepreneurial, flexible, and proactive candidates.

EBP Supply Solutions, a leading provider of Cleaning and Food Service supplies and services to commercial institutions, is currently seeking an experienced, conscientious, detail oriented and enthusiastic Junior Business Analyst to join our team in Milford, CT. As part our Business Analytics Group, the Junior Business Analyst position will support all departments within the organization, responsible for gathering and analyzing information, and delivering timely, accurate information on regularly scheduled intervals.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Scheduled and Ad hoc reporting for sales, management & other departments.Data Integrity – identifying and resolving data issues; gathering the information and preparing logical supporting documentation.Provide back-up for periodic commission processing and analysis.Assist in administration of large account programs such as Network, National Accounts or 3rd Party.Monitoring, analyzing & maintaining customer price lists and managed order guides.Administrative tasks in support of Business Partners and Bag Team Members.Information gathering and research in support of department projects.Developing competence by performing structured work assignments.Special projects assigned by the Department Manager, Senior Analysts, Business Analyst, CFO, President and Sales Management.Assist the Senior Analyst in maintaining controls and reporting over the Corporate Customer Allowance Program.Assist the Senior Analyst in the preparation and reporting of the annual revenue and gross profit budgets.THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE MUST ALSO HAVE THE FOLLOWING: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.Excellent oral and written communication skills.Ability to learn quickly.Proven problem solving experience.Strong MS Excel skills.Ability to effectively multitask with little supervision in a fast paced and high volume environment.EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE: Bachelor’s Degree in Data Analytics, Mathematics, Finance or Accounting.PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.
