The employee frequently is required to stand, walk; use hands to finger, handle or feel; and reach with hands and arms.Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.Must be able to access and navigate each department at the organizations facilities.The Company offers a competitive compensation package that is commensurate with experience as well as a broad range of benefits (Medical, Dental, Prescription Drug, Life Ins., Short & Long Term Disability Ins., EAP, Educational Assistance Program, etc..), and a 401(k) retirement plan with company match.Contact: EBP Supply Solutions200 Research DriveMilford, CT 06460Attn: Human ResourcesFax: 203-882-2897Minority & Women Applicants are Encouraged to ApplyJob Type: Full-timePay: $48,000.00 - $52,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee discountFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offProfessional development assistanceReferral programRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayWork Location:One locationBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:NoCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

job_title: Principal Business Analyst ll, Turner Construction
description:
A little about us
At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That’s why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you’ll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.
Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a “Great Place to Work” by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also named by Forbes as one of America’s Best Employers for Women and one of America’s Best Employers for New Graduates—as well as one of America’s Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran’s status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.
This is a unique opportunity to work directly with one of Liberty’s largest customers, to act as liaison to operational teams and to collaborate with underwriters on go forward strategies and program design.
The Turner Principal Business Analyst (BA) is an important player on the Turner underwriting team. He or she is responsible for overseeing unique elements of the program and ensuring they are effectively outlined and communicated to key stakeholders. The BA enjoys a direct relationship with the insured and the reinsurance partners. Working with internal stakeholders the BA is key in facilitating cross functional collaboration.
Join a highly collaborative team that values diversity of thought in improving processes and creating effective customer solutions.
Responsibilities:
Regularly meets with underwriting team, customer and reinsurance partners to communicate activity and address material findings.
Oversees the execution of key financial controls for the program.
Collaborates regularly with internal stakeholders.
Owns design of annual operational profit study and presents results to leadership.
Monitors program reporter for exposure and premium irregularities.
Works with CM Retro, Premium Audit and Reinsurance Accounting to manage program volume and bring items to resolution for the customer and reinsurance partners in a transparent and timely fashion.
Involves appropriate parties to support project initiatives as needed.
Ability to effectively present and communicate with stakeholders in a manner that exhibits strategic presence and builds credibility.
Exhibits strategic vision in recommendations and solutions by addressing broader, cross-functional implications.
Qualifications:
Displays strong research, problem solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills.
Advanced knowledge of Excel and strong knowledge of database software.
Advanced business operations knowledge including an understanding of direct and net premium implications.
Strong influencing, relationship management & presentation skills.
Strong project management skills as part of implementing business process changes.
Advanced knowledge of available data sources, strengths and shortcomings.
Ideal candidate will be analytically driven, comfortable in front of a customer and adept operating with a high level of autonomy.
Competencies typically acquired through a Bachelor`s degree or equivalent experience in addition to 8+ years of relevant experience to include business analysis

You will understand intimately the needs of our internal stakeholders and produce reports, results and options that they can choose from. The New Jersey Judiciary seeks an organized, customer service oriented individual with business analysis, report and dashboard design, and excellent communication skills to join the Trial Court Services Data Analytics, Research and Standards team. To support data-driven decisions in the Judiciary’s Municipal, Criminal, Civil and Family Courts, the analyst will assess needs, prepare detailed requirements, provide requirements to the developers, and test and create end-user documentation for reports and dashboards. The analyst will also coordinate with other teams to ensure data is available to support analytics.By working in a highly collaborative environment, they will gather and analyze feedback to ensure their deliverables are continually relevant. The successful candidate will be a self-starter with a positive attitude, great attention to detail, and be proficient in providing business intelligence based on large sets of mission critical data. Experience with Tableau and querying data via SQL is preferred.When you come to work for the New Jersey Judiciary, you will join a 9,000-member strong branch of government that operates with the highest standards of independence, integrity, fairness and quality service. We work hard every day to build the public's trust and confidence in our court system, which resolves nearly 800,000 Superior Court cases and 6 million Municipal Court cases each year. Whether it be in a courtroom, an administrative office, a courthouse, a training room, an IT office or in the field, our Judiciary workforce is improving the lives of countless individuals and families every day.Our culture is based on our strong belief in the importance of our work to all of those we serve. We honor the dignity and individualism of each member of our organization while fostering professionalism and continuous improvement in our work.Note: This position also may qualify for remote work outside of Judiciary buildings. To participate in this program, you will be required to have high speed home internet access. This program does not supersede the “New Jersey First Act”, which requires newly hired Judiciary employees to establish, and then maintain, principal residence in the State of New Jersey.EXAMPLE OF DUTIES: * Facilitate interviews with subject matter experts and business users to elicit requirements for reports and dashboards* Create detailed requirements for reports and dashboards including business rules, data mappings, visualizations, mockups, basic summary statistics and drill-down* Verify availability of data in the data warehouse to support reports and dashboards, including for new systems and enhancements, determining where expansion is needed* Analyze raw system data to ensure report and dashboard requirements properly account for data issues and works with business and technical teams to improve data quality* Provide report and dashboard requirements to the developers, ensuring they are fully understood* Ensure data, including reference values, is properly incorporated into reports and dashboards* Test reports, dashboards and data to ensure they meet requirements and are accurate and complete* Catalog and prioritize defects with developers for resolution* Empower users by conducting training as well as creating instructional materials (e.g., manuals, on-line training tutorials) to support the generation and consumption of reports and dashboards* Troubleshoot issues with reports and dashboards and facilitates enhancements* Ensure reports and dashboards comply with data security policies and proceduresThe selected candidate(s) may be required to work a non-traditional work week, which may include weekends and holidays.Salary range is $61,217.75 - $98,586.88. For newly hired individuals, the starting salary will normally be at the minimum of the salary range.Job Requirements: Bachelor's Degree from an accredited college or university in a field related to computer science, information technology or the area to which the applicant is applying, such as information systems, human-computer interaction, interactive media, software engineering, computer networking, and/or cybersecurity AND one (1) year of professional experience in: analyzing, designing, programming, troubleshooting, resolving technical problems, testing, defining business requirements, training and/or installing computer systems applications OR planning, acquiring, installing and implementing telecommunications facilities and services, wide area networks, or local area networksOR generating and maintaining system software.Substitution:  Applicants who do not possess the required education may substitute additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is applying on a year for year basis with one year of such experience being equal to 30 semester hour credits.A Bachelor's Degree in any field from an accredited college or university and one year of additional paraprofessional and/or professional IT technical experience or experience related to the area to which the applicant is job_title: Associate Business Analyst - Surety - King of Prussia, PA (July 2021)
location: King of Prussia Post Office, PA
description:
At Liberty Mutual, our purpose is to help people embrace today and confidently pursue tomorrow. That’s why we provide an environment focused on openness, inclusion, trust and respect. Here, you’ll discover our expansive range of roles, and a workplace where we aim to help turn your passion into a rewarding profession.
Liberty Mutual has proudly been recognized as a “Great Place to Work” by Great Place to Work® US for the past several years. We were also selected as one of the “100 Best Places to Work in IT” on IDG’s Insider Pro and Computerworld’s 2020 list. For many years running, we have been named by Forbes as one of America’s Best Employers for Women and one of America’s Best Employers for New Graduates—as well as one of America’s Best Employers for Diversity. To learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion please visit: https://jobs.libertymutualgroup.com/diversity-inclusion
We value your hard work, integrity and commitment to make things better, and we put people first by offering you benefits that support your life and well-being. To learn more about our benefit offerings please visit: https://LMI.co/Benefits
Liberty Mutual Surety, a business unit member of Liberty Mutual Insurance, is the largest Surety in the United States and one of the largest globally. We specialize in providing surety bonds for construction firms, manufacturers and suppliers, and commercial enterprises for corporations and individuals on an account and transactional basis, and conduct business worldwide through fronting relationships and Liberty owned subsidiaries, with bonds issued in over 60 countries. We pride ourselves on our outstanding service to brokers, agents, and customers throughout our field offices across the U.S., and in Mexico, Canada, Brazil, Peru, Chile, UK, Belgium, Germany, Italy, France, Netherlands, Spain, Hong Kong, and Australia. We are committed to our value proposition of building mutually profitable relationships by providing smart business solutions, ease of doing business, and consistent, responsive service, and is dedicated to the communities we serve and values highly a diverse workforce.
Liberty Mutual is an equal opportunity employer. We will not tolerate discrimination on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, age, disability, veteran’s status, pregnancy, genetic information or on any basis prohibited by federal, state or local law.
It’s a data-driven world. Be part of a team that harnesses the power of data to analyze performance trends, identify opportunities, and keep Liberty Mutual Surety™ moving forward.
Liberty Mutual Surety™ is currently seeking an ambitious, career-minded college graduate with strong analyst, research, and reporting abilities as an Associate Business Analyst in our Enterprise Risk Management group in King of Prussia, PA, which is part of Surety’s Global Risks organization. This is an excellent opportunity to build your analyst skills and help assist with reporting and analysis for our Global Risks organization.
The Details
Build skills and learn about business processes and research methodologies.
Gain exposure to conducting analysis and preparing recommendations.
Support implementation of business process improvements.
Develop knowledge of metrics and tools, and how to recommend changes and/or take actions to improve business outcomes
Develop and produce standard and ad-hoc reports.
Develop and maintain a strong understanding of department operations, processes, procedures, and operational effectiveness, and establish a rapport with field and home office underwriters, and others across the organization.
Develop a working knowledge of the Surety business, including contract and commercial underwriting concepts, Surety claims handling, and various internal and external factors which can impact the organization.
Participate, perform, or assist with special projects and ad hoc analyses as requested. May present findings and provide recommendations to project leadership and/or senior management.
Recommend, implement, and enhance process improvements in support of the Surety’s continuous improvement efforts.
Participate-in and successfully complete various activities of the Surety Underwriting Development Program, which may include AFSB certification activities and coursework, case studies, self-study, and exams as required. Participate in monthly Community of Practice. Job shadow into Surety product line areas and business units.
Other projects as assigned.
Gain experience and solid understanding of Surety’s internal structure and business units, such as Home Office and Field Underwriting and Claims.
What you’ve got
Bachelor's degree in Business Management, Economics, or related discipline.
0-2 years of professional experience.
Minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA. Additional requirements may apply.
Demonstrated research, problem solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills. Working knowledge of Excel. Knowledge of database software preferred
Strong interpersonal, written and verbal, analytical and organizational skills.
Demonstrated leadership, quantitative and analytical skills.
Strong attention to detail in a fast-paced work environment, and the ability to manage multiple priorities.
Prior internship in corporate environment a plus.
Prior involvement in community and/or school activities.
You must have permanent work authorization in the United States.

This job is flexible. You can work remote from home in your homeoffice.
We are looking for a Business Analyst who will be the vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features.
Responsibilities
Perform quality assurance
Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements
Define reporting and alerting requirements
Help design, document and maintain system processes
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to product team
Requirements
Previous experience in Business / Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance
Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
Experience in analysing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
Basic knowledge in generating process documentation
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills

Apply

Job Purpose
Explore an opportunity to join our ICE Data Services Desktop Solutions group as a Business Analyst in our Mid-town NYC location. The Desktop Solutions product offerings are global in scope and serve a broad section of the financial services industry. Through an integrated network of Desktop Solutions that we provide, our customers can access execution, messaging and analytics tools tailored to their existing workflows.
The Business Analyst will work with the Product Management team in defining, prioritizing, planning, and executing the vision for our Desktop applications targeting our core Data Services customers. The Business Analyst will be responsible for translating user needs into business requirements; identifying opportunities to expand our application’s capabilities; interacting with various internal teams (including but not limited to development, QA, sales, and marketing), vendors, and end users; performing user acceptance testing, and training sales and support teams on new content or functionality.

Responsibilities
Prioritize requirements, engage in business analysis activities and create specifications to be used by development teams
Work alongside product management to translate their vision into documents and wireframes
Recommend improvements and new features for desktop and mobile applications
Prepare training guides, release notes, and perform training for users
Liaise with development and QA teams to deliver new features and resolve issues
Perform UAT on new functionality or datasets
Identify and communicate project risks and issues
Collaborate with target market representatives, customers and partners to create powerful and compelling solutions for the marketplace

Knowledge and Experience
Knowledge of financial markets (minimum of 3+ years of experience); futures and energy markets knowledge are a plus
Previous experience as a Business Analyst (minimum of 3+ years of experience)
Requirements elicitation and documentation a must
Able to create mockups/wireframes
Great communication skills
Must be able to supervise, organize, prioritize workload and work on numerous projects/tasks at one time
Familiar with waterfall and agile methodologies
Attention to detail, critical thinking, problem solving, and analytical skills
Ability to work with technical teams (QA and development) as well as sales and end users
Proactive and able to take initiative
Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Software: Jira and Balsamiq (or other wireframing tool)
Desire to work in both data/content and functionality projects

Salesforce Business Analyst


We are seeking a strategic and detail oriented, Salesforce Business Analyst to join our growing Sales Operations team. The role is primarily responsible for driving technology and process improvement for our stakeholders, through the Salesforce tech stack and related ecosystem. This role requires analytical, functional, and technical skills, along with best practice knowledge for using Salesforce.com technologies to provide positive business outcomes. This position is located at our offices in New York City and will report to the Senior Manager, Sales Operations.


Responsibilities

Work with various stakeholders to analyze business needs, elicit requirements and design Salesforce solutions. that enable the business to achieve its objectives, improve user experience, and drive system adoption.
Complete gap analysis for as-is and to-be processes; translating into functional and technical specifications.
Leverage standard Salesforce functionality and custom development to solve complex business requirements.
Partner closely with Engineering to ensure the successful delivery of system enhancements.
Responsible for quality assurance, ensuring accurate testing cycles with Engineering and business partners.
Ownership of the enhancement backlog, partnering with stakeholders to jointly prioritize initiatives.
Support change management initiatives related to new feature releases including documentation and training.
As needed, provide help desk support to support business-as-usual (e.g. bugs, configuration, etc.)
Maintain familiarity with upstream / downstream integrations and their impact on feature enhancements
Stay current with Salesforce releases and leverage updates applicable to organizational requirements.
Identify, document, communicate and enforce standard business processes as they relate Salesforce.
Create operational excellence through best practice sharing and process consistency across all users.
Serve as an agent of change and drive effective communication to all business stakeholders.
Balance the service elements of the role with the broader needs of Roku's business.


Experience, Skills, And Knowledge Required

Minimum of 5 years of professional experience with a focus in Sales or Business Operations.
Minimum of 5 years professional experience with the Salesforce.com platform
Equivalent experience as a Salesforce Business Systems Analyst
Able to document, visualize, analyze, communicate and solve complex problems
Excellent communicator and collaborator; able to work with both technical and non-technical teams
Working knowledge or and experience with agile management methodologies
Ability to foresee and analyze project risks and develop risk management plans.
Role is based in New York or San Jose

ABOUT FANDUEL GROUP

FanDuel Group is a world-class team of brands and products all built with one goal in mind — to give fans new and innovative ways to interact with their favorite games, sports, teams, and leagues. That's no easy task, which is why we're so dedicated to building a winning team. And make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we'll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we're committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give.

FanDuel Group is based in New York, with offices in California, New Jersey, Florida, Oregon and Scotland. Our brands include:

FanDuel — A game-changing real-money fantasy sports app
FanDuel Sportsbook — America's #1 sports betting app
TVG — The best-in-class horse racing TV/media network and betting platform
FanDuel Racing — A horse racing app built for the average sports fan
FanDuel Casino & Betfair Casino — Fan-favorite online casino apps
FOXBet — A world-class betting platform and an affiliate of FanDuel Group
PokerStars — The premier online poker product and an affiliate of FanDuel Group

THE POSITION

Our roster has an opening with your name on it

We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our high-performance agile team. This is a key role in a fast-paced environment working with teams and stakeholders across the business. If you're excited by this challenge and want to work within a dynamic company then we'd love to hear from you.

THE GAME PLAN
Everyone on our team has a part to play

Be responsible for the elicitation and management of requirements for our next generation of sports games
Bring fresh ideas to the table when working to solve business problems, using your commercial understanding to generate innovative solutions
Be an enabling force driving through effective and sustainable change guiding the business through the journey
Play a key role in self-organizing agile delivery teams
Work within a collaborative environment, liaising with stakeholders across the global organization and the broader delivery team
Play a key role within the BA community here at FanDuel, sharing your industry best practice and fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and cross-skilling

THE STATS

What we're looking for in our next teammate

A self-starter able to work both autonomously with minimal supervision and collaboratively within an agile team
Experience of, or passion for, Agile delivery processes (used in software or web-based projects) and a willingness and enthusiasm to promote a culture of inspect and adapt
Experience conducting stakeholder interviews and facilitating stakeholder workshops
Ability to define and refine user stories, acceptance criteria, and sign off processes
Exceptional analysis skills
Drives high standards for individual accomplishment and works to meet or exceed challenging goals
High level of self-awareness displayed and good understanding of the behavior relating to the environment
Ability to constructively challenge and question as well as actively listen
Is used to working in a fast-paced environment helping to provide clarity to delivery teams when priorities change

WHAT YOU GET IN RETURN

Beyond working with such a great team?

An exciting environment with real growth
Contribute to exciting products used by a highly passionate user base
Personal learning and development opportunities
Flexible vacation allowance
Attractive health insurance premiums

There's more, but we don't want to go on and on.

FanDuel Group is an equal opportunities employer. Diversity and inclusion in FanDuel means that we respect and value everyone as individuals. We don't tolerate bias, judgement or harassment. Our focus is on developing employees so that they reach their full potential.

POSITION SUMMARYUnder general direction, this individual contributor ensures compliance with the Bank Secrecy Act (BSA), Anti-Money Laundering (AML) regulations, the USA PATRIOT Act, Know Your Customer (KYC) and Customer Due Diligence (CDD) requirements, Office of Foreign Asset Control (OFAC) regulations, Customer Identification Program (CIP) requirements and The Provident Bank's policies and procedures (hereafter referred to as the "BSA Program"). This is the entry level in the job family. Incumbent is being groomed for professional maturity, judgment and experience. A certain degree of creativity, diplomacy and latitude is required.

MAJOR JOB RESPONSIBILITIES

Contributes to monitoring programs designed to detect suspicious transactions, fraud, and 50% other possible violations of laws, regulations, policies, and/or procedures. Identifies and investigates possible suspicious activity by reviewing alerts, account transactions and customer identification information. Conducts a thorough analysis of the collected data documenting the investigation results and providing initial recommendations with supporting conclusion to BSA Management, all within a timely manner. Writes Suspicious Activity Report (SAR) narrative draft, compiles SAR administrative elements, and files completed and approved SARs in accordance to FinCEN deadlines. Makes recommendations as to account closeouts and/or restrictions based upon investigation results.

Performs reviews of new business account documents as well as reviews customer due 30%

diligence forms for adherence to established CDD procedures and to further identify any business account opening that may be in violation of the Bank’s BSA Policy. Reviews information gathered on CDD documents to ensure the appropriate risk rating has been applied to the account relationship. Notifies appropriate business lines of incomplete or insufficient CDD information that requires timely actions.

Assists in preparation of reports to keep management informed of the Compliance 10%

Department's activities and status of suspicious activity investigations.

Keeps informed of laws, regulations, and current practices pertaining to the Bank Secrecy 5%

Act and Anti-Money Laundering regulations.

Performs related duties as required. 5%

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES

None

SKILLS AND TRAINING 

Knowledge of the BSA, AML, USA PATRIOT Act, KYC, and OFAC regulations.

Knowledge of databases and websites used in the investigations of suspicious activity, including

money laundering and terrorist financing.

Knowledge of bank and branch operations.

Good personal computer skills and proficient in using software commonly employed in an office

environment.

Excellent written and oral communications skills.

Ability to analyze business situations, identify problems or concerns, determine applicable

scenarios and choose the appropriate solution to the problem.

Interfaces with other Bank personnel to obtain customer information for use in suspicious

activity investigations.

EDUCATION

Associate Degree - preferred

WORK EXPERIENCE

1 to 3 years

LICENSES AND/OR CERTIFICATES

Licenses and Certifications Expiration Date

None

WORKING CONDITIONS

Work is performed in a normal office environment, however, work may be performed in all areas within the Bank. May include travel by automobile.

HAZARDS

The hazards are mainly those present in a normal office setting, and those present in commuting by car.

This job description may not be all-inclusive. Employees are expected to perform other duties as assigned and directed by management. Job descriptions and duties may be modified when deemed appropriate by management.

Druva delivers data protection and management for the cloud era. Druva Cloud Platform is built on AWS and offered as-a-Service; delivering globally accessible, infinitely scalable and completely autonomous enterprise data resiliency. Customers drive down costs by up to 50 percent by freeing themselves from the burden of unnecessary hardware, capacity planning, and software management. Druva's patented cloud architecture transforms backup data into an asset, making it more open and accessible so customers can streamline governance, improve cyber resiliency, and gain critical insights to uncover opportunities and expedite decision making.

Druva has raised over $350m in venture capital, is trusted by over 4,000 global organizations and protects over 200 PB of data.
Position Summary:As part of Druva's Business Operations team, the Business Intelligence Analyst will be responsible for providing actionable, data-driven insights for multiple department leaders in a fast-paced environment. Leveraging modern BI data tools such as Looker, Snowflake, and Fivetran as well as a keen ability to partner with the business, you will manage the entire visualization process from discovery, modeling, and delivery to dashboard creation and ownership.

job_title: Business Systems Analyst - Service and Finance
description: Business Systems Analyst – Services and FinanceIntapp helps firms shift to a modernization strategy and gain a growth edge in today’s competitive marketplace. We offer intelligent solutions built for partner-led firms– spanning the entire client lifecycle, from strategy through origination and execution. Intapp is looking for a highly motivated team player for the key role of Business Systems Analyst, supporting Services and Finance within the Business Applications group.As a member of our Enterprise Applications Team, you will be helping to maintain and support Intapp’s cloud-based Enterprise Applications portfolio consisting of Project management/resourcing, project billing and Accounting solutions.As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for administering and supporting Intapp’s Services and Finance systems. You will be responsible for coordinating with key business partners regarding their business requirements and functioning as the functional lead for services and finance systems and design. The ideal candidate should have demonstrated skills in understanding and adhering to policies, procedures, and operating controls to ensure consistency and timeliness of execution. They will also need to be able to combine business process knowledge with a deep technical understanding of related systems and software to help identify and implement scalable solutions.ResponsibilitiesFunction as an analyst and business partner to the professional services and accounting teams to model, design, and build business solutions that improve and scale Intapp’s Services and finance processesResponsible for owning services and accounting system configuration - Configure fields, workflows, roles/permissions, custom rules, reports, and dashboardsAbility to explain technical objects or designs in non-technical terms for business partners (i.e. being able to digest something like a workflow & tell the business what it does without being too technical)Experience with integrations and the flow of data across multiple systems is a plusKnowledge of both business and IT process design and best practicesCollaborate with Services and Finance teams to define requirements and manage expectations from project inception through delivery, including status updates, issue resolution, scope changes, UAT, deployment, etcWork with business leadership, internal/external development resources and suppliers to ensure timely, accurate and cost-effective delivery of IT solutionsCreate and execute test cases for unit/regression testing; Interface with the application development teams to validate test results for new features/applications, verifying that they meet the requirements of the business before facilitating UAT and deploymentMaintain and document current and new system process flowsProvide day-to-day administration and maintenance of critical business systems including OpenAir and NetSuite. Triaging and resolving production support issues and implementing small enhancement requestsREQUIREMENTS:Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with minimum of 5 years of system administration or application support experience.At least 4-6 years of business systems analyst experience in a global organization utilizing NetSuite3+ years of professional experience supporting a Services/Finance organizationDemonstrated understanding of Services process – Project billing/ resource managementExperience with any Services application – OpenAir or Oracle project accountingExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsExperience with IT compliance controlsKnowledge of project management methodologies (waterfall or agile) a plusDemonstrated ability to remain composed in a dynamic environment and communicate successfully to all levels of employeesExperience in supporting a highly integrated ERP ecosystem with working knowledge of the following systems; NetSuite OpenAir.5+ years of Experience in providing end to end PSA solutions.Understanding of industry best practices implementing solutions for professional services team.

Roots of Peace is a humanitarian organization that has worked in war-torn countries around the world with our partners to remove the remnants of war, landmines and unexploded ordinance, and restore the land in order to rebuild peaceful communities for generations to come. For the past twenty years, the Roots of Peace award-winning “Mines to Vines” approach has impacted one million farmers and families, enabling the exports worth over $150 million to international markets. Since beginning our work in Afghanistan in 2003, Roots of Peace has worked with agricultural value chains in every province of the country resulting in 100,000 tons of exports, creating over 9,000 full-time agribusiness jobs that benefited more than 38,000 families from these value chain approaches. Berkeley Research Group (BRG) provides data analytics, authoritative studies, expert testimony, investigations, regulatory, and dispute consulting to Fortune 500 corporations, financial institutions, government agencies, major law firms, and regulatory bodies around the world. Headquartered in Emeryville, California, BRG currently has over 40 offices across the United States and internationally.Are you analytical? Like data? Do you find yourself writing scripts and queries to solve problems or automate systems and processes? If so, we should talk. BRG has a great opportunity for someone with a passion for identifying business needs and translating them into actionable items.BRG is actively seeking a Business and Systems Analyst to join our Data & Business Solutions team, a small, highly dynamic, and entrepreneurial team within BRG’s finance and accounting organization. The Business and Systems Analyst will work to support the maintenance of financial algorithms (SQL), create reports (SQL Server Reporting Services, Power BI), and work on initiatives to improve current and future processes. The role will be cross-functional and interact with members within the finance, accounting, information technology, operations, and legal departments. Our ideal candidate will have a solid quantitative background and possess an imaginative curiosity about how to leverage data to solve business problems. This position reports to the Vice President of Data & Business Solutions.ResponsibilitiesMaintain and support existing data analytics platforms, reporting tools, and financial systemsCollaborate with business and technology stakeholders to design business intelligence reports, metrics, visualizations, and dashboardsOwn and maintain existing reports, train new users and business stakeholders to help drive data informed decisionsAnalyze existing business systems and processes and identify ways to leverage technology to address inefficiencies. Interact with the business to define system requirements, write specifications to solve problems, and execute on solutionsAutomate tasks and create efficiencies through tools and scriptingCreate technical documentationManage and complete special and projects as requested. Examples include automation of wire and ACH payments, designing and productionizing a contractor database, assessment of new ERP or CRM systemsContinuously look for ways to improve, automate, and scale current processesQualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Engineering, Finance/Accounting, or similar quantitative field2-4 years of work experience in technical/analytical role (advanced degrees will be considered as well)Demonstrated technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills with commitment to accuracyExcellent organizational, interpersonal, and communication skillsExcellent computer skills including proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, lookup, macros, etc.), Microsoft Access, VBA, XML, Word, PowerPointWillingness to learn with initiative to partner collaboratively across the organization0-2 years of related SQL development experience (Microsoft SQL Server) or willingness to learn(Nice to have) Familiarity with scripting or programming languagesABOUT BRGBerkeley Research Group (BRG), headquartered in Emeryville, CA provides independent expert testimony, advisory services and data analytics to major law firms, Fortune 500 companies, government agencies and regulatory bodies around the world. To prepare, analyze, report, and manage data used for both plan-wide and regional decision making for evaluating performance in key quality measures and the effective use of health plan resources on a routine and ad hoc basis. Works collaboratively with departments company-wide to identify data needs, develop and maintain data queries and tools, and complete accurate reporting to support performance and process improvements. Project/program involvement may include PHC’s Healthcare Effectiveness Data Information Set (HEDIS) reporting initiative, Partnership Quality Dashboard (PDQ), PHC’s provider pay-for-performance programs, and others as assigned.Develops and maintains working knowledge (technical and user interfaces) of PHC data management and analytics programs and systems. May manage/monitor data integration into data infrastructure and may lead system-level user testing. Utilizes the Enterprise Data Warehouse and other data sources to identify and isolate data for analysis. Validates data reports and manages key data sources within program requirements, to ensure the completeness and accuracy of data.Works collaboratively with various departments (i.e. QI, IT, Finance, and Analytics teams) and external stakeholders to define business requirements and identify data needs. Refines reporting requests to support operational excellence initiatives and creates tools and reports to measure process/performance changes.Develops and executes data collection plans that identify baseline performance and capture the impact of interventions. Analyzes performance data (which may include data trending or stratification) to identify areas for improvement. Provides actionable recommendations and informs stakeholders of the impact of key decisions based on available data.Serves as active contributor in data quality or analytics workgroups. Develops and maintains standards and methodologies in data governance and data quality issue resolution timelines; streamlines reporting to reduce unnecessary duplication; ensures consistent and accurate use of data reporting; and provides accurate definitions of all data elements.Serves as a primary contact for internal and external stakeholders related to PHC performance data management.Serves as the analytic lead on select operational initiatives as assigned.Maintains expert knowledge of assigned business unit.Provides project management support for data related and performance/process improvement projects, which may include HEDIS, PDQ, pay-for-performance programs, and others as assigned. Tracks multiple deliverables and collaborates closely with broader project team.Other duties as assigned. Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree in related field; one – two (1-2) years of experience providing the knowledge and abilities listed.    Special Skills, Licenses and Certifications Demonstrated aptitude for acquiring and applying technical skills in data analysis, reporting, and data systems. Good oral and written communication skills. Strong analytical skills including knowledge of statistics. Excellent interpersonal skills. Valid California driver’s license and proof of current automobile insurance compliant with PHC policy are required to operate a vehicle and travel for company business.     Performance Based Competencies Knowledge of MS Excel, Access, and other analytic software. Knowledge of Lean and Model for Improvement methodologies. Familiar with quality measurement and healthcare data. Ability to communicate technical concepts with both technical and non-technical individuals. Detail-oriented with good organizational and project management skills to work on multiple projects simultaneously within established time frames.    Work Environment And Physical Demands Ability to use a PC with standard software packages. More than 70% of work time is spent in front of a computer monitor. When required, ability to move, carry, or list objects of varying size, weighing up to 25 lbs.     Additional Preferred Skills:In-depth knowledge/experience using Excel and software databases, with heavy concentration in performing detailed analysis. All HealthPlan employees are expected to:Provide the highest possible level of service to clients;Promote teamwork and cooperative effort among employees;Maintain safe practices; andAbide by the HealthPlan’s policies and procedures, as they may from time to time be updated. Analyst - Customer AnalyticsDo you want to play a role in global commerce?The beating heart of global supply chains are the logistic real estate assets that aggregate, store, sort, and deliver products. We are that heart. With the largest portfolio of assets in our industry, Prologis acts as a central hub for roughly 2% of the global GDP.About the Team: As an Customer Analytics analyst, you will leverage data to drive better understanding of our customers. You will support the Customer Team is analyzing data at the customer, industry and portfolio level. This position will have the opportunity to run/own various financial models, help with process improvement, assist in the company initiative of data analytics, provide insights, build dashboards and assist groups outside the Customer Team. Through data-driven insights you will help the team make decisions around customer profitability and segmentation strategy.The analyst is also responsible for the development, distribution, maintenance, and reporting of all surveys in the Voice of the Customer (VoC) program. The candidate will collaborate with business leaders and field resources throughout the company to develop surveys that provide a direct feedback channel from customers, providing leaders and their teams with the key insights to deliver a best in class Customer Experience. They will leverage strong analytical and customer service skills to serve as an internal VoC resource in assisting with guiding action plans and service delivery strategy.What's needed in order to do that:Assist in setting up and improving financial models, processes, and reportingExtract financial data from various accounting and information systems such as spreadsheets, relational databases, Qualtrics and Salesforce, manipulate and format data and reports. Ensure data integrity before presentation of findingsProvide ad hoc reporting and analysis for senior management as neededCollaborate with business leaders to develop Voice of the Customer (VOC) surveys for various functions, including their design, development, and implementationReview all survey responses, completing detailed analysis of results, consolidating with data from other sources, and synthesize findings to make recommendationsDevelop and distribute consolidated, detailed reporting, leveraging advanced tools to articulate findingsProvide ad hoc reporting and analysis for senior management,Tell us if you're ready.BA/BS degree in business administration, marketing, statistics, computer science or related field, preferredMinimum 2 years of experience as a financial analystPrevious VoC (Voice of Customer) experience preferredExpertise in Microsoft Excel as well as proficiency in Qualtrics and SalesforceStrong analytical skills with attention to detailExcellent interpersonal skills including strong listening, written and verbal communication, with ability to clearly and professionally communicate with othersAbility to collaborate across business areas and/or geographies, to assist in identifying trends, improvement opportunities, and best practicesAbility to prioritize, organize, analyze and summarize data from multiple sourcesWillingness to respond to urgent requests on the fly, including after hoursExperience with Tableau, and/or R Script preferred as wellTarget base compensation range of: $72,000 -$95,000 plus bonus target to be discussed during initial phone interview.All full-time roles in the US come with a robust benefits package which includes healthcare, dental, and vison insurance for employees and eligible dependents. Prologis also offers several other wellness, financial, and work/lifestyle-specific benefits. Our 401(k) retirement plan has a company match of 50% up to 12% of eligible compensation. We also offer generous PTO with a starting accrual of 22 days a year in addition to paid holidays and volunteer time.

Torani is seeking an experienced Service & Delivery Analyst to join our team to help establish top level Supply Chain practices in unique and fun ways. We’re looking for a highly motivated, self-starter and enthusiastic can-do individual who has passion for working with data in great detail. You will be part of our Logistics & Service Operations and will provide analysis, insights and visibility to improve quality of inventory, forecast attainment, and overall service results.You will ensure company data is available to cross-departmentally. You are the type of team member that’s gets thrilled when you identify trends and present data that drives Root Cause and Corrective Action. Your Supply Chain expertise will influence key company initiatives. Leadership capability is in your DNA and a natural mentorship role will exist between our Service & Delivery Analyst among others.SUCCESS FACTORS (FIRST 12-18 MONTHS)· Logistics Guru: Your thirst to turn data into meaningful information coupled with deep Logistics operational knowledge, allows you to be dialed-in to pain points and opportunities that exist across the organization. It’s all about improving our overall operating performance and profitability related to ‘Delivered Cost of Goods’ and achieving gold standard service and reliability.· Analytics & Reporting Owner:  You love to interpret and deliver data analytics that fuel our impressive growth. Key Stakeholders seek out your insight prior to action. Your ability to effectively distill complex data points for your business partners is rooted in years of in-person experience.· Foundation Builder: You are a teacher and a student. Working closely with our Service & Delivery Analyst, you have coached and developed their skills and made data come to life. Your vast industry knowledge has become a cornerstone of the team. You clearly understand and own how you contribute to Torani’s strategic priorities. At the same time, you never stop learning, and are deeply commited to ongoing personal and professional development.· Maestro of Measurement: What gets measured, gets done. You own a core set of Key Performance Indicators (KPI) that enable leadership to clearly understand the health of our Supply Chain. KPI results lead you to identify problem areas and provide leadership with information that drives decision making.· Partner data Master: You are on a constant quest to better understand data provided by various Supply Chain partners. You ensure the validity of parter data. You analyze the data available in our Partner’s portals and work closely with them to ensure that we are getting what we need. Through your understanding of our business and partner data, gaps are identified and creative resolutions are communicated proactively.· Make it Better: Continuous improvement is the name of the game. You get excited about root cause analytics and providing actionable improvement plans to drive efficiency and improve service delivery. You dream in the colors of corrective action. Through your forward thinking, end-to-end mindset, you help develop the capacity and capabilities to deliver healthy and sustainable growth.· Ad-Hoc: As business needs dictate, you rely on your organized and accurate methods so that the needed information is available at your fingertips.QUALIFICATIONS AND MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: 7 + years Supply Chain experience (preferably in Logistics)Ability to adapt to changing prioritiesDemonstrated success working in a cross-functional, team oriented environmentAdvanced knowledge of Excel functions (I.E. pivot tables, vlookups, formulas)Working knowledge of Business Intelligence tools (I.E. Tableau, PowerBI)Experience using large ERP systems (I.E. Oracle)Proficient in PowerPoint, Word and OutlookFluent in verbal & written EnglishEligible to work in US without sponsorshipLive in SF Bay Area or willing to relocate at your own expenseJob Type: Full-timePay: $10.00 - $30.00 per hourBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible spending accountHealth insurancePaid time offReferral programVision insuranceSchedule:10 hour shift12 hour shift8 hour shiftMonday to FridayWeekendsSupplemental Pay:Bonus payExperience:Supply Chain: 7 years (Required)BI tools and ERP Systems: 5 years (Required)Work Location:One locationCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/ToraniFlavor/Benefit Conditions:Only full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:NoCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Remote interview processPersonal protective equipment provided or requiredPlastic shield at work stationsTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeVirtual meetingsSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

Overview“Where's my tax refund?” “How’s my business doing?” “Can I afford to buy that?”Every day, millions of people and businesses around the world rely on Intuit’s products to answer these questions. Increasingly, our users expect to converse in natural language to accomplish these tasks instead of navigating menus and windows.If you’re passionate about building platforms at scale that help transform the lives of consumers, small businesses, and accountants, we would love to have you join Intuit’s Conversation Experiences team as a Senior Business Data Analyst. As the analyst on the team, you will help define how we use analytics to transform customer experiences, optimize business results, and accelerate Intuit’s digital assistant strategy in industry-leading products like QuickBooks, Mint, and TurboTax. Everything from shaping our product strategy through hypothesis-driven testing to building self-service reporting pipelines and systems and more happens within our team.So what does it take to thrive? You need to be a top-notch problem solver and problem identifier. Aside from the standard suite of analytical tools such as SQL, R/Python, and business intelligence platforms (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI QlikSense), you should also have a deep understanding of statistical analysis/modeling and experiment design as well as working knowledge of machine learning fundamentals. Because this role will enable and accelerate the analytical maturity of digital assistant teams across Intuit’s ecosystem, clear and precise communication with stakeholders (e.g. product managers, engineers, data scientists, business leaders) of different backgrounds will be critical.What you'll bring4-6+ years’ professional experience with data and statistical analysis, with a deep understanding of explanatory power and hypothesis-driven analysisExperience with tools to extract, manipulate, analyze, and visualize datasets (e.g. SQL, Excel, Python, Splunk, Tableau, Qlik Sense, Vertica, Hive).Fundamental understanding and application of machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques such as clustering, classification, regression, and random forest, and text miningProven track record of data visualization and story-telling, to develop actionable insights and business impactBachelor’s Degree, or equivalent work experience, in Quantitative field or commensurate experience (Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, Operations Research). Master’s degree preferredHow you will leadProvide guidance and thought partnership to business leaders and stakeholders on how best to harness available data for critical business needs and goalsTranslate business questions into verifiable hypotheses, create experiments and/or analysis to test them, and generate recommendations based on the findingsEffective storytelling with data, to educate and instill confidence, motivating stakeholders to act on recommendationsManage the full cycle of iterative big data exploration, including hypothesis setting, data cleansing, insight generation/visualization, and action planningDesign and implement the approach needed to methodically and iteratively structure, extract, analyze, validate, and communicate data-backed insights

While candidates in the listed location(s) are encouraged for this role, candidates in other remote US locations will be considered.

The Business Systems team works across all Databricks departments to support and build the required systems to run our business processes. The Business Systems Analyst is a new role, reporting to the Director of Business Systems Architecture, to implement projects that are necessary to the success of scaling the business.

You will work with business process owners to gather requirements, set expectations, and communicate on milestonesYou will oversee project management for internal projects, delivering on keeping projects and important milestones.Produce weekly status reports with dashboarding tools, such as TableauDocument business and data process flows and proceduresPrioritize requirements, oversee multiple concurrent projects, and modify management approachesManage scope and mitigate risk across projects

What we look for:

5+ years experience in successfully managing projects5+ years experience working with business owners to identify technical requirementsFamiliarity with business/back office systems (Salesforce, Netsuite, Marketo, and FinancialForce.)Experience building Dashboards and Reports using Salesforce and TableauExperience with project management systems (JIRA, Asana, etc.)[Preferred] Familiarity with process tools such as Visio, Draw.io is a plus

Benefits

Comprehensive health coverage including medical, dental, and vision401(k) PlanEquity awardsFlexible time offPaid parental leaveFamily PlanningGym reimbursementAnnual personal development fundWork headphones reimbursementEmployee Assistance Program (EAP)Business travel accident insurance

About Databricks

Databricks is the data and AI company. Thousands of organizations worldwide including Comcast, Condé Nast, Nationwide and H&M rely on Databricks' open and unified platform for data engineering, machine learning and analytics. Databricks is venture-backed and headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark, Delta Lake and MLflow, Databricks is on a mission to help data teams solve the world's toughest problems. ***This position requires the employee to be on site in Sacramento, CA. There is no relocation package offered.***American Building Supply (ABS), a subsidiary of Jeld Wen, and one of the Nation's largest wholesale suppliers of Doors, Door Hardware, Windows, and Millwork is currently seeking a Continuous Improvement Analyst to specialize in the continuous improvement of our Distribution and Manufacturing facility.Summary: The JELD-WEN Excellence Model (JEM) is a culture, a system and a tool kit. The lean manufacturing tools and process improvement techniques are proven in achieving operational excellence on a worldwide scale. JEM is built by JELD-WEN associates, reflecting our diverse experiences at lean, world-class organizations. Under the direct supervision of the Jem Leader, the JEM Coordinator will lead the plant’s CI initiatives designed to eliminate waste and non-value added activities and improve performance in Safety, Quality, Product Delivery, Cost and Inventory. This position will provide guidance and act as a resource to the Plant Managers and CI teams on the selection and project management of Lean projects.Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Include the following. Other duties may be assigned.· This position will lead the plant leadership team in developing the plant’s overall CI plan in alignment with the Plant Managers and corporate CI improvement teams.· This leader ensures that the Plant Managers and is aware of the corporate requirements and works in building an integrated plan that delivers both the needed results and the growth in capability (skills and culture) for sustaining CI.· This position will lead Lean projects for improvement results that can be leveraged across plants, functions, and product lines.· Ensures that CI training, tools, test practices and resources are available to employees at all levels and are being utilized appropriately and effectively.· Develops and executes a communication plan to support the rollout and education on continuous improvements to the plants.· Lead all reporting and root-cause analysis. Lead or coach focused improvement activities and teams to improve results like safety, quality, delivery, cost and inventory. Conduct root-cause analysis and coaching to resolve production issues.· Coach and teach the daily plant management system on the floor and plant management levels. Work and coach on improving machine performance and work flow.· Study process flow charts and recommend modifications in work flow.· Analyze and improve work and measure performance.· Coach the process of developing and deploying effective standard work practices across the plants. Share and reapply proven methods from other locations as appropriate. Communicate such changes in CI’s promptly to all to ensure consistency.· Facilitate and co-facilitate various CI related workshops and training events. Teach the concepts and coach the plant personnel to see and eliminate waste.· Works with the Plant Managers and plant leadership in analyzing key performance indicators to make the plants better measure, visualize, analyze, improve, report and implement CI’s based upon key performance indicators.Qualifications: · Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Operations, Manufacturing, or equivalent experience.· Hands on experience using modern Operational Excellence and Continuous Improvement methods (LEAN, TPS, SQDCI, etc.).· Proven Lean Training.· At least three (3) to five (5) years experience leading Lean Transformations in manufacturing operations, educating others on Lean principles and deployment planning.· Knowledge of manufacturing process improvement techniques, preferably in the door and window industry.· Strong project management, organizational, analytical, and presentation skills.· Demonstrated ability to apply critical thought processes to develop, recommend and implement strategies and programs that address plant and corporate objectives.· Outstanding written and oral communication skills up and down the organizational hierarchy to include corporate offices.· Demonstrated leadership skills with direct reports and influence on those with whom there is not a reporting relationship.· Demonstrated ability to resolve conflict effectively and problem solve.· Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Office and applicable JELD-WEN and ABS software applications.· Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality.· Demonstrated ability to work efficiently under conditions of multiple deadlines and changing priorities.· Ability to travel on occasion for training purposes and/or to plant locations.ABS takes pride in providing a supportive, employee-friendly environment. Our total compensation package includes health insurance, paid vacation and a 401(k) retirement plan with company match. While this helps us attract good people, our culture helps us keep them. We truly care about our employees and want your experience with us to be positive and rewarding.Job Type: Full-timeBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceDisability insuranceEmployee assistance programEmployee discountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offReferral programRetirement planTuition reimbursementVision insuranceSchedule:Day shiftMonday to FridayWork Location:One locationCompany's website:www.abs-abs.comCompany's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/americanbuildingsupplyBenefit Conditions:Waiting period may applyOnly full-time employees eligibleWork Remotely:NoCOVID-19 Precaution(s):Personal protective equipment provided or requiredTemperature screeningsSocial distancing guidelines in placeSanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

job_title: Sr. Financial Business Systems Analyst, RevPro
description:
This role will be within the IT enterprise Apps team. Responsibilities include supporting the Finance business during period close and improvement to the Zuora/RevPro implementation. Requires the ability to multitask, build a relationship with business, and manage project deliverables.

Responsibilities:

Work with Finance organization on revenue recognition projects and support Finance during period close processes.Analyze current systems and processes and determine ways to improve.Document and analysis business requirements, scope, and plan implementation.Develop detailed project plans for the scope of the project.Work with the ServiceNow platform to manage and track new projects.Work with the ServiceNow platform to manage support activities.Collaborate with other IT groups to ensure quality of data integrated with NetSuite and Zuora.

Qualifications/Skills Required and Preferred:

DescriptionBusiness Analyst

San Francisco, CA

First Republic is an ultra-high-touch bank that provides extraordinary client service. We believe that one-on-one interactions build lasting relationships. We move quickly to serve our clients' needs so that their financial transactions are handled with ease and efficiency. Client trust and security are paramount in our line of business. Ultimately, our goal is unsurpassed client satisfaction.

Incredible teams doing exceptional work, every day

We recognize that our competitive advantage starts with our people and our culture. At First Republic, we work hard and move quickly as a very coordinated team. If you are looking for an opportunity to grow and contribute in a fun, fast-paced environment, First Republic is the place for you. We have exceptional people focused on providing extraordinary service.

First Republic's "Continuous Process Improvement" (CPI) department is part of the Empower program within the bank - with a focus on empowering our people to deliver extraordinary service to clients. The CPI team works across the enterprise to support identification and resolution of operational improvement opportunities. The team solves for process improvements and product enhancements with a focus on client experience, operational efficiency and risk management. This department plays a key role in supporting the bank to scale while continuing to provide differentiated client service.ResponsibilitiesCommon goals, uncommon potential

A key aspect of this department is to implement solutions that improve our ability to provide exceptional client service. The right candidate will have a mindset to engage with our colleagues (front-line and operations) - understanding their processes and pain points, challenging the status-quo, evaluating additional opportunities, see the âbig-picture', and ultimately helping design a creative solution that will enable our colleagues to provide high-touch client service.

To that end, the Business Analyst will partner closely with businesses to support process improvement initiatives. This includes engaging across various levels of the organization to identify problems and collaboratively define requirements and process changes/solutions, as appropriate. The Business Analyst will also help support implementations.

The Business Analyst supports multiple lines of businesses on projects building and improving the data infrastructure. They build technical specifications that ensures businesses receive the right data sets for analytics, and internal and external reporting.

This role requires an understanding of banking products, operations and system functionality. Candidates must be results-oriented and have excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact with stakeholders at various level.

What you'll do as a Business Analyst:



Keep the client and our front-line colleagues at the forefront of all analysis, requirements, process changes and solutions. Help enable high-touch, high-quality client service while scaling our processes to support volume growth and changing client needs
Support implementation of new capabilities and drive value from existing capabilities
Perform dataanalysis and process design activities at the operational and organizational level
Coordinate the efforts of internal technical and non-technical staff, and of key business users for an initiative
Work with the business to come up with solutions for process improvements
Engage and direct business partners and subject matter experts to identify priorities and scope for medium business problems
Define and document business requirements
Provide assistance in identifying, evaluating, and developing systems and procedures that are cost effective and meet business requirements
Plan and execute user acceptance testing
Collaborate with management to ensure timely and successful resolution of project issues
Support project planning and managing of business team deliverables
Attend/Coordinate/Lead meetings as required
Support production reporting systems

Additional responsibilities include:

Adhere to and comply with all applicable federate laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to Anti-Money Laundering (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, USA PATRIOT Act, etc.)
Adhere to Bank policies and procedures
Complete required training

DISCLAIMER:

Critical features of this job are described under the items above. They may be subject to change at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. This job description reflects Management's assignment of essential functions; it does not prescribe or restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Nothing in this job description restricts Management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.QualificationsYou could be a great fit if you have:



Professional and personable communication skills across multiple channels, such as email, phone, chat, and meetings
Excellent organizational, planning, and analytical skills
Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and handle competing deadlines
A team orientation to go beyond explicitly stated job duties to further team and company objectives
Mentality that is open and eager to make improvements
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, particularly for presentation of data reports (Excel, PowerPoint)
Four Year degree or equivalent professional experience and/or qualificationsEducation, Experience, Certifications Required: Bachelor's degree and 5-10 years experience in process improvement, technology project design/development/implementation preferably within banking or financial services.
Preferred: 2+ years experience in RPA project delivery.Technical Knowledge
Project/program management experience relating to technology deployment (e.g. RPA or other emerging technologies).
Process re-engineering, change management and process automation experience required.
Professional services, management consulting or project management preferred.
Financial services industry preferred.


Products & Software



BluePrism, UIPath, Automation Anywhere or equivalent industry-leading RPA platforms.
Jira, TFS or equivalent project management software

Job Demands:

Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.
Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.


Own your work and your career - apply now

Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability - that's the First Republic way. Come join us!

Company DescriptionVisa Inc. is a global payments technology company that connects consumers, businesses, financial institutions and governments in more than 200 countries and territories, enabling them to use digital currency instead of cash and checks. Visa does not issue cards, extend credit or set rates and fees for consumers. Visa's innovations enable its bank customers to offer consumers choices: Pay now with debit, ahead of time with prepaid or later with credit products. From the world's major cities to remote areas without banks, people are increasingly relying on digital currency along with mobile technology to use their money anytime, make purchases online, transfer funds and access basic financial services. All of which makes their lives easier and helps grow economies. Behind the Visa brand are more than 5,000 talented employees who continuously raise the bar with innovative solutions and products that deliver the convenience and security of digital currency to more people all over the world.

CyberSource, a Visa company, is the leading payment management company focused on eCommerce. The company serves over 450,000 online merchants, including many leading global brands as well as a broad base of small to mid-sized accounts. Approximately 1 out of every 4 dollars spent online in North America is processed through CyberSource, and we are growing worldwide. CyberSource is a payment management service leader, combining a comprehensive suite of global payment options with sophisticated fraud and security management, delivered in a software-as-a-service model.Job DescriptionVisa’s CyberSource division is looking for a savvy individual with a technical bend and interest in product ownership to help us continue to grow and launch new features and services. The Technical Product Analyst (TPA) is a hands-on role where you will have to analyze technical artifacts, study payment processor specifications, and write user stories for our engineering and test engineering teams to build features and products that delight our merchants, partners, consumers, and developers. The TPA is also expected to write programming pseudo-code in a home grown tool that translates business rules into technical specifications that enable our merchants to transact with payment processors worldwide. The successful candidate will work closely with business product managers, engineers, architects, user experience, and global cross-functional counterparts.

If you have strong analytical skills, a curious mindset, and a strong desire to create a career in technical product management, come talk to us. You will get a chance to work with some of the brightest payment professionals and take your career to new heights. You will be part of the Technical Product Management organization which will enable Visa and its subsidiaries such as Cybersource, Authorize.Net, Verify, as well its strategic partners to rapidly build, iterate and refine payment experiences across all channels such as web and mobile.

We have a start-up mentality, take smart risks, solve important problems, and adapt and iterate quickly. We are looking for someone who is passionate about the payments space to join a team that is made stronger through innovation and collaboration.

Essential Functions:

Be hands-on with describing business rules as technical artifacts for analysts, business product managers, and any functional team that depends on this informationDefine business rules in a proprietary tool using a proprietary language, perform unit tests, resolve bugs and be responsible for the delivery of the project to productionBe comfortable looking at system logs when needed and identifying bugs when they might appear during course of analysisWork with technical product managers and business product managers to understand the requirements and receive technical specificationsWork with architects and engineers to come up solutions addressing business needsAnalyze technical specifications and create user stories for engineering and test engineering teamsBe the product owner for the scrum teams driving project executionMaintain the metrics for the product/capabilitiesHighly execution focused by working in conjunction with various counterpartsParticipate in daily scrum meetingsBe the primary liaison between other business units, BU product managers, engineering and other applicable groups to ensure flawless integration of new and existing feature sets


QualificationsBasic Qualifications:

2 years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD)

Preferred Qualifications:

3 or more years of work experience or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD)Prior experience as a test engineer, software engineer, business analyst, product manager, or system analyst is requiredMinimum 3 years of work experience with a Bachelor’s degree or a minimum of 1 year of experience with an advanced degree (e.g. MS, MBA)Demonstrated quantitative and qualitative reasoning skills through prior projectsComfortable working in an agile environment and with cross-functional and regionally distributed teamsMust have excellent written and verbal communication skills to articulate business opportunities, requirements, and customer problemsBasic understanding or interest in REST, SOAP, or other API technologies is requiredBasic understanding of version control systems is preferredAbility to understand technical design specifications described in UML or other business process notation is desiredExperience within a technology or financial services company is desired


Additional InformationWork Hours This position requires the incumbent to be available during core business hours.

Travel Requirements This position requires the incumbent to travel for work 10% of the time.

Mental/Physical Requirements This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, and reach with hands and arms.

EEO Statement Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.
