Overview:Senior Credit Analyst supports the business lenders in performing analysis on diverse types of borrowers (both individuals and businesses) and completes credit memorandums for new and existing credit union relationships. Assists lenders in determining the most appropriate loan structure and provides information and assistance to the Vice President Chief Credit Officer as needed.Key responsibilities include inputting and analyzing financial data (tax returns, financial statements, and credit bureaus) to determine business and global cash flow of commercial borrowers and to interpret the repayment capacity of borrowers to minimize risk and help grow revenue for the credit union. The Senior Business Credit Analyst is crucial in ensuring loan packages are complete according to credit union policy and regulatory guidelines, monitoring covenant compliance, and for completing timely annual reviews on large loan customers. The Senior Business Credit Analyst will also provide mentoring and support to junior credit analysts and others on a regular basis, as well as ensure that their duties are performed accurately, timely / efficiently and within credit union policies / regulatory guidelines.Upholds legal, regulatory and compliance requirements unique to the role, in addition to Bank Secrecy Act, Anti-Money Laundering, OFAC, and Information Security policies and procedures. Completes annually required compliance related courses as established by Harborstone Credit Union policies and/or practices.Completes annually required Product and Process Knowledge competency testing, in addition to job related courses as established by Harborstone Credit Union policies and/or practices.Effectively builds trust with members and internal staff by embodying and demonstrating the Core Values of the organization (Trust, Advocacy, Prosperity, Equity, Empathy, and Simplicity). Consistently advocates for Harborstone’s members, offering opportunities for financial equity and prosperity and the tools necessary to help them thrive. Demonstrates value and difference by expertly informing our communities of effective financial products, services, and solutions to help them attain their full potential.Responsibilities:o Credit risk analysis skills.o Thorough understanding of global cash flow and underwriting criteria.o Loan documentation and application system knowledge (preferred).o Ability to work independently and as part of a team.o Working knowledge of credit union, state and federal policies, procedures and laws regarding lending.o Sageworks Analyst software operating system (preferred).o Demonstrates functional, technical and credit expertise and effectively transfers this knowledge to team members.o Provides coaching and mentoring to junior credit analysts and others within the organization.o Prepare detailed analyses of historical and future property operations to make informed decisions about performance.o Reviews real estate appraisal, environmental reports and construction budget review.o Oversee and manage financial information files to assure current reports, financial statements and required information is received when the credit is reviewed.o Bondable.Qualifications:Five or more years’ work experience in a financial institution, in commercial lending and credit administration preferred.Three years’ credit experience.Experience with processing commercial real estate (CRE) loans is required.

Who We Are:

At PEMCO it’s all about people, starting with our customers. We’re a mutual insurance company owned by our Northwest policyholders and protecting their dreams since 1949. We believe in listening to our customers and showing that we understand them in ways that others don’t.

Why We Need You:

PEMCO has a dynamic and challenging opportunity for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our community. In this role, you’ll be responsible for reporting, interpreting, and translating department-level data to provide insights that drive effective business decisions. The position ensures the necessary department data is available for use, either through the corporate data warehouse or by direct extraction from the source. If you want to help us harness the power of data to propel us into the future, we’d love to chat with you.

What You’ll be Doing:

Monitor the department's data and meta data with an understanding of data sources, validation techniques, metrics and standard definitions, and the interaction of data with other departments, corporate finances and budgeting Occasional CAT duty as needed Participate in discussions with department leadership and business subject matter experts to discover and document analytics needs. Provide data collection and analysis support to cross-functional teams in the execution of projects and initiatives Retrieve, prepare, model and analyze department data including using Tableau and a variety of technology tools, systems and analytics approaches; demonstrate curiosity around data findings, anomalies and opportunities beyond what is requested Work directly with the corporate Information Management team to ensure that the right data warehouse data resources are available to meet the department's analytics needs Design, develop, and maintain department metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards; report results of analyses to department leadership; provide insights and/or recommendations to improve operational and financial effectiveness and workforce efficiency and present in a clear and concise manner to senior leaders Demonstrate proficiency with department-level software systems; provide end user training and support including educating on self-service data exploration capabilities. Demonstrate behaviors consistent with PEMCO's policies, values, code of ethics and business conduct. Authentically support the PEMCO Brand and constantly are on the lookout for top talent to join us to achieve our Mission to Worry Less and Live More Other duties as assigned

What You'll Bring:

B.A. or B.S. degree or equivalent work experience (Computer science, mathematics or related field) 2 years of experience in using Tableau Desktop and Tableau Server is required 3 years of experience in business intelligence including excellent SQL skills, primarily on the MS SQL server platform is required Experience with data analysis / profiling / organizing data, and ability to participate in conversations with both business SMEs and technical teams Experience developing Tableau dashboards using data visualization best practices and advanced Tableau functions such as table calculations, LOD calculations, mapping etc. Professional Licenses & Certifications: Tableau Certified Professional MS Office: Skilled proficiency in MS Visio is required MS Office: Skilled proficiency in Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook is required Analytical and data-driven: Thinks analytically; a structured thinker who can put complex ideas into clear frameworks; uses data to conduct root cause analysis and develops high quality, consumable, and consistent metrics that drive strategic objectives and priorities is required Precision: Is detail orientated and has a strong desire for accuracy and thoroughness

We’ve Got You Covered:

Competitive salary 200% match on your 401(k) up to 6% of your pay Generous medical, dental, disability and life insurance plans A friendly, professional work environment The opportunity to work at a place of integrity, where customer service is emphasized

Work closely with our Product Managers and Actuaries to provide support on analyses and to develop recommendations that will support the Company's and Product Department's initiatives. You’ll bring with you experience analyzing data to solve complex business problems and making actionable recommendations for improvements.

What You'll Be Doing

Contribute to the achievement of short and long-term strategies to achieve profitable growth leveraging quantitative and qualitative data Perform semi-complex analysis to evaluate the performance of and identify trends and issues for our products and make actionable recommendations for improvements Assist in product and rating reviews, including making pricing recommendations Compile and submit materials for rate and form filings Query databases to generate scheduled and ad hoc reports and analysis to support department goals Plan and manage small to medium scale, complex projects Build tools to create efficiencies, especially in analyzing metrics Document system workflows and business processes Manage expectations; prioritize own workload and communicate status

What You'll Bring

Two or more (2+) years of data analysis and modeling experience required Requires Bachelor's degree; preference to Business, Economics, Mathematics, or other quantitative fields of study Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint) Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel (create pivot tables, use lookup formulas, etc.) Intermediate proficiency with database software (SQL Server, Teradata, SAS, etc.) required Business intelligence software experience is a plus (Tableau, Power BI, Microstrategy, etc.) Property and casualty insurance industry experience desired and knowledge of insurance contracts, forms, product pricing and how state regulations impact the business are a plus!

Job Conditions

This job requires ability to use a computer and work occasional variable hours, depending on work assigned.

We've Got You Covered

Competitive salary 200% match on your 401(k) up to 6% of your pay Generous medical, dental, disability and life insurance plans A friendly, professional work environment The opportunity to work at a place of integrity, where customer service is emphasized

At PEMCO it’s all about people, starting with our customers. We’re a mutual insurance company owned by our Northwest policyholders and protecting their dreams since 1949. We believe in listening to our customers and showing that we understand them in ways that others don’t.

As a Senior Business Systems Analyst at PEMCO, you’ll be responsible for providing consultation to business unit managers to determine technical solutions to business problems, by conducting operational and organization studies on business units. The position applies a thorough knowledge of a business unit and knowledge of systems technology to identify and design improvements for computer-based systems.

What You'll Be Doing

Manage stories in a sprint to ensure a continuous workflow to developers and quality assurance team members; perform complex analysis using data and present data analysis results using robust presentation and/or dashboarding Meet with a variety of business leaders to identify and document business requirements and understand business impacts of implementing new technology platforms and application upgrades Negotiate agreements and commitments by facilitating communication between business units and the technical staff from initial requirements to final implementation Perform business or system analysis to translate business requirements into functional specifications and specifications of user interfaces and manage changes Provide and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders, recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilities Facilitate work sessions with business units and technical staff to develop functional business requirements for medium to large sized projects and may lead small to medium projects through all phases of the project management lifecycle Facilitate business process redesign sessions and create documentation, as needed, for new technology Facilitate agile/scrum ceremonies like daily standups, mid iteration reviews, end of sprint retrospectives; coordinate end user demonstrations at regular intervals to gather timely feedback on the end product Act as a subject matter expert of"as is" and"to be" business processes and facilitate end user training as needed, ensuring technical and user documentation is completed as needed; serve as a key resource in the analysis, development, testing, implementation and maintenance of applications Demonstrate behaviors consistent with PEMCO's policies, values, code of ethics and business conduct. Authentically support the PEMCO Brand and constantly are on the lookout for top talent to join us to achieve our Mission to Worry Less and Live More Other duties as assigned

What You'll Bring

5 years of experience information technology roles Property and casualty insurance industry experience, knowledge relevant business landscape, and trends in growth and insurance environments; can spot early indicators of change and apply strategies to adapt quickly B.A. or B.S. degree or equivalent work experience (information technology or business administration or equivalent) Working knowledge and demonstrated experience with Waterfall and Agile project methodologies Skilled proficiency of Basic SQL language skills and data sources, types, architectures, models, and diagrams Demonstrated skills and expertise in data management tools and defect management tools Excellent written communications skills sufficient to write systems documentation, project documentation, reports and business correspondences in an organized and concise fashion Communicates clearly and informatively, verbally and in writing, with colleagues, customers, and the community in both technical and non-technical professional language. Proficient with MS Office Suite Skilled proficiency in Smartsheet is preferred

job_title: Associate Advisor - First Year Analyst - Seattle- June 2021 Start
description:
Our First Year Analyst (FYA) position is the first step in your journey towards becoming a Brighton Jones advisor. Our program equips recent undergraduates with the skills and experiences necessary to deliver strategic wealth management advice to clients.Many firms throw their new hires straight into the deep end with a desk and a phone book, expecting them to bring in their own clients starting with friends and family. Your colleagues are often competitors, giving you little opportunity or incentive to collaborate. You won’t be competing against your teammates, because you’re not responsible for bringing in clients.At Brighton Jones, we pride ourselves on doing things differently. We’ve created a supportive, collaborative and challenging environment focused on learning and growth. We believe authentic relationships are built with trust, and over time. Your primary goal as a FYA will be to dig in, get your hands dirty and LEARN. Our process is designed to set you up for success. There’s a reason why we’re one of largest and fastest-growing Registered Investment Advisory firms in the country and have an award-winning culture. Come make a difference with our #oneteam.Successful candidates for this role will bring a “how can I help?” attitude and a willingness to do whatever it takes to help our clients and colleagues succeed. Our strategy is to find and reward great people who are passionate about this business; who want to contribute to and celebrate the success of others; and who want to be part of an organization that leads the industry. Your Role


Manage the day to day responsibilities, priorities and workload of their client service teams. This includes providing analytical, operational, and administrative support for the acquisition, implementation, and ongoing retention of clientsTimely execution of intra-day requests with strict timeframes such as trades, wire requests, and journals. Responsible for initiating requests, review, and approval. Ensures completion within specified timeframes and provides thorough communication to client throughout the process.Primary point of contact for custodians around all operational and tactical service mattersGather, organize, and input client data into the CRM (Salesforce); manage data accuracy and integrity and keep records currentAct as the point person for all client service team inquiries; work with team members to ensure all action items are moved forward and completedWork with the team to craft client meeting agenda and prepare deliverables to be presented; analyzes client data and develops strategies; occasionally attends client meetings; ensures all client related action items are communicated and memorialized in the CRMPrepare all standard deliverables related to the delivery of wealth management advice based on inputs from team members. Review current client portfolios and makes recommendations in consultation with team regarding changes based on both asset allocation and location; considers both strategic and tactical allocation opportunities to improve return and reduce volatilityProvide spreadsheet analysis on an ad-hoc basis for more advanced financial topics and other specialty requests such as tax loss harvesting, stock option and restricted stock inventories, and other wealth transfer strategies; maintains all record-keeping related to these activities, including cost basis and other position data via portfolio management software Work with Tax, Investments and Estate Planning to determine additional levels of detail required for the client's situationManages tax coordination and execution for clients’ personal and trust accounts.



Details:

The Spur Group is looking for a Senior Consultant - Data Engineering to join our Data& AI organization. As a Data Engineer, you will lead the design, implementation, and successful delivery of large-scale, critical, and complex data architecture, storage, and pipelines that improve the lives of tens of millions of people every single day. Best of all, you’ll be part of a team-centric culture where fellow consultants and managers support you and encourage you to grow every day.

 What You'll Do

Build large-scale distributed data processing systems, data lakes, and optimize for both computational and storage efficiency on cloud platforms like AzureDesign, implement and automate data pipelines sourcing data from internal and external systems, transforming the data for the optimal needs of various systems.Design data schema and operate cloud-based data warehouses and SQL database systems.Write Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) jobsDesign, implement and automate integrations with analytical tool (i.e., juypter, excel, SAS) and business intelligence (i.e., PowerBI, Tableau) toolsOwn the design, development and maintenance of ongoing metrics, reports, analyses, dashboards, etc. to drive key business decisions.Drive architectural plans and implementation for future data storage, ETL, reporting, and analytic solutions.Provide insightful code reviews, receive code reviews constructively and take ownership of outcomes (“you ship it, you own it”), working very efficiently and routinely deliver the right things in the front-end UI area.

Who You Are (What you'd bring to Spur)

You have a background in data and software engineering and a passion to learn.You've made mistakes in the past and have learned a lot from them. You apply this learning regularly.You believe there are generally multiple ways to solve a technical problem, each with different trade-offs.You approach projects, tasks, and unknowns with curiosity, and enjoy sharing what you know and what you learn with the people around you.You believe that a team is strongest when it is diverse and includes multiple perspectives.You are able to put yourself into your customer's shoes. You frequently immerse yourself in the customer experience to understand how you can better serve them.

Requirements

BS in Computer Science or related field, or an equivalent in relevant work experience.Experience implementing big data processing technology: Hadoop, Apache Spark, etc.3+ years of Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Ruby, Java, etc.).Experience writing and optimizing advanced SQL queries in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.3+ years experience in cloud-first design, preferably AzureExperience in data architecture, databases (e.g., MySQL, Redshift, PostgreSQL), SQL and DDD/ER/ORM design.Knowledge of software engineering practices& best practices for the software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations.

Why Spur

We are go-to-market consultants who drive results that matter. As the leading authority on go-to-market solutions, we act as an extension of our client teams, providing the support, tools, and strategies to achieve important outcomes. If you tackle challenges with unmatched persistence and believe learning is critical to ongoing growth, we want you on our team.

We live and breathe our core values of Inclusion, Courage, Accountability, Respect and Excellence, and we hope to see them in every employee. We are a company of passionate individuals striving to improve healthcare and patient experiences. Our evidence-based medical content and software tools empower both payers and providers to make the best decisions for patients. Our work makes a difference in the quality of care that hundreds of thousands of patients receive each day and we're proud of our positive impact.

We are looking for a Marketing Automation Data Analyst to join our dynamic team in Seattle, WA. Come be a part of a great company, proven by our average rating on Glassdoor of 4.7. You will help optimize our marketing tech stack and ensure efficient data flow between marketing systems, maintain database quality, support lead attribution initiatives, and develop dashboards and reports that clearly speak actionable insights. This person reports to the Director of Marketing and will collaborate across Marketing and Sales to drive growth, operational excellence, and ensure we're measuring effectiveness throughout the customer journey.

In this role you will:

Own Marketo database hygiene and integrity, including list management and opt ins/opt outs
Work with cross-functional teams to ensure accuracy of data and consistency across all systems integrated with Marketo
Manage and troubleshoot technical aspects of our marketing tech stack to ensure proper data values, data flow, and sync between systems
Support marketing data intelligence, analysis, and reporting of key marketing metrics and KPIs
Help improve our existing marketing attribution true up process, and audit this data monthly
Own process for new data uploads
Interface with IT to build and maintain data fields for targeted campaigns, and identify improvement opportunities
Create technical documentation for various marketing projects
Prepare monthly presentations that summarize key insights
Manage other projects, as assigned, to drive operational excellence and business growth

We'd love to hear from you if:

You have 3-5+ years of database marketing, marketing operations, and/or analytics experience is required
You have hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms (Marketo preferred)
You have experience with Salesforce or similar enterprise-wide CRMs, and reporting
You have experience with Bizible or other marketing attribution tools a plus
You have experience working with data enrichment vendors a plus
You have a strong understanding of marketing metrics and marketing attribution methodologies
You have demonstrated analytical and problem-solving skills
You are excellent team player and works well with cross-functional teams
You pay excellent attention to detail and communications skills
You are very proficient with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint)

We embrace diversity and equal opportunity, and are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. It is only with diverse thoughts and ideas that we'll be able to create the change we want in healthcare. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be for it.

job_title: Business Systems Analyst - Service and Finance
description: Business Systems Analyst – Services and FinanceIntapp helps firms shift to a modernization strategy and gain a growth edge in today’s competitive marketplace. We offer intelligent solutions built for partner-led firms– spanning the entire client lifecycle, from strategy through origination and execution. Intapp is looking for a highly motivated team player for the key role of Business Systems Analyst, supporting Services and Finance within the Business Applications group.As a member of our Enterprise Applications Team, you will be helping to maintain and support Intapp’s cloud-based Enterprise Applications portfolio consisting of Project management/resourcing, project billing and Accounting solutions.As a Business Systems Analyst, you will be responsible for administering and supporting Intapp’s Services and Finance systems. You will be responsible for coordinating with key business partners regarding their business requirements and functioning as the functional lead for services and finance systems and design. The ideal candidate should have demonstrated skills in understanding and adhering to policies, procedures, and operating controls to ensure consistency and timeliness of execution. They will also need to be able to combine business process knowledge with a deep technical understanding of related systems and software to help identify and implement scalable solutions.ResponsibilitiesFunction as an analyst and business partner to the professional services and accounting teams to model, design, and build business solutions that improve and scale Intapp’s Services and finance processesResponsible for owning services and accounting system configuration - Configure fields, workflows, roles/permissions, custom rules, reports, and dashboardsAbility to explain technical objects or designs in non-technical terms for business partners (i.e. being able to digest something like a workflow & tell the business what it does without being too technical)Experience with integrations and the flow of data across multiple systems is a plusKnowledge of both business and IT process design and best practicesCollaborate with Services and Finance teams to define requirements and manage expectations from project inception through delivery, including status updates, issue resolution, scope changes, UAT, deployment, etcWork with business leadership, internal/external development resources and suppliers to ensure timely, accurate and cost-effective delivery of IT solutionsCreate and execute test cases for unit/regression testing; Interface with the application development teams to validate test results for new features/applications, verifying that they meet the requirements of the business before facilitating UAT and deploymentMaintain and document current and new system process flowsProvide day-to-day administration and maintenance of critical business systems including OpenAir and NetSuite. Triaging and resolving production support issues and implementing small enhancement requestsREQUIREMENTS:Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university with minimum of 5 years of system administration or application support experience.At least 4-6 years of business systems analyst experience in a global organization utilizing NetSuite3+ years of professional experience supporting a Services/Finance organizationDemonstrated understanding of Services process – Project billing/ resource managementExperience with any Services application – OpenAir or Oracle project accountingExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsExperience with IT compliance controlsKnowledge of project management methodologies (waterfall or agile) a plusDemonstrated ability to remain composed in a dynamic environment and communicate successfully to all levels of employeesExperience in supporting a highly integrated ERP ecosystem with working knowledge of the following systems; NetSuite OpenAir.5+ years of Experience in providing end to end PSA solutions.Understanding of industry best practices implementing solutions for professional services team.

The Role

The Spur Group is looking for a Senior Consultant to join our Data + AI Team. In this role, you become a fully integrated member into project teams within the first few months of employment. The combination of on-the-job learning, classroom training, and ongoing coaching and mentoring enable Senior Consultants to enjoy professional growth and career opportunities. The firm’s culture which is built on teaming and teaching, empowers our professionals to support each other in their career development.

The Senior Consultant’s career track includes promotion to Individual Contributor SC roles, Manager and beyond for individuals looking to develop a rewarding, long-term career in consulting with The Spur Group

What You'll Do

Participate, contribute in and run client interviews as well as related fact-finding initiatives.Conduct appropriate data analysis including statistical analysis.Apply logic and Spur methodologies to provide recommendations to clients.Communicate project findings, conclusions and recommendations with peers and clients.Develop communication from emails to executive presentations.Prepare drafts of documents that are of high quality, error free deliverables.Participate and contribute in client meetings to review and present analytical approaches and interpret results.Work independently or closely with client and team members to accomplish tasks.Engage in project support and complete required tasks.

Who You Are (What You Bring)

Bias for action – you anticipate client needs and follow up appropriately. You have a bias for action, have a willingness to learn, a high aptitude for perseverance and self-motivation. You show pride in your work and follow through as necessary. You have the ability to work independently and on teams. You are proactive to ask for help or guidance as needed.

Problem solver – you are capable to research and gather data to support strategic discussion. You have a genuine interest in technology and a passion for what we do using data analytics. You suggest innovative solutions to business problems. You propose direction in projects and use appropriate judgement in driving outcomes. You understand how the deliverable fits into the larger process.

Effective communicator – you are capable of drafting effective, complete and error free client correspondence. You listen, ask appropriate questions and know which method of communication is appropriate for each audience. You are respectful in all your communication.

Client and Peer Relationships – you have demonstrated the ability to work independently as well as collaboratively with clients and team members to deliver results. You have the ability to work with clients in face to face settings as well as virtually. You are respectful, accountable and self-aware.

Detail oriented – you are list/task driven and pay attention to the details. Prior project management experience and/or skills are a plus.

Adaptability – You are able to deal with ambiguity and changing roles, teams or tasks and still drive professional work products to completion. You have the willingness to teach and the curiosity to learn.

Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in (Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or Economics) OR equivalent experience. Master Preferred.5+ years of consulting experience with a national firm. Big 4 experience preferred.5+ years of relevant professional experience required (Data Science, Analytics, AI, Machine Learning)3+ years leading large scale Data Analytics and Data projects for Enterprise clients.2+ years business process modeling and developing solutions architectures.1+ years with Python, R, R Studio and building predictive models in clear concise and unique ways.1+ years with Azure Machine Learning / Machine Learning Studio1+ years of knowledge and the application of Design Thinking Principals.1+ years with DAX, and SQL Query and using visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, and QlikView.Working knowledge of Azure Data Lake Services, Azure Databricks.Working knowledge of data management platforms such as Snowflake, Segment, SQL Server 2016, SAP HANA, and Hadoop preferred.Experience providing solutions to Hi-tech, Telecommunications, Aerospace, Retail and the Entertainment industries preferred.Working knowledge of Agile SAFeExtremely proficient in Microsoft O365 (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook).Working experience authoring Features, User Stories and Acceptance Criteria.Good business acumen and awareness of business trends.Quantitative skills and general problem-solving skills.Strong interpersonal and team working skills.Polished communication skills (written and verbal).Ability to learn quickly and resourcefully.High degree of motivation, flexibility and creativity.Genuine desire to work hard and progress rapidly in the consulting profession.Positive attitude and strong willingness to learn from mentors and peers.Ability to travel (Minimal requirements if any. Sometimes on short notice).

What We Offer 

 Competitive salary and total rewards packageHealth, Dental, Vision benefits for you and your family (100% paid by the company)Life, Accidental Death& Dismemberment, and Disability insuranceOpportunity to participate in 401k with up to 4% optional company matchFlexible vacationCell phone and serviceA world-class community at Spur!

job_title: Sr BI Analyst / Technical Project Manager at Microsoft
description: Account Based Marketing – Cloud + Enterprise - ContractAre you an experienced BI Analyst and Project Manager ready to partner with the Global Demand Center (GDC) marketing team to direct how Microsoft competes globally? Cloud technologies have disrupted the marketplace and are now part of a fast-pace, exciting industry. This is your opportunity to be at the center of the action and make an impact by guiding Microsoft’s Account Based Marketing (ABM) and Targeting Strategies with high visibility analytics projects.This role has two main aspects to it (50/50 BI Analyst/TPM), so it has many interesting parts:As a BI Analyst , you will be a key lead in the customer analytics space responsible for measurement, impact and analysis. You will collaborate with core stakeholders to identify critical business questions and develop analysis & learning plans to address them. Additionally, you will manage multi-month strategic or operational analytical initiatives across various, engaged stakeholders, own and contribute to reporting and visualization efforts to support the communication of program insights to support decisions from the strategic to the tactical, manage ad hoc request in-take and prioritization for your subject area and provide dedicated analysis and insights monthly and you will work with the data engineering team to find opportunities to expand capabilities and develop robust solutions for the business.As a Technical PM , you will coordinate between the Analyst team, the BI team and GDC Data Engineering team. Right now, the team is small but there are multiple workstreams going on concurrently. In order to scale the work / team, a TPM is needed to come in and coordinate requests, monitor progress across workstreams, do lots of technical platform documentation work (especially if solution is being mainstreamed – will need to get ducks in a row, before passing it over). Right now, the team is just in work mode and not taking care and thinking longer term – Need to think about how to coordinate with Agile BI (and GDC Data Engineering team) for onboarding. Since the Analysts will be taking on different capabilities, the TPM will need to coordinate efforts across the capabilities and work with the platform stakeholders on technical requirements/prioritization.Qualifications:Must have experience in analysis or finance supporting sales or marketing, marketing technology management, or marketing business managementMust have experience with marketing campaign / customer analytics and intelligent targeting.Strong experience with advanced Excel, PowerPivot, Power BI, SQL, Azure Synapse. modeling, and Starlight (other technical skills encouraged)Understanding Marketo data, and/or GDCs use of that data is a huge plusIdeal to have Dynamics, BizApps, Modern Workplace or Azure marketing experience at MicrosoftBusiness analysis and reporting experience within Microsoft is preferredMotivated, highly entrepreneurial, and comfortable with ambiguity in a dynamic environmentExperience as a Technical Project Manager, planning, managing stakeholders, milestones, status reporting, and process documentationCoordinating and working with data engineering teamsExtremely strong collaboration, communication, and follow-through skillsWorking in a fast paced, constantly changing environment, dealing with lot of ambiguity is SUPER important (and while this is common in many job descriptions, it’s more true here than most places)Ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders is a key skill. Being able to track down who has the data or the answer needed, adds a lot of value here.Action-oriented people do well here.Role is highly technical, must be able to write SQL queries, do analysis, write reports, generate data and see the problems with the data.MS finance tools like MS Sales and Mercury and querying with MSRA are helpfulCollege degree (MBA/Masters preferred)ABOUT INVISO : Inviso is a premier consulting firm that delivers business solutions through Software Asset Management (SAM), Office 365 and Azure (Cloud), Modern App Dev and Business Intelligence, Staffing, and Marketing. We are an entrepreneurial, agile organization with a broad range of business experience and talents, and a laser focus on adding value to our customers. With headquarters in Bellevue, WA and additional locations around the world, we assist hundreds of customers across North America and beyond.

SIHB Core CompetenciesCore Competencies are foundational commitments and skills that all SIHB staff are expected to develop. These competencies define common measures for performance that are applied to every role in the organization.Commitment to Indigenous and Organizational Values: Everything we do at SIHB is centered on Traditional Indian Medicine. It is our responsibility to maintain cultural integrity in all that we do.Accountability: All employees of SIHB effectively manage their own work and the work of their teams. We take ownership of our actions and decisions. We all strive to deliver the highest quality work and care, while respecting our teammates and relatives.Collaboration: SIHB is a team-oriented organization. As team members, we share the responsibility of working toward a common purpose. We collaborate with our colleagues across the organization to deliver the highest quality of care and results in alignment with our mission, vision, values and Theory of Change.Communication: We practice effective and clear communication with staff, relatives, teams and community. We demonstrate empathy among each other and with those we serve, and transparency in our decision making.Customer Service Orientation: All employees of SIHB recognize the needs of the diverse community we serve. We put the needs of our relatives first by delivering the highest quality, professional, responsive, and innovative care. Our relatives come first and deserve the best.Position Summary:The Data Analyst Manager will have a strong technical background in data visualization, data architecture and analytics, as well as the ability to lead and coordinate the efforts of a growing team of data analysts and data coordinators. job_title: Senior Business Analyst (Process Improvement Experience Preferred)
description: Looking for an individual with intensive process improvement experience.SUMMARY:Under the general supervision of the AVP of Program Management, the Senior Business Analyst (BA) performs thorough analysis of business problems and processes, as well as document business and end-user needs to define functional and non-functional requirements for business solutions. The Senior BA is responsible for reviewing assigned business processes from end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial and technological risks. Identify opportunities to improve efficiency. The Senior BA will also be responsible to elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify and manage the requirements of the project stakeholders in support of enterprise projects, including members and end-users, and serves as the conduit for requirements that flow between business units and technical teams responsible for solution delivery. This position has advanced to expert, wide-range job knowledge, and has proven the ability to handle significant responsibilities in addition to the Business Analyst role. Maintains a mature state of and seeks continuous improvement to the Business Analyst role and processes within the PIQA Team. The Senior BA also acts as a mentor, provides coaching, develops process improvement actions, and conducts training for other Business Analysts within the organization.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONs:Elicit, capture, track, and document requirements for all business units using best practices by working with the project sponsor and/or product business ownerElicit requirements from the businessPresent requirements to business owners, project teams and management and obtain agreement from all decision makers on the strategic and tactical direction of the initiativeLead the decomposition of high-level business and user requirements into development and test requirementsFacilitate systems scoping and requirements sessions, independently, with stakeholdersManage requirements traceability information and tracking requirements status throughout the project 2. Lead requirements analysis and verification to ensure that requirement statements are complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable, and that they conform to standardsCo-facilitate requirements prioritization with project managers and/or Junior Business AnalystsLead peer reviews and inspections of requirements documentsLead analysis and validation of project / maintenance release deliverables against project requirements and visionLead the analysis and preparation of testing requirements and documentation needs 3. Lead research and recommend improvements to business processes, organization, and rules that can increase the advantages gained from technical and non-technical solutionsEstablish the strategic direction of process and system improvements initiatives by working with business owners and identifying options.Document complex multi-system workflows and business processes and pro-actively identify improvements and opportunities.Utilizes process improvement tools, such as SIPOCs, X-Y Matrix, Multi-Vari charts, Fishbone Diagrams, and Value Stream Maps to identify major obstacles in achieving efficiency and consistency and guide the business unit through the process of improving operations.Evaluates project and process improvement success through the Benefit Realization Management process by analyzing and comparing business data to established KPI measurementsProvide direction for strategic business improvements4. Lead the continuous growth of the Business Analyst role within the PIQA team and across the credit union.Improve the Business Analysis process on a continuous basisProvide leadership for the Business Analysis process across the companyUnderstanding and working knowledge of Project Management systems and methodologies, to include agile.Mentor, coach, and advise less experienced Business Analysts.Perform other duties as assignedSKILLS/ABILITIES:Core CompetenciesMember and Relationship CenteredCollaborative and EmpoweringContinuously DevelopsAccountable for ResultsInnovativeContinuous Process Improvement 2. Your mission as a Senior Data Analyst:Serve as a Socrata platform and government data-enabled expert who combines strong technical proficiency and communication skills with excellent interpersonal and business consultant acumen. At Tyler Technologies, we exist to inspire and empower every public servant to address society's pressing issues. We do that by enabling data-driven leadership through connected data and shared insights.Our data-as-a-service platform and cloud-based solutions support the world’s most effective open and internal data sharing programs at every level of government. What we do matters. New York City, Virginia, the U.S. Department of Commerce, and 230+ other cities, states, counties and federal agencies use us to connect citizens and their internal teams with information that matters to their day-to-day life.As a Senior Data Analyst on our Global Services team, you are a technical consultant for the world’s leading governments and NGOs. You design and build data-driven experiences, leveraging best practices in data science to help our clients make better decisions, provide better services to their constituents, and provide a basis for stronger economic growth. This is a technical role but also requires a diverse range of consultative and project management skills. The primary focus of this role is to collaborate internally with an amazing group of Project Managers and externally with equally amazing clients to design and implement data ingress strategies that support client solutions. As a technical expert and client advocate, you lead effective implementations in order to architect, enable, deliver, and support data-enabling enterprise solutions for governments, driving high levels of strategic solutions and detailed data governance for product adoption.Work with our transformative data solutions that help agencies address mission-critical outcomes. Our cloud-based data platform, open data solutions, and performance management solutions help agencies improve performance, transparency, and public engagement.LocationSeattle, managing client expectations regarding scope of work, technical expertise required for maintenance, quality, risks, budget, and outcomesDeliver quality documentation including technical governance plans, data playbooks, design documents, and test plansLead clients in a consultative role by translating qualitative needs into robust technical solutionsCommunicate technical needs to a Azure, or Esri is helpfulExperience coaching users of varying skill levels in data science is helpfulAbout UsTyler Technologies (NYSE: TYL) provides integrated software and technology services to the public sector. Tyler’s end-to-end solutions empower local, state, and federal government entities to operate more efficiently and connect more transparently with their constituents and with each other. By connecting data and processes across disparate systems, Tyler’s solutions are transforming how clients gain actionable insights that solve problems in their communities. Tyler has more than 26,000 successful installations across more than 10,000 sites, with clients in all 50 states, Canada, the Caribbean, Australia, and other international locations. A financially strong company, Tyler has achieved double-digit revenue growth every quarter since 2012. It was also named to Forbes’ “Best Midsize Employers” list in 2019 and recognized twice on its “Most Innovative Growth Companies” list. Customer Trust & Partner Support (CTPS) is responsible for creating a trustworthy shopping experience across Amazon stores worldwide by protecting Customers, Brands, Selling Partners and Amazon from fraud, counterfeit, and abuse as well as empowering, providing worldclass support, and building loyalty with Amazons millions of selling partners. We value individual expression, respect different opinions, and work together to create a culture where each of us is able to contribute fully. Our unique backgrounds and perspectives strengthen our ability to achieve Amazon's mission of being Earth's most customer-centric company.As a team within CTPS, Partner Solutions & Support (PSAS), strives to make Amazon the best way for Selling Partners to reach customers locally and globally and to operate their businesses, driven by the accurate and efficient support and solutions we provide them. PSAS focuses on both preventing Selling Partner (Seller, Vendor and Brand Registry) contacts through preventing issues based on knowledge obtained during our support interactions, and for handling those contacts with quality and efficiency. To achieve this vision, we invest in technology to eliminate the root cause defects that cause Selling Partners to seek help, build self-service tools to resolve their issues on their own without waiting for help from Amazon, and provide Associates with the tools that automate routine steps and help them deliver consistent, efficient, quality resolution, Our team includes product managers, program managers, SDEs, scientists, and a range of operational and other specialty roles, and we operate at scale with over 17K Amazonians in our team, spanning 50+ global locations, and handling over 50M contacts a yearAre you data savvy, business focused, with a desire to use your analytical prowess to help others understand Seller needs and drive change through rigorous data analysis? We are looking for a Business Analyst to join the PSAS Science and Analytics team. The successful candidate will be highly analytical, an expert with SQL and Excel, experienced with significance testing and A/B experimentation, resourceful, customer-focused, strategic-thinking, and have an ability to work independently under time constraints to meet deadlines.In this role you will:· Be an important member of a team that improves the experience of selling on Amazon by eliminating defects, proactively identifying and resolving selling issues, and discovering seller insights.· Define the vision for analytical approach, reporting strategy, and new metrics for cross-organizational initiatives.· Proactively identify, analyze, and solve business problems with focus on understanding root causes and discovering significant forward-looking opportunities.· Dive deep into Amazons data to reveal trends, support machine-learning based automation, perform cohort analysis, and design experiments to test hypotheses and quantify impacts.· Work closely with Product Managers, Software Development Engineers, Technical Product Managers, Data Engineers, Process Engineers, and senior management to define and build reporting and analytic solutions that allow us to make data-based product and business decisions that make it easier to sell on Amazon.· Enable effective decision making by retrieving and aggregating from multiple of Amazons largest data sources and compiling it into a digestible and actionable format.· Create and maintain tools, reports, and analyses which support senior leadership and various teams throughout the organization.Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us .Basic Qualifications· BS/BA in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, quantitative Social Sciences or related field· Experience with A/B testing and statistical significance testing.· Experience writing SQL queries· Advanced technical and modeling skills including Excel skills (pivot, vlookup, etc.) and data analytics· Experience using data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases· Ability to translate complex analysis into actionable recommendationsPreferred Qualifications· Advanced degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, quantitative Social Sciences or related field· Advanced analytical and quantitative skills with demonstrated ability in using data and metrics to identify root causes· Proficiency in a statistical software such as R, Stata, SAS, SPSS, or Minitab· Experience with predictive analytics, data mining, and data visualization· Experience with survey research· Experience working with wide variety of business data sources

Position Summary:Bedrock's IT Manufacturing/MRP Business Analyst is responsible to review, analyze, and evaluate business processes and organizational needs. To gather and document business requirements, define scope and objectives, and identify system modifications needed to support these business requirements and initiatives. This position will follow defined departmental standards, and help define new ones as appropriate, as well as advise and transfer knowledge end users.

A successful candidate will need to interact directly with business owners and business users, as well as other functional Business Analysts, Project Managers, and Support staff.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Analyze, and document existing business processes and Standard Operating Procedures (SOP).
Work directly with internal customers to identify and develop new business processes, process improvements, and system modifications.
Identify and gather business requirements, using use cases, data modeling, process modeling, context diagrams, systems diagrams, etc.
Develop functional specifications for system modifications.
Develop Test Cases and Test Plans.
Responsible to test system changes within specified functional areas, and regression testing.
Modify existing Dynamics AX configurations to meet business needs.
Maintain an expertise within the appropriate Dynamics AX functional area and configuration.
Provide end-user support for Dynamics AX, using current internal support processes and tools.
Create and manage support tickets and coordinate support activities as needed.
Provide end user training.

Skills and Qualifications:



Two-year college degree required or applicable trade school, or equivalent working experience.
Four-year college degree preferred.
3+ years Dynamics AX for Manufacturing and MRP experience.
3+ years experience working with core manufacturing business processes (Shop Floor Controls, Material and Resource Planning/Scheduling, Production Routing, Bill of Material Costing, and Warehouse Management)
3+ years experience in business system analysis and business process improvement.
Experience writing functional requirements specification for Dynamics AX 2012.
Experience with Dynamics AX 2012 implementations and configurations.
Excellent communication, both verbal and written.
Strong requirements gathering skills (interviewing business owners and operational users).
Excellent project management and organizational skills.
